Reviews.Title: “Watch out for additional fees”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole in Dallas, TX for a friend's wedding. This was my first time in Dallas and I was excited for the weekend. When it was time to check out I checked my bill and they had charged me for minibar snacks that I had not consumed. I had not touched my minibar! I contacted the front desk and they made the appropriate changes. When I got home, I checked my bank account to make sure they had not charged me. I was shocked to find that I was charged $17 a day to park at the hotel during my visit! During my stay, I was told by the attendant that parking was free since I was attending the wedding but, when I called the hotel I was informed that it was only free during the day of the wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Rich & Vibrant Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Tootie84
Reviews.Content: This was a very classy hotel with rich and vibrant feel. Loved media sports bar. Rooms were a tad dark, but other than that, I had no problems at all with the hotel or the staff. Self-parking was possible which was nice, and it wasn't a far walk at all to get to the elevators. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge place with lots to do”
Reviews.Author: GaDawg44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Rooms were comfortableand staff was very helpful. Not a lot fo choices for food, but there are a lot od restaurants near by. This is a good place to use as a "home base" when visiting Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: TDvorak
Reviews.Content: I took 4 students to the Hilton Anatole this past weekend. Rooms were roomy and very comfortable. Amenities and hotel were excellent. Kalith and Dolores in the Terrace Restaurant were excellent. Going above and beyond to assist me and my students. One of my students forgot to pack a server apron and Dolores let us borrow the apron off of her back! Such great service. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing art display!”
Reviews.Author: CathyK76837
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel as a judge for a high school competition and was amazed at the numerous art displays throughout the expansive facility! It is located just off I35 near the Market & medical facilities. Ate at the hotel restaurant - delightful staff and delicious food! Would definitely staff again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cristy A
Reviews.Content: My Room was big but it looked like a conference room with a bed. It smelled old and musty. The in room coffee was terrible. The blow dryer weak. There were two big events that made getting an elevator impossible. On the good side the staff at the Media Bar "Shawn" were very friendly and the food was good. They had a Sushi Bar in another part of the hotel. All in all the staff were all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Service received at the Media Bar and Grill”
Reviews.Author: Esco074
Reviews.Content: While at staying at the hotel on April 6, 2012 my frineds and I dined at the Media Bar and Grill. Sean was our waiter. The service he provide to our group was exceptional. He was very polite and personable going over and beyound to make our experience pleasant and enjoyable. This type of service is very rare in today's soceity. Thanks you Sean for the wonderful service you and the entire Hilton Anatole staff provide.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: James J
Reviews.Content: The people who work here really don't know what is going on. I ask one person about my reservation she told me one thing said i have to speak to the assistant manager, who didn't know anything about the conversation so i asked the question to him and he had a different answer too. Then I was not at the hotel and was told by a young lady at the front desk that i could make another reservation then when i got back was told i could not. Beds were not comfortable it was clean and maintenance was great but the office personnel should def be retrained on guild lines and policies. Will not return! My son plays for the cowboys so we spend money on hotels to visit and will not bring another dime from me or my friends to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not unless you're at a meeting!”
Reviews.Author: Jack H
Reviews.Content: This mammoth 1,606 hotel has only ONE place to have lunch or dinner, the noisy Media Bar, unless you count the sushi bar or the Nana on the 27th floor, which is limping to a June closing. Nana has downsized the menu, but not the prices. My $42. a la carte beef filet tasted like it had a vinegar marinade. The view is still awesome, however, and they say they will reopen in October as a steakhouse (hopefully, without the sour marinade ruining the taste). The tower is a little remote from the two atriums, but worth the extra cost because of the newer, nicer rooms. The corner rooms are about 1/3 larger, but avoid west exposure if the weather's hot. The executive lounge on the 25 floor is nothing special as hotel lounges go, except for the view of the Dallas skyline a couple of milles away. The staff is very nice, but can only shrug and say they're sorry for the $26. a night parking when the hotel is on 45 acres. The outdoor pool is 200 yards away and the spa almost that far. This one is strickly for the convention trade.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a Hotel Gets it Right”
Reviews.Author: edra45
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and lately have found even the expensive hotels lacking. But the Anatole was the exception. It was clean, spacious, elegant, and very relaxing. I ran in the sculpture garden and went shopping in the dress shop downstairs in my spare time. The hotel's location was perfect for all my appointments, and an easy drive to resturants and entertainment, but if the weather is bad, there are wonderful resturants and bars inside the hotel. The staff was friendly and professional, going out of their way to be helpful. I will be staying here on my next trip to Big D.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a Princess”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMBrooks
Reviews.Content: When you walk in the doors of the Anatole you immediately feel welcomed from the the door men to the people at the counters to the house keepers who managed my room during my stay. The hotel is huge with such beautiful artwork and very appeal decor. The activities that are in the hotel are usually large events and the housekeeping is always top of the line and well run. My hotel room was spotless - I did not fine one complaint the bathroom was amazing and the beds slept so good with 5 pillows on the bed. The view out my window drew my attention several times in my stay to just stand and enjoy. The grounds at the hotel are amazingly manicured and clean. I will be coming back to the hotel in October and I already can not wait because of the service that I know will be waiting for me when i get here.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what to think”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan051986
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very helpful and professional. The rooms are clean and large. Still, there is something about this property that is a bit off-putting. Perhaps this is because it is so large. I was here for a conference, but I do not think I would come here for personal reasons. It is not close to downtown Dallas and it is overrun by conference goers.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnk317
Reviews.Content: Massive hotel, ideal for business conferences. Great rooms in terms of size and decoration and wonderful bathrooms. Beautiful grounds, pools and gym. great overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good but massive hotel, lots of little costs”
Reviews.Author: vangorcp
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Anatole for a business trip. The hotel is HUGE, it can take 10 minutes to walk from one side to the other. We had a problem with the AC in our tower room. Engineering attempted 3 times to fix but the temp would not go below 70 deg. We worked with the Front desk staff and they moved us to another room on the same floor. Our conference got us discounted Internet and parking but still it is high. Why do the nicer hotels charge you for something the lower quality hotels provide for free? We used the concierge for dinner recommendations and was pleased. Food on-site is very expensive. At one time parking was really scarce during the middle of the day. Hunted for over 5 minutes to find a parking spot. Area is fair, doesn't look the best but we felt safe. Was a 5-10 min drive to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Business at an Elegant Property”
Reviews.Author: Gypsyrose101
Reviews.Content: In Dallas last week for business. Hotel is a 25 minute drive from DFW. Hilton Anatole is a large elegant property. Rooms are spacious, quiet decorated with a modern tasteful Asian influence. Has several restaurants, stores and a business center. Offers array of services, a quality relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business trips”
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. If you book here request the towers which were recently renovated; the gym is great. The grounds are excellent for walking; the Media Bar & Grill is tasty and if you are a Hilton Honors member you can enjoy a free breakfast and afternoon snacks. The staff is friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Art Collection”
Reviews.Author: ElmhurstEBS
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for a convention last week at the Hilton Anatole. It had been several years since I had visited this hotel and I was very supprised to see the beautiful asian art collection that is in every corner of this huge hotel. Worth a visit alone. Hilton has really upgraded the facility!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but best hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: horhey1215
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel with thousands of rooms and a gorgeous atrium. Biggest collection of oriental art in a US hotel. Almost in downtown Dallas. 4 restaurants to choose from, all are good. Excellent beds. Friendly staff. Great place to visit if you can drop the cash. Parking expensive, too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RGCertified
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Anatole for 4 days to attend conference and found the staff very helpful. It is a very big hotel and maintained very well. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Shawn at Media Bar and Grill”
Reviews.Author: Mimi C
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take a moment to thank Shawn and the rest of the staff at Media Bar & Grill for exceptional service and close attention to detail. Shawn went above and beyone to make sure our team was taken care of. We had a really great evening of team building and great memories and Shawn made it even better with delighting us with his care. Thanks! Mimi G. Czako

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dunlewey
Reviews.Content: Recently had a conference in this hotel. I will say it is stunning inside and the rooms are lovely but...the prices are shocking. First of all - it is a super shuttle ride from either airport of $17OW and another cab ride to get downtown to anything exciting. The rooms did not have a usable fridge which is annoying and the room-provided coffee was down right horrendous. I think that ploy was to steer you downstairs where 2 cups of fancy coffee and a cookie set me back $15. Ordering 2 glasses of chardonnay on the 27th floor was a cool $40! Wow. I always know conference places are high but this was out of control. The Media bar was a nice venue, the beer flights were reasonably priced at $10. I have been struggling with loyalty between Hilton and Marriott for my United points but I am thinking Marriott is starting to win the battle. I understand profit but price gouging when there is nothing within walking distance is downright annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Eddie Van Derdys - The man!”
Reviews.Author: rick B
Reviews.Content: If you have ever arrived in a new city and not sure how to find where to purchase that special gift for someone, you know the importance of a friendly and informative Concierge. This hotel is an excellent palce to stay, additional to the many aspects: service , food, good standard of rooms. This concierge is one of the best I have ever met throughout my 20 years of buisness trip. He was able to find where to purchase my wifes' gift at the nearest location considering my situation. His friendly smile says it all ! He's the man you need to know in a situation like this!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful inside”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTLC
Reviews.Content: I satyed here for a conference in March 2012 and was very impressed with how large the hotel was. There aren't that many restaurants to choose from, but the ones that are there, has great food! However, the food served in the ballrooms and/or halls was not impressive. I stayed in a atrium room and was not impressed. They are old and I could hear my neighbor's alarm and people chatting outside my door. The rooms in the tower seem newer and MUCH nicer! Hotel also does not have a free shuttle to/from DFW airport, which is surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice, but the area is depreciating”
Reviews.Author: ss309556
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice, but the area around it is getting a lot of empty / for sale signs in the businesses. The Service was excellent, but the upgraded room was a murphy bed, which sort of surprised me. it was an awesome view being in a corner room,(half of a suite I think). but the murphy bed was just different, comfortable but very low. The Anatole is made for business meetings and is well spread out, so after 3 days of a conference,some of the women were visibly hurting in their heels, so plan on appropriate footwear.

Reviews.Title: “Good for conference/stay...but wouldn't stay again for personal travel”
Reviews.Author: Zandemom
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous reviewers: *Main areas of hotel are quite lovely, nice decor, beautifully done. The facility over all is huge and all main areas were very well maintained, pleasant. *Rooms in the atrium building were very small; bathrooms were extremely small (had to stand to the side of the toilet to shut the door...kind of like in a bathroom stall.) And worst of all...the connecting rooms (which I was told were in the majority of atrium rooms) had zero sound barriers. For three days, morning and night, it was as if I had the door open, with every little sound that I could hear of my hotel neighbor. Additionally, even though I was on the 12th floor...I could hear nearly every "clank" and glassware/plate cart being pushed across the first floor (open atrium) breakfast/luncheon area. *When I first arrived, the room I was assigned was "half" cleaned. Trash can had alcohol containers, some trash on floor. They did move me. The "phone" access to customer relations was much better than the limited staff at the check-in desk. *Like others mentioned...be prepared to walk. My room was in the atrium...my conference was on the other side of this expanisve facility. *Restaurants are actually limited...and unless you plan to take a taxi...not much selection. No casual cafe type options. Nothing in walking distance. *Conference provision were nice and well tended to by hotel staff. *Valet staff had to be approached for assistance...they never voluntarily approached to assist. The two times I approached the concierge desk...they were talking casually with co-workers and acted annoyed with my simple questions. This was probably the weakest of customer service staff throughout the hotel, though it should have been the best. *Had multiple issues with TV/satellite. Had technician come to assist the first evening, but then gave up.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place for a meeting not a vacation”
Reviews.Author: rszAtlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: I attended a business meeting at the Anatole and was very impressed with the professional attitude and efficiency of the staff that worked very hard to make sure that the meeting came off without a problem The banquet rooms were very well laid out and all of my requests were handled quickly and with a can do attitude. Staff were very professional and friendly. The public rooms in the hotel are imminence and beautiful. The hotel has a bounty of restaurants and bars but as with any business hotel very pricey. The work out center is very large and is really a full scale spa facility with both indoor and outdoor pools, tennis courts, gym,basketball courts and a professional staff for instructions. They also have a complete spa with all of the expected amenities for a luxury facility. The cost for usage of the gym is included for Hilton Honor members, The guest rooms are very small and the bathrooms are tiny. I could not get into the shower without closing the door. There is no turn down service that would be expected at an upscale Hilton property. The other major issue that I have with this hotel is the lack of staff assigned to the front desk. My key would fail at least once a day and to get a new one I would spend at least ten minutes in line waiting for someone to check in, They never had more than two staff members at the front desk even during the evening check in rush. This is a very good meeting hotel it is not for families or tourists the location of the Anatole is very isolated. There are no shopping or restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. This not where you want to stay to visit as a tourist in Dallas unless you are willing to drive everywhere or take cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Everything's bigger in Texas”
Reviews.Author: Vicki A
Reviews.Content: Recently there for a meeting with several hundred people. The Anatole is well-equipped for large meetings with several ballroom and numerous meeting rooms in various sections/wings. Rue the day that you are staying in the Atrium section, with your meeting in Coronado, and you want to wear you're cute shoes -- just wear your walking shoes. Nothing against the Anatole personally, it's just the curse of any large conference center. Hotel buffet meals and seated dinners were just ok - have had worse but certainly have had better. The Tower rooms have been updated and were spacious and very nice. Even with the large group the tower elevators always came quickly. The atrium rooms were not as recently updated. The atrium rooms were noisy, especially early morning when breakfast was set up in the open common lobby. The Tower concierge lounge was spacious with a working computer and printer. Breakfast in the concierge lounge was continental only, no hot offerings unless you count hot water for instant oatmeal. The hotel is located near the Parkland Hospital medical complex (across the highway and down a probably less than a mile).

Reviews.Title: “OK for Company Conference - Not Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: mmahoney
Reviews.Content: I was here for business. This hotel did a nice job accommodating my company's conference. Food and service was fine. But since most rooms face an atrium style core, where all the shops and restaurants are housed, it makes for a really noisy night. I would not want to stay here for leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “compliment”
Reviews.Author: jamaica1forney
Reviews.Content: I recently visisted the Hilton for a night out with friends this might have been my 5th visit as a guest but visited there on other ocasions to see the beauty of the hotel. The service was great and the staff was helpful and polite. Shawn Leslie who worked in the bar area as a server was remarkable. He was very friendly and was extremely knowledgeable of the hotel and the services the hotels offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: Matt T
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Tower, room very clean and roomy. Shower nice a big with great pressure. Hotel is very clean and also very large. While I did not try the restaurants, the bars had good wine selections and the staff was very attentive. I stayed during a conference and food catered for the conference by the hotel was great. The rest of the staff was very helpful finding local businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but kind of expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Deepstops
Reviews.Content: I come here every February for my company's national service meeting. It's a beautiful property but everything is expensive. $20 for self parking, $15 for Internet, the ground floor restaurants are pricey, a can of diet coke from the minibar was $5.50, and two rum & cokes were $23...... That said, the rooms are nice with great beds. Nana's on the top floor is very good. But I'm still glad I'm not paying the bill. Great hotel but IMO the value isn't there.

Reviews.Title: “Large but accomodating”
Reviews.Author: ljgok
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the tower in one of the large corner rooms and it was very spacious and comfortable with both sofa and club chair as well as a desk chair for working. Entire hotel was exceptionally clean and well maintained. The bath rooms were obsviously designed in a past era but have been tastefully redone for their small size. We had dinner at the upscale restaurant, Nana and were quite pleased. The executive lounge was nicely decorated but breakfast offerings are minimal continental and the chardonnay pour for $7.50 is the same stuff they pour for free at the Embassy Suites down the street, at least should be upgraded to Bogle or Beringer for that price, the per bottle profit will still be three times the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1000Islands
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton Anatole made for a successful trip to the Dallas Market. I was fortunate to get a very attractive car/hotel package rate for the property during the January market week. Located just across the freeway from the Market, with quick and regular shuttle service during shows the Hilton was very convenient. The public spaces and room were definately up to Hilton standards. Our room was clean and well appointed with a comfortable bed. We found a burnt out bulb in the bathroom when we arrived and the TV reception was quirky. I only mention this because of the Anatole's response - both problems were fixed within a few minutes of calls to the desk. Another plus was the campus-like layout of the hotel. Having listened to the distant bass beat of too many wedding bands in poorly planned hotels, I was nervous when a large evening affair arrived in the hotel's meeting rooms the second night of our stay. But, no noise filtered up to our room. The mix of restaurants and bars on site proved to be just what we needed. The food and service at the Media Grill was very good. The real trip-saver was the Hilton's Counter Offer take out restaurant. It let us grab a quick coffee and breakfast on our way to the show without wasting much time or money - very refreshing to see a full service hotel offer a food choice that doesn't overcharge for convenience. My only nit is one common to many full service properties - the hotel charges a substantial fee for basic in-room Internet connection. Worse, I couldn't even find a common wifi connection in the lobby areas. Unless you rely on your smart phone or personal hot spot, count on paying up for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel dwcorated with amazing Asian art”
Reviews.Author: RuthyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotels I have stayed in.The setting is gorgeous, the family that owns the property (which is managed by Hilton) has one of the most extensive Asian art collections in the world, and throughout the hotel there are magnificent pieces. The enormous quantity of displays is mind blowing. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, and the service is excellent. There are several restaurants in the hotel, I visited two and enjoyed both.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cspear
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conventions and overall it is a typical convention hotel. Fitness center is above average and rooms were adequate. Plenty of meeting space and food was actually pretty good for banquet and large group buffet presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Aesthetically beautiful, but really falling apart!”
Reviews.Author: jlfaa
Reviews.Content: I had once stayed here in 1988 under the name of the Lowes Anatole, the hotel has grown to a massive size and is absolutely beautiful. I had quite a few unfortunate experiences and other guests that were also staying in the hotel were amazed at how disorganized and falling apart this hotel was. The front desk at the "Tower" side had a very large problem of communication. I paid for a King Size bed in a No Smoking room and was given a room with two doubles, when I told the girl at the front desk she told me that the rooms were not assigned by her and that all Kings were full. The next morning after taking a shower, the water would not turn off. No matter how hard I tried the water was still pouring out. I told the girl at the front desk before I left and asked her to get maintenance up to my room as water was still running from the shower. She said she would, I left to continue my day. When I cam back 5 hours later, I checked in with the new front desk clerk to see if the shower had been fixed. He called maintenance and they told him that a ticket had NEVER been made up and that they would do that right now. I went to my room changed my clothes and then had to leave two hours later, never did maintenance show up while I was in my room. I then left again and asked the same desk clerk to have my room cleaned and make sure the shower was fixed by the time I got back, which would be an hour or so. He said he woul. When I returned 2 hours later I purposely checked with the new front desk clerk to see if the shower had been fixed. She stood on hold with maintenance for 5 minutes she said they had not fixed it. I was shocked that a Hotel of this magnitude could let something like this go without any second thought at all. I went up to the room and found maintenance in the bathroom staring at the faucet asking what is wrong. He asked, "whats wrong" I said turn on the water then try to turn it off. He turned on the water and it shot everywhere now. I walked back into the suite area of the room and there was still dirty dishes and the room had not been cleaned. I immediately went down stairs and told the front desk I wanted a new room, that was a King as my feet were hanging off the double bed, and I wanted it done immediately. She did not hesitate to find a new room for me. When I got to the new room, the Television was broken. Overall this hotel is OK, at best. The Media restraunt food is fair, the counter offer sushi bar, is excellent (sushi), but prices at they always are at hotels are above average. The hotel is large and provides many banquet and meeting rooms for conventions, symposiums, business. The employees on average are very nice. Just not sure there are other hotels in the area that wouldn't provide much better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “A very welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: WDUK
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Texas and the hotel staff certainly uphold the State's reputation for southern hospitality. The staff is friendly and service surprisingly good for a hotel of this size. The Anatole was also the host hotel for a convention I attended so it was very busy during my stay. Saying that, the location is not the most convenient if you are visiting the convention center or downtown area. The rooms are at normal Hilton standard - clean and equipped with all the basics. The internet speed was not too bad however it did drop out a couple of times during my stay. Technical support were very quick to resolve the issue so it didn't affect my ability to work. The fitness center is quite big with a comprehensive selection of equipment. They also have group exercise classes, personal trainers and a spa. I recommend staying in the Tower part of the hotel, rather than the Atrium, especially during the busy times. I stayed at the far end of the Atrium on a higher floor and could still hear people at the Media Bar during the early hours. The Executive Lounge is also located in the Tower, and I would have used it more if I was staying on that side of the hotel. I ate at the Media Bar 3 times and ordered room service once. The food was hit and miss, but the service excellent.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: venturagirls2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very very nice. Housekeeping staff was so helpful and went out of there way to make sure my stay was wonderful. I'm alergic to polyester sheets and they went out and purchased a set to have on the bed when I arrived...WOW what service. I would stay here again when I'm in Dallas. My only complaint is the convenient store in the hotel closes to early and there is no place to get something if you need it during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great....”
Reviews.Author: sophiegirl04
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with much to recommend. All food I had (most were corporate event meals) was above average..and where I actually ordered food at a bar or restaurant, it was excellent, The room was large, spotless, and housekeeping provided excellent service each day, with free in room coffee, but Internet is not free unless you are a Hilton Honors Member (Gold or above) or your group has negotiated a special rate. I had several problems during my stay - was charged for Internet which was supposed to be free, room type selected at time of reservation was not provided, etc. Nothing truly major, but annoyances that should be avoidable. What now annoys me is that the promised resolution was never forthcoming, which I think is far, far worse than the original errors. If you promise something...FOLLOW THROUGH. I think this is a good hotel- with a little attention, could be great. I would stay here again, and do recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: randallsvtc
Reviews.Content: We try to stay in downtown area when traveling since we own a small renovated motor court in rural West Texas. The Anatole is a beautiful, well designed facility that offers a great variety of fine dinning, relaxing, and great meeting space! We had a King Studio for two nights and it was perfect. Didn't really care that I-net was high, as we really didn't want to use it anyway. We were at market and didn't need the communication link. We have a cell for that. We had a glitch when checking in, as we were double charged incidentals that did not meet our actual room charges. We had to call our bank. The clerk was not aware they could handle that on their end.Best way around that is to not charge to room. Amenities were great and we didn't need the wet bar in the room with so many options on the ground floor. I was even able to purchase a cigar and find a quite place to enjoy it and a drink, outside of course. Our final evening was on the 27th floor at the Nana. Our waiter and his staff were 5-star! So was the food! It was an historic time for our entire party! I highly recommend the Hilton when looking at downtown.

Reviews.Title: “media bar”
Reviews.Author: Owleyes T
Reviews.Content: Awesome service in media bar all the time when we come... Thank you Shawn!

Reviews.Title: “The Place for Meeting Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Eve O
Reviews.Content: I had dined at the Anatole before and I've been addicted to the V Spa there for about 2 years. I'm also a member of the fitness club The Verandah which is classy and massive but I had never stayed at the Hilton Anatole. In December it was time for my very first corporate meeting for my company and I was nervous. I had never planned full day catering and meeting rooms before so basically I said "HELP" to the Anatole and asked them to choose everything. Thank goodness these guys are such pros. Our meeting room was unbelievably spacious. Every morning we were greeted with hot coffee, crusty pastries and more and snacks were delivered like clockwork after lunch. We loved our lunch at Counter Offer (especially the cupcakes) and Media always has a Crab and Mango salad I go nuts for. Yes, the food and the rooms were great but the difference was in the service of the people. Ava in Catering checked in on us several times a day and made sure we had whatever our hearts desired. My suite was huge and beautiful and the perfect place to rest after the big Christmas party. For a newbie to having a corporate meeting like me, the Hilton Anatole was a dream and I don't think I'll be holding our yearly meetings anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A home office away from home!”
Reviews.Author: DFWGirl88
Reviews.Content: In December 2011, I attended a work staff meeting for two days and spent one night at the Hilton Anatole. In addition, I had an opportunity to enjoy a visit to the V Spa. It was delightful from beginning to end. From the moment of arrival with the valet staff to the staff at the V Spa, you are consistently attentive and genuinely friendly. Throughout the hotel, the Asian artwork is amazing, as was the beautiful Christmas decorations. You feel as if you are visiting a museum during your journey to your room. And the subtle nods to Asian themes in the bathroom decor is a nice touch. As with any Hilton property, the beds are amazing and you certainly do not want to leave your bed. But alas, work calls and one of my favorite features in my room was the work area. I actually took a photo because the comfort and simplicity feels just like I would like my home office to someday reflect. I highly recommend the Hilton Anatole for a staff retreat. The meeting rooms are comfortable with all of the amenities needed for a successful meeting. The food service within the meeting rooms from the beautiful breakfast spread to the snacks are great. Your team will enjoy the variety of restaurants on-site, making each meal a totally different experience. I look forward to returning for a stayaction in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosalyn E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a company meeting and then party. Had a blast. The staff at the Hilton Anatole treated us like royalty during our meetings, by rolling in snack/beverage trays every hour, checking in to make sure we were fine, etc. Everyone was so nice to us. The hotel itself is beautiful, has a nice modern asian chic decor. Would definitely love to come back with friends/family

Reviews.Title: “Abandon Sleep all ye who enter”
Reviews.Author: HavanaBob
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine, Everything you would expect from a Hilton. Clean, spacious, comfortable. The main problem is, the housekeeping staff beging yelling in the hallways and slamming doors repeatedly often well before 8am, even on Sundays. This place isn't withing reasonable walking distance of anything, so you'll want to bring a car ( $17.00 / day ). If you're attending a conference in the hotel, then it is very convenient and you won't miss your meetings because the staff certainly won't let you oversleep. If you are coming to Dallas for any other reason, pick another place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for attending Dallas Market Center”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property while visiting the Dallas Market Center. This property is large and public spaces are well designed and decorated. The food served at the on-site restaurants is very well prepared and affordable for this quality as expected. The room is furnished nicely and is clean and comfortable. Felt safe during stay. I didn't have a car to park, but shuttle service during market was readily available and made commuting a breeze. Overall a very nice hotel and I'd make this my choice in future market trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: El_Yeah
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the Atrium side, was the older of the two towers but nice. Pros: Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location, nice artwork, nice view, good restaurant Cons: cold indoor pool, expensive self parking $17 yikes

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a family”
Reviews.Author: Suntra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice this year, for more than four days each time. The rooms were very clean and our experience were overall enjoyable. The hotel has plenty to offer and was very family friendly. The Asian art antiques were a pleasure to watch and I spent a great deal of time looking over those. They do have an Replica of a very famous god/goddess statue depicting the wedding of Shiva and Parvati, but unfortunately it is at the entrance of a restroom. Quite a disgrace to the ancient culture and their respected faith.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Cotton Bowl”
Reviews.Author: davab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a corner suite in the Tower on the 24th floor. The room was very large. We had a nice view and the suite was very clean. This is an extremely large hotel. My brother and sister-in-law stayed in the Atrium side and it was a long walk between the Atrium and the Tower. We were there for the Cotton Bowl and there were a ton of Razorback fans there. This is a good hotel for something like that. Overall, I would stay here again and hopefully will, if the Razorbacks go to the Cotton Bowl again soon. The executive lounge on the 25th floor is very nice and has complimentary continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Club Nana has the best singer: W. T. Greer!”
Reviews.Author: Cathyhd
Reviews.Content: We went to see W. T. Greer sing for New Years Eve in the club next to Nana's restaurant. Love, love, love his sound! Check him out on Fri-Sat nights.. The club has two window walls that looks down on the two best views of downtown Dallas' lights. The service was spot on and friendly. We stayed overnight so we didn't have to count drinks. Nice, modern, BUT they had two double beds (instead of Queens).

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel - parking fee not so much”
Reviews.Author: TexasStarshine
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I ran across an attractive online rate for a one-night stay at the Anatole and found everything about the hotel to be top-notch. The Asian decor theme was soothing, exotic and very tasteful. The large open spaces lend well to conventions. The Media Bar was much more enjoyable than the usual sports bar -- lots of tv screens around the room, but the noise level was still conducive to carrying on conversation at normal speech levels. Our room was an interior room with a window opening onto an interior corridor instead of outside -- very nicely decorated and everything in excellent condition. We were a little surprised that self-parking in an open parking lot was $18 for the night -- seemed excessive for the experience of finding bird poop on the car the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly Upgraded!”
Reviews.Author: kempro
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Anatole annually for approximately 16 years. I missed the past two years because of conflicts and returned in early January 2012. I was very much impressed with the upgrades which occurred since my last visit. I was especially pleased with the Atrium amenities including the Media Grill and Bar. This up to date chic meeting place replaced the old disco which had been outdated for years. The food, beverages, and service were excellent! I was especially impressed by the new sculpture hanging in the atrium. I took the time at second glance to notice the light changes and subtle movements. It was quite beautiful and relaxing. The view from Nana's bar can't be beat and the musical entertainment was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Made my New Year's Eve spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Craig S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to book the Anatole for our New Year's Eve celebration. Though we have "staycationed" at numerous Dallas hotels, we never stayed at the Anatole because we thought it was a little pricey but decided to splurge since it was New Year's. We got a room in Atrium II and while it was noisy, from quite a few kids with their parents, you couldn't hear it in the room itself. We had an awesome view of downtown, by chance, and got to watch the fireworks at Victory Park at midnight, from the comfort of our room. Although we did have an excellent stay, I do have a couple of complaints. First, we thought it was ridiculous that we would have to pay for internet access given the cost of the room. Thank goodness for 4G access on our phones. Second, I thought the bed was rather firm for my tastes but my wife said she slept fine. Other than that, there is plenty to do at this hotel. The Media Bar and Grill was super fun! The breakfast at The Terrace was interesting as they have some unusual but good dishes. The coffee is outstanding! We also dined at Nana for our anniversary nine months earlier and was superb with a fantastic view of downtown. Just be sure to request a table nearest to the window when you make your reservation to get the best view possible. We would stay here again for very special occasions but not as a general rule. It's just outside what we like to pay for a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: jazzyjohnny
Reviews.Content: Decided to book a room for the New Year weekend to be closer to the downtown area, BIG MISTAKE! The hotel was booked solid with the college crowd in for the big Cotton Bowl game. I was booked in the Tower and should have stayed in the Atrium as it seemed a lot more quite and subdued. Both nights, Fri and Sat were noisy, lots of yelling and partying going on, wasn't able to get any sleep. Also, to use the fitness center it cost $26 a day! I wasn't going to pay that price just to use the treadmill. The hotel is nice, but to big, you have to walk a long distance to the restaruants. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility”
Reviews.Author: AmarilloByMorning
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Anatole many times over the past 30 years, usually with complete satisfaction. On this stay, however, we had an ongoing difficulty with a beautiful glass-walled shower that simply did not drain. We called for service 3 times, to no avail. Otherwise, we were pleased with our stay. I think it's futile to continue to complain about exorbitant parking charges, but just in case someone cares, I will voice every guest's impotent outrage at a virtually empty parking facility that charges $9 for a 15 minute dash by the room.

Reviews.Title: “relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Denise T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel when the Mav played the Heat it was and awesome time, so when we came back this time the watier that waited on us last time remember us, I thought that was great. His name is Shawn Leslie great person, great watier he made us feel so welcome like we been knowing each other for a long time. We love the Anatole this hotel will be our home away from home. If you're in Dallas try the Anatole go to the Medic bar and don't forget to ask for shawn Leslie and please don't forget to try the restaurant on the 27th floor excellent.

Reviews.Title: “art enthusiasts... stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lwigger
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all, spacious rooms, luxurious spa, delicious food, and a stellar art collection. The Anatole has a very modern, open atrium area with a great art installation. It boasts a large private art collection that contains both historical and more modern pieces. I very much enjoyed my stay here, my favorite part was walking around to see the art and also eating at the restaurants. The food is AWESOME. I ate at Media Grill + Bar and had the crab melt.. the best meal ever. Also Counter Offer has alot to offer: delicious food. I was here on business, and the meeting room facilities were luxurious. Breakfast was served in our meeting room every morning and it was great. Staff were helpful, friendly, courteous, willing to go the extra mile. The spa treatments were DIVINE. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Chcaggie1
Reviews.Content: We live local but I wanted to do something special for my husbands birthday. We spent the weekend here and felt like we had taken a trip out of town! The decor is very nice and we spent alot of time taking in all of the artwork. We also enjoyed the japanese garden and feeding the color fish in the pond.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mix of Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: AngeloBenito
Reviews.Content: I came to the Hilton Anatole for our company's two-day end of year review meetings. I had heard good things about the Hilton from some of my coworkers and other friends but this would be my first time staying here. The rooms were perfectly set-up for our meeting as we had requested, they provided technical support when we had troubles with the projector and kept us sane with the ongoing snacks and drinks they would bring in throughout the day. Everyone was courteous and helpful, just what I would expect. Our lunch break was truly remarkable. On our first day we enjoyed the food that Counter Offer had to offer which for us was delicious steak, couscous, salad and an asparagus soup. For dessert they brought us 4 different kinds of cupcakes of which I had the pleasure of trying each. The atmosphere was very classy but somewhat relaxed which gave us a much needed break from all of the work we had been doing before. Being able to escape from work for a good hour was the boost we all needed to get through the rest of the day. Our hotel rooms were incredible. The rooms were very large and spacious, giving me a space to do my work and a separate one for me to relax in. The view was great and I could see all of downtown Dallas which was nice. Everything I could have wanted was in that hotel room and with the room service I'm not sure I would have had to leave if not for the business meetings. By far one of the nicest rooms I have had the pleasure of staying in across the United States. On the second day of our visit we had more people in the meeting and the staff adjusted the room accordingly to make more room for everyone which we thought was subtle but amazingly helpful once everyone showed up. They again brought in different drinks and snacks throughout the day while being very courteous of our meeting. Some of us hadn't even realized they had come in and out of the room to switch everything out. For lunch that day we went to Media Bar + Grill. The head chef came by and made a few suggestions for us, one of which was the hamburger, which was all the incentive I needed to order it. We had a room all to ourselves which was great so we could talk about work and other things without worrying about others hearing us. The staff again was super helpful and kind whenever we had questions or needed to change our orders. The food came out and was just as delicious as we had hoped. Everyone enjoyed their meals, we all shared to try different items ordered and everyone left with smiles on their faces. The rest of the meeting went well and after it was over I had time to visit a few of the shops and pick out a few Christmas gifts for my loved ones. I loved coming here for my business meeting but I expect to come back on my own next time I visit Dallas. I can't look forward to coming with my family to show them what a great time they can have in the Hilton Anatole in Dallas. One of the biggest things for me was truly the staff you guys have hired on, not for one second did I see anyone who wasn't treating us with the utmost respect and kindness. That for me is truly incredible that you've found staff who all treat their customers like royalty when they stay here. From valet, to the shops, to the restaurants and the general staff; everyone I met was very helpful and almost made me jealous of working there. I really look forward to coming back next time I visit Dallas for myself and hope next year's meeting is held there again, I know I'll be lobbying for it if anyone says otherwise. Thank you for the amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel stay was the best you could get out of a hotel in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: Andele3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was designed beautifully and still felt like home. I would defiantly recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Texas Sized Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Nut
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal at the Hilton Anatole using my HHonors points for one night. I was able to select a corner, exec floor room, which provided a comfortable seating area between the entry/bathroom area and the bed. This was definitely not your standard US Hilton fare, with a significant Asian theme including bronze Asian statutes, and lacquer finished closets and decorations in the room. The seating area included a couch, lounge chair and desk with working chair, all facing a flat panel TV that swiveled towards the bedroom area, allowing you to watch TV conveniently in the seating /working area, as well as the bed. The bathroom was very tastefully done, with a glass and tile shower, including bench. There was also a nicely built combo sink and vanity, with seating/make-up area which I'm sure my wife would have loved if she had been with me. The hotel is "Texas sized" with two separate wings, each with their own reception areas, and connected by a large concourse. Make sure you know which side you're staying in before parking or getting dropped off by the cab, otherwise it's a hike between the sides. For Hilton Honors Gold or Diamond members, you'll want to stay in the Tower side to take advantage of the nice Executive lounge on the 25th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bjcseven
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in Dallas at the Anatole while in town for business and came away very impressed. The hotel is very large as others have mentioned, but is perfect for holding large conferences. There were plenty of places to mingle and with the extra bars that were brought in there were plenty of options for grabbing a drink (or two). The rooms were large and well maintained. I had a room in the Atrium building, but also had co-workers who were in the Tower building. My room was spacious and clean, but my co-workers room in the Tower blew it out of the water. Seemed much newer and also had a large sitting area with an easy chair and a couch. The only thing that kept my review from excellent was the TV in my room. While it was a nice flat screen TV, there were many channels that were not coming in. I believe that they were using DirecTV (based on the advertisements), and I had numerous channels (ESPN chiefly among them) that never had a strong enough signal to come in to my room. This wasn't a huge deal as I only spent about 20 minutes at night in my room, but I could definitely understand that being an issue to others who were spending more time in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo501
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel already 3 times and every time I was surprised by the fact that this hotel absolutely does not remind you of being a Hilton property. The rooms are of generous size, clean and well maintained. And so are the bathrooms. The beds are really wide and comfortable. The hotel is big, with two separate buildings, connected by a walkway and a convention center. I guess everything IS bigger in Texas :) There are few restaurants on the property, with one of them being more on the â€œfancyâ€� side and so are the prices. Overall I believe this hotel represents a good valueâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Over and Beyond all Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo L
Reviews.Content: Being the host of a Lifestyle show I am use to experiencing excellence, but the Hilton Anatole has really raised the bar. Any and everything I could possibly want was at my fingertips; from the Health club and Spa to fabulous restaurants, lounges, shops and cafes. The grounds were amazing and there is no one who would not be impressed with the art collection that greets your every glance. I was there for 8 days and never once felt as if I needed to leave the hotel. You could really spend your whole trip there and leave with a smile. I would not be doing justice to this review if I did not mention the amazing staff, which was as diverse and friendly as any domestic or international traveler could wish for. I will always remember the friendly smile and incredible service of Shawn from the Media Bar and Lounge. My hat is off to you Hilton Anatole, you got it right! Lorenzo

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional again and again and again. Count on it!”
Reviews.Author: KOinDenver
Reviews.Content: Another Business trip to the Anatole.. making working and traveling so much more enjoyable. Everything form the cleanliness of the rooms - comfort of the bed - staff service - in-room dining - restaurants - spa - grounds - shopping .. I forget why I decided to rent a car from the airport.. I never had to leave the hotel in four days - and at the end of a big conference, and a lot of work, I came away rested and pampered. See you next year Anatole!

Reviews.Title: “Best walking trail ever”
Reviews.Author: Puppizoo4
Reviews.Content: When in Dallas on business, this is one of my favorite hotel stays. The location is just perfect for about anywhere you want to go in the city (or out). The rooms are very pretty. The staff is friendly. But probably my favorite part of the Hilton Anatole is the walking trail. It is one where you can feel safe yet have a gorgeous park-like atmosphere surrounding you. It even has a ilttle bridge and pond. So be sure to build in enough stay time to take a walk.

Reviews.Title: “good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleo13
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a convention. the service was good, the rooms were nice. Bathrooms were very nice, 2 sinks, marble counter. For a few extra dollars we stayed on an executive floor and had access to the executive lounge. It was definitely worth it, bottled water all day, breakfast, drinks, snacks, free internet access in lounge, etc.. The food in the restaurants was average. Also, very nice fitness center/spa. Overall was a good experience in a large convention hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Huge but nice”
Reviews.Author: FlorianNetherlands
Reviews.Content: As everybody else mentioned as well below: this hotel is h u g e !! Pro's: clean big room's, lot's of bars for both food and drinks. Very helpfull and friendly staff all over the hotel: we needed a taxi several times during our stay and staff at the door was alert and friendly: very good service! Nice suggestions where and what to visit in downtown Dallas! Con's: WIFI was way to expensive and usually only available in my room: that sucks since I like to sit at a bar with my netbook! Room for improvement there! Overall: fantastic, clean conference hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “An institutional monster. Not bad for a conference.”
Reviews.Author: nodrama1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is HUGE. If you're at a conference beware if meetings are being held on both the tower and Atrium side as there is a good 100yds between each building. The large auditorium is closest to the atrium side. Media bar has good food and a decent atmosphere when the hotel is full. The hotel is not really near anything so plan on taking a taxi everywhere. The gym is impressive but is a full 5 min walk from the atrium side of the hotel. I would unlikely choose to stay here if I was on a vacation in Dallas because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely surroundings”
Reviews.Author: tnwaltz
Reviews.Content: Typical of Hilton, this hotel has spacious lobbies with lovely water features and seating areas. It was a good thing to have a glass roof because the first afternoon when we were waiting to check in the electricity went off for about an hour. We were served cookies and efforts were made to accommodate people's needs. When we were finally able to check in, the electronic room keys had been disabled, so the bellhop had to go to each room to let people in. Overall, however, the restaurant, Media Grill, was delightful and our room was spacious and well appointed. The concierge, Terri, was especially helpful and friendly. The best part, though, is the sculpture park that begins at the hotel and extends beyond. The walking/jogging paths are great and I loved having a beautiful and safe place to have my morning walk. Room service is exorbitant. Also, there are no other restaurants or any shopping area within walking distance. That was the greatest drawback, in my estimation, since we didn't rent a car. A taxi to a shopping area with restaurants was $25.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Beautiful Artwork”
Reviews.Author: Steve R
Reviews.Content: What can you say other than awesome about a hotel that has a huge moving color changing abstract piece of art in the atrium that cost $1,500,000 not to mention the jillions of dollars of other artwork throughout the hotel. Only complaint was the bathroom was very small

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5 star hotel terrible management.”
Reviews.Author: ColesDad1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice 5 star hotel in the market square area of dallas.Huge hotel with asian dacor.I had a corner room,large,nice linens and well kept.Some will complain about the cost of parking.These folks have not traveled much.All major large city hotels do this.The property the parking lots site on are prime real estate. Now get over it! This hotel also has a very nice indoor pool area with a nice hot tub.My main problem with this hotel was wuth housekeeping and management.I had two hotels on this trip.This one and one in arlington.I had business in both cities and needed more than one hotel this trip.When i came back to the anatole at 10am to my room,the door was open and my luggage was visible from the hallway.I was pissed! I had left a do not disturb sign on the door and a note on the bed to let all know I was not cheking out yet.Asked for the main manager and not only didi he do nothing but he was rude.I will not stay here again and suggest others do not as well,unless you want your luggage stolen!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, you can get lost its so big”
Reviews.Author: hart277
Reviews.Content: with over 1600 rooms this hotel you would think would have some holes in service and other things, but it was very nice, the only thing i didn't understand was the asian theme all over the place. Room was fine, typically hilton room. Room was clean and the everyone was pretty helpful when I needed something. I never really left the hotel, don't really need to it has everything that you might need!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and grounds”
Reviews.Author: djt68
Reviews.Content: I loved the asian inspired decor. Room was spacious and comfortable. The grounds were spacious and immaculate. Was here for a conference, the conference faciities were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Anatole Hotel”
Reviews.Author: r a
Reviews.Content: The hotel complex is very large, beautiful, and well-maintained. The only complaint we have is that the barbeque smell prevalent in the tower was annoying after a day. Donna, in the executive concierge lounge, was extremely friendly and very helpful. She went out of her way to ensure we were well taken care of. The food choices in the executive lounge were not as good as other HIlton properties, where we experience more hot, filling choices of entrees.

Reviews.Title: “New Year 2010-2011”
Reviews.Author: MimiDiQT
Reviews.Content: Great stay in this beautiful hugeeee hotel* We spent 20010-2011 New Years in this Hotel in floor 27 in the restaurant they had a party and we had a great time* You get treated like a Queen as soon as you pull up to the door of the hotel...Great outstanding class service* A lot of ART in the Hotel and the room was Gorgeous- Beautiful view- The restroom was very clean and very nice. We got complimentary parking free- and a credit for breakfast for one of their restaurants- Great concierge they help you find what you are looking for* I would definitley visit this hotel in a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good service and good location”
Reviews.Author: nejcusa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, has nice, large spacious rooms, the entire hotel area is huge, however it lacks some touch - for example - a nice bar outside where you can enjoy the weather, since the hotel AC is set too cold. The pool was open, but did not have a functioning bar. The food service was not very good either, neither was the quality of it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: Colleen L
Reviews.Content: We are two Aussies who started our trip with being 3 hours late in Brisbane, therefore missing our connecting flight to Dallas. Along the way our luggage was lost. The Anatole was supurb in every way. The decor is amazing with such exquisite Asian artifacts. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were overwhelmed with our wonderful concierge Rahel. She went out of her way to assist with checking the airport many times for our luggage, providing us with toiletries, even recharging my Australian iPhone. She is certainly a great credit to a very tranquil and enjoyable hotel. Colleen and Tom

Reviews.Title: “One of the best conference hotels I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: mgt2010
Reviews.Content: I went here last week for a conference and stayed a few extra days. This hotel is huge, but service still held up well. What struck me so favorably was that it also doubles as a museum. It has world-class Asian art everywhere you look. There was even a sculpture on a pedestal IN MY ROOM. Conference facility services were great. They had a great fitness center - very posh. The room was everything you need, including light-blocking curtains for sleeping in. All in all, everything together made for a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Feels a bit like Vegas (both good and bad)”
Reviews.Author: joshkspa
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference, so it wasn't on my dime. That being said, cost wasn't a factor for me. This Hilton is interesting. I hear it was built in the 80's for some Republican convention and Reagan. It's a very very large complex. Two large 12 story atriums plus a tower. The decor is nice and modern and interesting--like staying in a giant asian art museum. I liked it but felt somewhat themed like Vegas. I stayed on the 9th floor of the atrium with Media (club, restaurant, bar) down in the lobby). Even at 1-2am on a weekend I could hear the thump thump of music. This stuff doesn't bother me a bit but I was surprised with 12 stories of rooms facing this atrium, how is it they aren't full of complaints to quiet the bar? Anyways. the rooms are very nice. My bed was extremely comfortable. The room was spotless. Staff throughout the entire building were helpful, speedy and upbeat. Location? eh, not near much except a Whataburger and other hotels. The sheer size, the over the top decor and the party feel until the wee hours kept making me think this place has a lot of Vegas in it.

Reviews.Title: “Has so much!”
Reviews.Author: Cari O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Anatole last winter. It is a grand hotel. It was very busy, but it is a large facility so no worries. We booked an interior room because it was cheaper, but not sure all will enjoy not having windows to the "outside". The hotels has neat shops, and we had dinner at one of the restaurants. Great food, a little pricey, but expected. We even went dancing that evening at the hotel. Fun! The breakfast was wonderful. We will return, it has so much.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and great service!”
Reviews.Author: DessieK
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was extremely helpful. The room was comfortable and super clean but could hear the neighbor watching TV... Food throughout the hotel bars and restaurants is delicious. Highly recommend the V-spa but make sure you make a reservation at least a day in advance. The fitness center was awesome! The only down fall of this fairy tale is the Internet - it should be available at no charge in the rooms....

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay but widely varying price vs quality situation”
Reviews.Author: jasoncrh
Reviews.Content: Overall I do really like the Anatole. I've stayed there a number ofbtimes and for a hotel its size it's amazingly well run. I've only stayed in the tower, but overall the rooms are clean, large, and the showers have good water pressure. I appreciate the toiletry selection. Value at this hotel varies widely. I've gotten a room there for as low as $120 a night- breakfast included- to my last stay- $270 for the exact same room, and the exact same breakfast at the terrace restaurant. Annoying that there's such a discrepancy. Also annoying is the $17 per night self parking (!!!!!!!) charge. Extortion. Overall, though, the hotel is convenient, food good, the Asian art interesting, and comfortable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Huge top notch hotel, but no verizon cell service in the room!”
Reviews.Author: tmhigg
Reviews.Content: Awesome, huge , luxury hotel. Great fitness center! How about boosting that Verizon signal in the hotel? It would make it perfect!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all !”
Reviews.Author: CoronaFallsChurchVA
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here in a month. The gym is the best around - seriously large with top of the line equipment and an actual separate pool with lap lanes - and not just one or two lanes: five of them, 25 meters, laned off well appointed. After a good solid workout, time to eat excellent food. Media is my favorite: in the main atrium. Excellent wine and beer selection. As a vegetarian, I am always skeptical of the vegetarian burger. One of the bartenders, who appeared to be a carnivore, surprised me and told me the details of how it was made in house and what the ingredients were. It was outstanding !! Presented on a very cool plate with condiments and excellent french fries. Even took a brownie and ice cream dessert upstairs - cream cheese ice cream with caramel and chocolate sauce. So much for the workout-truly decadent. Service: treated so well at check-in and the bellmen helped with directions on my way out. The room: I was in the Tower building closest to the Atrium and my room was so well appointed, looked recently renovated, excellent amenities. Liked that I didn't have to pay $16.95 for the internet - used the lower priced $12.95 version and it worked very fast. Overall, this hotel does it all for me: price, quality, food, service.

Reviews.Title: “DFW convenient, nice rooms, excellent toiletries”
Reviews.Author: nostalgia88
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip to Dallas through Expedia, and they offered a great flight/hotel package that put me at the Hilton Anatole. It's not in the heart of downtown Dallas, but it's close to a lot of things and is priced a little more moderately than some of the hotels in the city. I recommend having a rental car (even though parking is $17/day, you will easily spend that on cab fare doing anything in the city). DFW is about 20 minutes away. I stayed in the Atrium, which I found to be comfortable, but occasionally the sound from the downstairs bar area filtered up to our room. It was a rowdy weekend, as we were there during the Red River Rivalry game, and the place was swarming with Texas & OU fans. Security was pretty tight (you had to show a hotel key to access the elevators), which I appreciated. The room itself was spacious and comfortable. I have no complaints about it, except that the hotel needs to get with the program and offer free wi-fi. Parking is $17/day, which is steep, but not completely out of line with what else is available in the area. They get SUPER bonus points for having Peter Thomas Roth toiletries. I am always impressed when a hotel makes the effort of having an upscale brand do their toiletries! It's a small detail, but really makes a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to be nickled and dimed.”
Reviews.Author: broadcast9
Reviews.Content: Basically, this is four star hotel where you get to pay piecemeal for all the four star amenities. The indoor pool- you have to pay for. The fitness club- $16/day. Internet service? Tiered from $12 for dial up speeds, and $18 for real broadband speeds. Free breakfast? Nope. Self parking - $18/day. Basically even though they charge above average room rates, you still get nicked everytime you turn around. Had a tower room- which I would recommend against. It is basically a windowless room. There is a window but it points into the hallway. The maids were ridicuolously annoying. I would leave the room from 9am-1pm but they wouldn't clean it then. Then I would come back and do some work and they would knock with that annoying key knock. (rapid clicking to get your attention in case you weren't paying attention) I would say, please come back at 4pm - and they would come back in 20 minutes and knock again. Or the supervisor would come by to confirm I wanted my room cleaned at 4pm. The only good thing I have to say about this place is that the Media restaurant was pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel...I mean HUGE!”
Reviews.Author: dtravelgirl007
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference back in July 2011. My husband wasn't sure where to park so we entered in the 1st entrance - turned out we were in the 'other' tower. I didn't realize how massive this hotel was until I took a tour with the other speakers. But, despite it's size, it wasn't all that difficult to get around. Really loved the Asian decor...it was definitely like being at the Asian Art Museum. The displays were incredible and just everywhere. My husband & I sat in the cabana-like atriums in the lobby. Lots of pillows, lots of places to sit. The convenience store was open until at least midnight so we could get some cool refreshments. My only issue is the air-conditioning...or lack thereof in the open walk-ways of the higher floors. We were on the 10th floor. It was a hot & humid trek from once you exit the elevator on our floor to the room. So, that didn't make for much time spent in the halls. Great place. Would stay there again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Anatole Is Number 1 in Customer Service and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Saskatchewanbeauty
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in this Hotel for 4 days and upon arrival, we were greeted by a Kind Smile and Friendly Voice. Nicole is a Hilton Star for Sure... she proceeded to check us in with minimum time wasted and very thorough information for our stay. We stayed in the Atrium side and were Very impressed with the spacious Double rooms and views. Interior wise this hotel is just one Discovery after the other....had much to do and much to enjoy. Several Bars are located at the Hotel if you feel you want to stay here... we did check them all out and they are each Great in Different ways....We alsio loved how helpful the desk outside is for helping plan your day to getting taxi's for your pick up.... just a short jaunt to The Historic West End, $15.00 one way where there are Many Many possibilities including Bar and Grills, Entertainment and Museums. We Also spent a day Shopping at the North Mall where you will find designer shops like Gucci, Coach and Guess as well as Macy's and some great places to eat, about $23.00 one way by taxi well worth it for the day....( F.Y.I.There are 2 ATM Machines on Premises) Terri at the Concierge Desk was our other Great Hilton Star!! Both of these gals Stuck out for us in every aspect and We hope that Hilton Anatole knows what Great People they have working here. (We Suspect they do!!) Pool was Wonderful..love the outdoors.. Sculpture Garden, Walking and Running Paths, be sure to take time for these sights on the hotel Grounds. Spa is a Bonus and there is also a Salon in the Mezzanine. Thanks Hilton For a WONDERFUL STAY!!! Cannot wait to get back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bars inside, Nice Decor, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: murmagmazy
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are nothing special, but the bars they have are very nice. You can just check in here, enjoy a few different bar atmospheres without even leaving the hotel. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph D
Reviews.Content: Ever since 2007, whenevr I go to Dallas, I will only stay at the Hilton Anatole. I travel to Dallas two or three times a year, and I was most recently there in September. I absolutely love this hotel. This is a beautiful hotel with huge conference space, nice gym, and a spa. The rooms are new and modern, and the beds are very comfortable! The front desk staff is okay, not overly friendly or helpful, but the concierge, bell staff, and housekeeping staff are very friendly. I have also had the pleasure of meeting many nice people who are also staying at the hotel; the clientele is very friendly and outgoing! The hotel has a five star restaurant named Nana, but the menu selections are a bit rich for my taste. I prefer to eat at the Media Bar, and I highly recommend their burgers. I also like to hang out at the Media Bar while having beers and watching sporting events. For breakfast, I like to eat at The Terrace, where they sometimes have a buffet that is great! I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: designedtosoar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past 3 years, for my company's annual conference. It is a beautiful, elegant hotel, but very costly. NO free parking, free internet or free breakfast. Restaurants in hotel are good, but very expensive. And you can't take your own food either, because there are no fridges or microwaves in the room, except a pre-filled fridge with very expensive snacks! Also, no restaurants within walking distance, except Denny's, which is a few blocks down the street. This is the greatest disadvantage of all, in my opinion, especially if you've flown to Dallas for a business conference and taken a shuttle to the hotel. Then you're stuck with very few food options. If you rent a car in order to drive to restaurants a few miles away, you have to fight the traffic, and then you can't hardly find a parking spot available at the hotel when you get back! The location of the hotel is very easy to drive to. But someone needs to get smart and buy up some of the property nearby and build several restaurant franchises. Thousands of people stay at this hotel for business conferences... the restaurants would have plenty of business if they would just build there! If you have plenty of money, this is a beautiful place to stay... but it is definitely NOT for someone on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “NAMSS Conference 2011”
Reviews.Author: GoldFinch924
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for the conference. Stayed in the towers which had very convenient elevator locations for the rooms (good to remember!). Views from the tower of Dallas were stunning! The ambiance at night in the hotels varying grills and bars was nice. You could take your glass of wine and sit outside in a nice setting as well. Rooms were nice, quiet, clean and ample for me and my roommate. We shuttled in from airport and took taxis to dinner two nights (other night we were taken by bus to Eddie Deans). The taxi ride was 13 one way which was not bad split between three passengers... The conference and exhibition rooms were a slight hike, especially for those who were staying in atrium rooms. All in all, I would return as it was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families”
Reviews.Author: CorporateMom911
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the suggestion of a friend. It is conveniently located close to market and downtown Dallas. However, after paying $185 per night, I was shocked to pay $17 per day to SELF park. Although the food at both the Terrace and the Media bar and grill was good, it was horribly overpriced. We'd packed drinks and snacks for the kids, only to find we had to drag our cooler to the room to because the fridge was automated only (which also meant nowhere for leftover meals). All 3 pools were also under construction at the SAME time, which was awfully disappointing. Gym membership was 40 bucks for 3 days!!! They nickel and dime you to death. Also it was very hard to control temps in the rooms. Great for conventions or planning an event, but not for the vacation traveler. We aren't on a budget by any means, but I've gotten better accommodations for the money many times.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place, fair price, may be long walk to room”
Reviews.Author: chazb0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a meeting and was impressed by the physical plant, both inside and out. There's a huge attractive atrium and 10 floors built around it. Nice view down below. Unfortunately, I could only find one elevator from the atrium and my room 1075 was the geographic furthest from the meeting room and the elevator bank. The room was clean and nice, decor fine. The bathroom was small but adequate since I was travelling alone, but there was a separate sink and vanity from the room with the tub and commode. I ate all 3 meals on the floor of the nice atrium;they were all buffet style with average food and attentive service, satisfying nevertheless. I noticed attractive restaurants and bars opposite the 2 large meeting rooms but didn't have time to visit them. Overall pleasant stay with excellent group rate of $129/night. Would definitely recommend for a meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Running Wild”
Reviews.Author: mjbbg572
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the first weekend of May 2011. Upon checking in I was shocked to see hundreds of 8-12 year old kids running around. I soon realized that there was a chess tournament being held in the conference rooms. If I would have known this in advance, I would've definitely stayed somewhere else. I cannot fault the hotel for this. My room was standard. It was clean. Did not have much of a view. Room service was what you would expect from most hotels, overpriced and blah. There were very few late night dining options after 10 PM, even for a weekend. Valet was extremely slow when I needed my car. I could have easily parked myself since there is a huge parking lot right outside the hotel. Overall my stay was a decent one. No real complaints. It's not a bad place to stay but next trip to Dallas, I may look into other options...........

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property!”
Reviews.Author: MikeSap
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here for a conference in September, 2011. This is a very large hotel which seems to be part hotel, and part art gallery. Overall theme is Oriental, and there are a lot of interesting art pieces throughout. There is also a wonderful sculpture garden where you can walk, run, and admire more art. The rooms were also nice. I took a discounted upgrade to an executive level room. The room looked recently renovated, and the bathroom was especially impressive. One of the best showers I can ever remember! This upgrade also includes access to the Executive Lounge which serves a continental breakfast in the morning, and hors d'oeuvres at night. The staff in the lounge were some of the friendliest I have ever dealt with at a hotel, anywhere! Possibly the only downside is that this hotel is not located within walking distance of much...

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, insanely great food, but out of towners might want better location”
Reviews.Author: TexasGingerbread
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. We stayed in the tower. Concierge floor has WONDERFUL food, as does room service. You would not need to eat out...the food here is as good if not better. Yummy guacamole, steak sandwich, spring rolls, seafood alfredo pasta. Rooms are nice, flat screen, attentive maids.
