If your room key stops working be prepared for a long walk (if late at night) or a very long wait for another one. The tower front desk not open late so you have to go to atrium. It's a HUGE hotel. Decent location but not the best. During rush hour traffic is the pits to go even 15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “awesome convention center”
Reviews.Author: jackiesamy
Reviews.Content: great hotel, awesome ammenities, huge hotel for convention, has several restaurants, huge area for resting, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Conference!”
Reviews.Author: travelinglointer
Reviews.Content: Have been really impressed with the up-to-date design of the hotel. Thoroughly modern without being gimmicky. Housekeeping standards a little lax (the bedskirt in my room was horribly snagged and stained. the manufacturer tags were hanging down from all the furniture) but all in all a great working hotel. Huge lobby/atrium with lots of places to meet. Staff was all exceedingly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilikemarkers
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Anatole has the largest collection of art of any US hotel. In that respect, it was fabulous to be able to just walk around and look at all the beautiful Asian art, and other wonderful pieces from around the world. The Sleeping rooms were comparable to most other Hiltons. I stayed in a King room, and I liked the little sitting area, as well as the desk area. However, I was unhappy with the closet door handles, which stick out strangely in the walking path past the door. In moving past them I scraped my arm, and the whole weekend, they seemed to be at just the wrong height and would snag on my clothes as I would go in and out of the room. The Concierge lounge was OK. I've been in better. However, breakfast was nice, though no hot foods. Appetizers were good. It would have been nice if they had a better drink selection (juices & sodas) without having to ask at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel full of riches and antiques to admire”
Reviews.Author: Robbiii
Reviews.Content: I spent most of my free time looking and studying the huge collections of antiques and riches that are in the collections of this hotel. The room are basic but the rest of the hotel makes up for all the bad hotel experiences you have had.

Reviews.Title: “Wish service was as wonderful as the beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: lclick
Reviews.Content: We came with a group of friends for a weekend getaway. The hotel is beautiful in my opinion but a bit overwhelming because there are very few friendly faces helping along the way. I am sure it would be great for someone who doesn't mind their room being charged every time they turn around. It just feels like there isnt a lot of give when it comes to anything (expensive parking, you cant use the cart for luggage, Internet fees, not even one vending machine for a coke -haha.) This is just one of my pet peeves, so this is not a great place for me to stay in the future. Too bad; because it is really beautiful and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Grand in many ways!”
Reviews.Author: MIRoadWarrior42416
Reviews.Content: One of the best in Dallas, the new renovations make it even more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with Great staff”
Reviews.Author: rottshower
Reviews.Content: Where to begin... The property is amazing with tons of photo ops! While it sits on over 7 acres and is easy to get lost, friendly staff are literally around every corner to guide you in the right direction. The staff welcomed my family who are a bit on the sheltered side, and not used to luxury accommodations, while making myself and my domestic life partner accepted. The valet staff was amazing and knew us on first name basis. Tonya and another, whos name I cannot recall, gave us the attention that is expected at such an establishment. While the prices may seem overwhelming, you get what you pay for; attention to the smallest details and a wonderful carefree experience

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...depends on which side you're on!”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice and there is one side that is very nice and then the tower side which isn't quite so much!

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious, many amenities”
Reviews.Author: TWTHOMAS
Reviews.Content: This place is huge. Big halls, large conference room, great workout facilities. If you are in the towers, the elevators are quick to the floors. The have a nice outside track. They have a pretty good workout facilities with full gym, swimming pool, saunas, indoor track, basketball court and raquetball courts. Food was good, not great. My biggest complaint, if you want to go to the bar for a drink, you might have to donate blood to pay your bill. It is ridiculous on how pricey even a beer is, $6.50 for a 12 oz. If you are entertaining clients, get a cab and get away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: PickyGuy
Reviews.Content: First, it is a beautiful large hotel, not unlike the Las Vegas hotels. The restaurants looked fine and they have a good coffee bar for your morning espresso. Just be aware that overnight parking is $17 and 24they hours of internet is $13 to $15. Breakfast cost at least $15.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but very large and spread out”
Reviews.Author: be32
Reviews.Content: The quality of the Hilton Anatole is typical of Hilton properties but rooms are divided out between three buildings and two lobby areas. I stayed on one of the top floors of the atrium side and since the atrium is open, the open hallways were very hot (heat rises) probably close to 90 degrees. It was a 3-4 minute walk from the elevator to my room so I was roasting by the time I got there. I used the executive lounge in the tower building which was about a 10 minute trip from my room. Similarily, the work out facility and pool were a long way away as well. Hotel was not busy and room service trays sat out in hallways from the time I arrived to the time I departed even though I saw maintenance and other staff on my floor throughout the evening. Parking is excessive at $17 per day considering it is a surface lot on the property. Just another typical revenue generator at an overpriced hotel. Internet worked fine for me though I noticed others complained about availability. I would prefer the Doubletree down the street as it is a better value and less of a walk to amenities though it is probably a 3.5 star vs. 4 star but very nice hotel nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Truly beautiful”
Reviews.Author: AustinBeach001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Anatole on points in August of 2011. We were driving from Arkansas from Austin and decided to make a pit stop here as a last little hurrah for summer and boy was it worth it! Let me start of with this... the hotel is the 2nd largest hotel in Dallas and has over 1600 rooms with 3 buildings. We stayed in the tower in a Junior Suite on the 24th (Executive) floor (room 2466). The room was great. It was large and had a great view of the Dallas skyline. It was clean and comfortable and conveinient to the outdoor activities (as are all rooms in the tower). The ground and interior area of the hotel are beautiful. All the statues and sculptures are Asian inspired and the total amount within the hotel is priceless (the hotel felt like a museum). The hotel, along with the tower, has 2 massive atriums with rooms and Atrium 1 has the dinner restaurant and a magnificant lighting piece hanging from the top of the building. The service is good and everybody there caters to you. I would definitely stay here again. Also, be aware the hotel is not in downtown Dallas (about 2 miles, right across from Market Center) and charges for parking and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent antique Asian art and sculpture collection, a Zen experience”
Reviews.Author: jdlasser
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel, but deserted! 1624 rooms with probably less than 100 occupied. It was a ghost town.No WiFi available in rooms in the Tower. Never saw a Concierge in 3 days. Never saw a Bellman at the desk in 3 days. Often, no one at check-in desk.The Atrium side was different. Stores closed Sunday due to low guest census and not re-opening 'til Wednesday when a convention comes in. $7 for ice bucket room service. $17 at night to park yourself - $26 a night valet. Lots of room in the restaurants. On the positive side, a restful Zen experience in the lobbies of the Atrium and Tower. Magnificent, massive glass sculpture undulates from the ceiling to soft Asian music, indoor reflecting pools, 3 outdoor pools (4 people in water all weekend - we could see them from our 18th story window.) Rooms large, clean, well-appointed; food at the Grill was very good. Abundant breakfast. Excellent Spa, massages recommended. What would get me to go back there? The Asian art collection of Trammell Crow. Stunning and must be seen. Could spend hours taking it all in.

Reviews.Title: “A trip back to the seventies, with bad service and a worse smell to complete the package!”
Reviews.Author: jojoP84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business with coworker and one of the reasons we chose the hotel was because they would allow us to split the bill on two credit; however upon arrival we learned they had charged one for everything in advance and would not fix their error. The very long trek to our room was filled with a stale smell and horrible decor. The room itself seemed to be partially updated, but the shower curtain an carpet fit in with the seventies design in the hallway. The beds were tiny and horribly uncomfortable, and we had to call to ask for a maid to clean the room. Next time I'll save myself the money and stay at a motel 6...a much better choice than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice but understaffed and unable to accomodate large crowds”
Reviews.Author: sk_fairfax
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a convention. There were 3 large conventions going on, and I believe the hotel was full, and it is a large hotel. Dining options are VERY limited. One fine dining, one sushi bar and a bar/restaurant with approx. 12 tables for dinner. No nearby restaurants and cab rides were getting expensive. All restaurants/bars were completely understaffed and unable to handle crowds as a result of 3 conventions. Wait times for food/drinks were crazy, for every meal. Even the outside pool had a bar that was only staffed with one bartender, and the pool area was crowded! I would not ever choose this hotel for a convention, and will think twice about returning next year. For what it's worth, the rooms were very nice and clean and the art work scattered around the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Art Combined”
Reviews.Author: katgonmom
Reviews.Content: While our stay here was a bit skewed by the fact that I was checking it out for a possible future conference, I would highly recommend a stay here. The amazing art pieces scattered throughout the hotel make the visit worthwhile. Comfortable, clean rooms, excellent service, friendly employees make this a top-notch place to stay for Dallas travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations - I will be back”
Reviews.Author: corsagi
Reviews.Content: I stay here twice each year for work. I have stayed in other hotels in this area in Dallas (near the Dallas Market Center) and the Hilton Anatole is my favorite. Nice little business center, which I've used every stay, great room service, nice restaurants and bars on property. The Hilton Anatole just completed a rennovation to one of its lobbies, and it looks wonderful. Most times I stay in the Tower - I love the Asian themed decor, but I've also stayed in the Atrium. This is a busy hotel, but has ample staff to handle the demands of its customers. I will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Anatole”
Reviews.Author: airbornliz
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very pleasant stay at the Anatole for our best friends wedding festivities. It was just the four of us and we had a nice time. Whatever you do DO NOT I repeat DO NOT give your bags to the bell boys. They took our bags and did not allow us to take them to our rooms ourselves as that was against policy, we did not get them back for over an hour which would not have been a big deal if they were busy or short staffed. Neither of these were the case and after calling down from our rooms two times and letting them know they were going to make us late to our dinner reservations we finally received our bags with 10 minutes to get ready. Upon check out we over heard other guests getting mad and not even handing over their luggage because urgency and good guest service is definitely not their motto. The rooms were beautiful, however we would have enjoyed staying in the terrace side versus the towers because there was more to offer. Dinner at Nana's was delicious, but I do wish they would have let our friends cut their wedding cake (which we brought from outside) and listen to us when we told them 10 times this was wedding rather than assume that this was a first year anniversary dinner. The music at Nana's was nice, it did not create a ambiance of romance like advertised however and the music in Media Bar did not exist. This is a great hotel to sleep while your in town, but you definitely won't want to spend all your time on the premises. One night was more than enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Great Food and Very Professional Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: fsudru
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel as a traveler and NOT attending a convention. This was one of the best hotels my wife and I have ever stayed before! It started the minute we walked in and were greeted by the friendly front desk staff to the very last server at our dinner at Media. The food was outstanding and the atmosphere was fun and upscale. The next morning we had a great breakfast (in room) overlooking downtown Dallas, swam in a beautiful pool and worked out in a huge fitness gym. The grounds around pool and workout area were immaculate and well groomed. I would definitely go back to this hotel and stay every time I go to downtown Dallas. Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Five star service!!!”
Reviews.Author: djackson09
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, from Jonathan in valet to Enrique delivering my luggage. Everyone was very professional. Comfortable nights rest and breakfast at the Terraces Restaurant was delicious. I would definitely come back and recommend this hotel to my friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly charm amidst impressive renovations”
Reviews.Author: walk4me
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference hosted at this hotel. From doorman to front desk to restaurant staff to maid, I was struck how everyone was so friendly and helpful. I was always acknowledged and asked how my stay was. Everyone seemed genuinely interested in helping me navigate the large hotel and the local public transit. Coming from San Francisco, it was a bit ironic to see the renovations done in a modern Asian theme. It managed to avoid being kitschy, almost museum-like at times. There were 3 conferences going on at the same time throughout their many rooms & ballrooms, but it never felt congested or overwhelming. And at the end of the day I still preferred eating at their excellent Media Grill or ordering from 24-hr room service than braving the 100+ degree Summer heat in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “So many positives, so many negatives!”
Reviews.Author: starsfan2299
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a conference at this hotel and have to praise it as well as be critical in many areas. Overall the hotel is beautiful and very well taken care of. The grounds are beautiful, hotel is clean and care is taken to make sure your every need is addressed. The staff is top notch and will go out of their way to help when a security issue arises which happened in my case. With all this praise you probably think it will overshadow the negatives, not so. This hotel nickel and dimes you to death, everything seems to be wayyy overpriced as well. A small breakfast for two was $59! I was surprised their wasn't a charge for using the public restrooms. As others have written in the reviews they charge for every amenity. No in room refrigerators, very overpriced mini bar, no microwaves. They want you to use their restaurants and this is a way to do it. I found it very odd that at a massive hotel where you can walk a quarter of a mile from one conference room to another, there is no public seating. It is not unusual for these conferences to be a couple of thousand strong, but no place to sit down between meetings? Wonder why? You'll need to check into a room for that! Smart on their part but very inconvenient for the attendees. In the conference rooms you are packed in like sardines, no leg room and only very small chairs. I will think twice before attending another conference here but the staff is top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: grayt63
Reviews.Content: First I will start by saying this is a very pretty hotel. There are both good and bad things I experienced here. The good, the rooms in the tower were very nice. However, everything was extra. No microwave, no refrigerator you must buy everything at one of the gift shops or the restaurants. There is a refrigerator in the room stocked with mini bar items that are all extra. A coke is almost $8. Crazy !!! The bad....everything is extra including the internet. There is no free interent anywhere except for one restaurant in the hotel. Parking is extra. Gym is extra. There are no restaurants or much else around the area. In addition...there was a mistake on my bill, I was charged for several mini bar items I did not take. About $100 worth! When I called down to the front desk about the charges at around 6:00am I received the worst customer service I had ever experienced. Rude, agrumentative, and abrupt ! After basically being accused of lying about taking things from the mini bar I asked for a supervisor and was told "there is no supervisor here". The desk clerk name was Nyeti Abasi. I have never had anyone talk to me like she talked to me. In addition, I was at a Federal conference and had filled out a tax expempt paper and was still charged taxes. When I asked about that I was rudely told that I could not have filled one out because she (Nyeti) could not find mine. I was informed that I had to come down and fill out another one or the charges would not be removed. These are the kind of employees that are making the Hilton name bad. I will not return because of her. There was one employee named Terri that worked at the Concierge desk and she was totally AWESOME. Had it not been for her I would have said Hilton customer service was terrible. They did fix my bill but I still had to go through an awful upsetting experience. I travel frequently and see the HIlton's lacking and Marriott's and Holiday Inn's overcoming them because of employee like Nyeti. I would find somewhere else to stay . All in all, an awful experience with front desk customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is an Add-On Expense”
Reviews.Author: MysteryAct
Reviews.Content: When planning a stay at the Hildton Anatole, be prepared for numerous additional expenses. Even parking is not free - plan $17 a night! The Continental breakfast service is for guests in the Executive rooms only. And the mini frig is such that you cannot add your own food or leftovers. We did not find public transportation or restaurants within walking distance or the hotel. And the restaurants at the hotel, while nice, were pricy. The workout facilities sounded nice. But again, the hotel charges a fee to use them. Internet access is only free in the Executive Lounge. To use the Hilton's computers and printers, there is a charge for time and a charge for per page printing. Shipping from the business center proves pricey as well.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the hotel (but the parking situation is nuts)”
Reviews.Author: DamnSaltyHam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now and have had the most magnificent accommodations both times despite booking via a travel bid site. The first time we had a junior suite (that overlooked a gravel rooftop, but the room was so opulent we didn't care about what was going on outside) and the second time they gave us an upper floor double with a panoramic view. You really get the feeling of being wrapped in luxury here for the most part, although the age of the hotel does show in small ways, like the bath fixtures were less up to date than the rest of the room in some instances and the elevators don't seem in keeping with the newness elsewhere. The lobby and public spaces, and especially the grounds, are lovely and really fun to explore, and the good thing about the hotel's age is that you at times get a glimpse of its old-school opulence despite the stylish updates and hip watering holes. I have to say we spent more time hanging out at the hotel than we normally would because we enjoyed our room and dug the general atmosphere. The big drawback, and the reason this is not a five-star review, is the parking -- it sucks. You pay a high daily rate for self-parking, and do not get the freedom of in-and-out access unless you pay the fees in advance or valet (the latter of which is just prohibitively expensive). There is a loophole however, in that the parking booth seems to be randomly staffed. Our first visit we agreed to just let them charge our bill in advance for the number of days in our stay, but then noticed that half the time the gate out was left open and no one was in the booth to charge anyone. When we complained about paying for parking when others were not being charged, after much wrangling we got $50 in parking fees refunded.. Our second visit we wised up and just paid at the booth as we went, and using the method we only ended up being charged one time during a three-day visit. But of course that's also a gamble, and mainly worked because when we left for the day we didn't come back till we were in for the night. Due to the parking cost and weirdness of that situation, I don't recommend this hotel for people who will be going back and forth to the hotel over the course of each day, as you can get charged anytime you take your car out if there happens to be someone working the parking booth. I would stay here much more frequently if parking weren't such an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is okay, service in restaurant was sporadic”
Reviews.Author: TRAXUK
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is okay standard, no major complaints - its a bit dated and in need of a facelist but overall acceptable quality. the main pain that I had was in the restaurant - couldnt be bothered to go out so ate in the only restaurant available as the main restaurant is closed for some reason. The food was very good, but the service was extremely sporadic, I had to keep getting up and going and asking the guys at the bar for everything (food, drink, check!). Maybe they were having a bad day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a convention”
Reviews.Author: RBG49
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 2 - 5, 2011 on 12 floor. This is a great hotel and an excellent site for a conference/convention. Ours had close to 700 attendees from all over Texas. Located right across the freeway for the Dallas Market Center you could walk there if you were so inclined. Rooms were nice although the A/C was a little cantankerous. Would liked to have had a mini-fridge but I guess you can't have everything. On the downside the restaurant, cafe & coffee shop were quite expensive but there are lots of great cafes and restaurants within a 10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Strange experience”
Reviews.Author: SSueAustin
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night; made a last minute reservation when I found I couldn't return home when planned. I'd always been curious about the Anatole (Loews Anatole, back in the day), so I thought I'd give it a try. Given its history for luxury and attention to detail, I found the "attention to detail" sorely lacking. Upon my arrival, I decided to use valet parking. I told the desk clerk this when I checked in. When I went back to the valet to give him information, he told me that that my room was in the building furthest away from the main building, and that I should take my car to that building (and that I should have been told by the desk clerk to go there for check-in and for valet parking). Okay. Small detail. When I arrived at other building, after I unpacked and re-gained my bearings, I realized how tired I was, and I thought I might just get room service or at least see what was in the hotel complex. But there was no room service menu in the room, nor was there a description of hotel dining facilities to be found. Fine. I called the appropriate party and asked for a menu. Waited 1-1/2 hours. Called again. Waited another hour. Called again. Got a menu. Ordered. I was half-asleep by the time the food arrived, so I didn't check it immediately. When I did, I found that much of what I ordered was different or missing. I was too tired to call back and complain one more time. It's obvious that the hotel is undergoing some transition since being bought by Hilton. I'd wait awhile before spending any time there for leisure, especially given the expense. (There is a very good, high-end restaurant there that the locals like to use, however.)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Arkansasgranny2
Reviews.Content: huge lobby- beautiful with wonderful art work lovely garden expensive restaurants no free tv or internet in rooms (wifi weak) no fridge or microwave-expensive refreshment bar in room parking pricey-self park - valet parking not much diff except in price rooms good value

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: FIUPANTHER
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month for a business meeting with over 3,200 people. This hotel and its staff did not miss a beat. They were prompt and friendly 24/7. I sometimes felt like if I was on a cruise ship (especially when we would go to eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner). I stayed at this hotel strickly for business. If you are planning to have a meeting here, this is the place to do it. The staff does a great job with logistics too (especially since we were a group of 3200 people from across the united states). Great for meetings. In addition, I felt that the grounds and areas were very well kept. My room was very clean and the bed was really comfy. The carpets throughout the entire hotel were very clean and new. Big property = more walking etc. But overall, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent grounds; fabulous restaurant”
Reviews.Author: DAEsmae
Reviews.Content: I actually selected this hotel because of the restaurant, which has a divine tasting menu. I got a good pre-paid rate. When we had a flight delay and were to arrive very late, I called the hotel to confirm they would have a room available. It's a pre-paid room but I wanted to be sure; oddly I was placed on hold 5 minutes but then finally told it would be ready. When we arrived, we were given double beds despite having booked a king. When we called reception, we were again placed on hold five minutes, then we were told no king rooms were available until after noon the next day - but the hotel was oddly empty so I do not know why this was the case. However, as promised, at noon the next day they did send up keys to a king room when we called and asked. There is an indoor lap pool and an outdoor pool as well as other finess facilities. There is a charge to use some of the facilities but waived for Hilton Honors members. The grounds are extensive with sculptures, koi pond, jogging path. The hotel is Asian themed and overall opulent/luxurious, so we were surprised as for the rate we paid we would have expected far less. There is a charge for parking - however this is true for many area hotels and we did not find it out of line. The charge for in room wireless was annoying however. Nana, the restaurant on the 27th floor, offers a city view and a fabulous tasting menu. the chef there is great so it was the highlight of our trip - and since it was the reason we picked this hotel, we were glad it proved so worthwhile. We will definately be back to dine there again and will not hesitate to stay here when we do, even though our stay was not perfect. There was one serious drawback, though I don't know that the hotel can fairly be blamed. A couple on our floor had a late night (3am) argument involving screaming, swearing and door pounding. It went on for over 20 minutes. I don't know if the hotel ever noticed or did anything about it, but since the first night we had a tiny bed and the second night we had screamers, it did not make for a good night's sleep either night.

Reviews.Title: “You have to pay for everything else”
Reviews.Author: donabl
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight for a dinner event with my 2 children (11, 6). We had to pay about $27 for parking, there is no wifi in the rooms, we didn't have time to check the amenities but from the menu, you have to pay to be able to use them, such as the basketball court, indoor swimming pool, etc. On top of this, when we turned on the TV to watch some news, we have to pay 4.99 for a local TV show!! Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Would have been satisfied had our neighbors not been so loud”
Reviews.Author: PattiGe
Reviews.Content: I don't have too much to say about this hotel since I was only there for a day and a half and did not use the amenities. I was there for a wedding so we did not choose the location. It is not near anything really. The positives: Room was nice and clean so had no complaints in that department. Service was good. My only complaint was that we could hear our neighbors and it was so loud we could not sleep. They were really loud though (in the middle of the night of course) but I believe that rooms have thin walls because I could hear their entire conversation clearly. I don't know if other rooms have this but our room has one of those connecting doors to the other room so that probably contributed to why we could hear everything they did so loudly. Usually when I stay at hotels at least the noise is somewhat muffled if people are loud.

Reviews.Title: “Why do expensive hotels charge for the "incidentals"?”
Reviews.Author: kjnielsen206
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference of an organization I belong to. I bought my room/airline ticket and rental car through another online search engine for $700 total. My stay was three nights. While I was lucky to get such a good deal, I was really surprised that parking, wifi, the gym/pool cost additional. Enough that it was the equivalent of another nights stay. Now compare that to the fact I stayed the previous night at a Super 8 that cost me $45 total. That room had the same sized bed, free breakfast (a hot one not just donuts and coffee) free wifi and the pool and weight room were free too. While I signed up for Hilton Honors, I am almost certain that I go out of my way to avoid this chain again. It was just very expensive

Reviews.Title: “OK to try this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GenCo101
Reviews.Content: After reading the poor reviews, I was bracing for a not-so-good experience for my upcoming 3 day conference stay. I've stayed in many hotels, so I've seen the good the bad & the ugly. Thankfully, this was a good experience. Front desk staff was very accomodating with my early arrival and request for a non-adjoining room. Room was clean & well appointed (and I am picky). The Terrance Restaurant was only open in the AM, so I never got to try it. I was not interested in the sushi bar or the 5 star restaurant, so that left the (upscale) Media Bar & Grill for all my dinners. Good food, nice atomosphere. There were a few shops to browse. From one shop I picked up snacks/water for in the room. I did not try the spa or have to park a vehicle, so can't comment on those elements. I brought my MiFi, so I did not have to pay the crazy daily internet charges. It is worthwhile to take some time to enjoy the huge Asian art collection throughout the 3 lobbies, the conference center halls and on the mezzanine level. The wide variety of artifacts made for some nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Bud56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention. The hotel was very clean, the restaurants were good and the service was wonderful. The room was nice and didnâ€™t hear much noise from other rooms or the Atrium. I would stay here again. This is a 4 star hotel, not a 5. One tip about getting to the hotel. Try and get a shuttle service (cheaper), the cabs are expensive to get there ($50 with tip).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds - Phenomenal Service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAngel1234
Reviews.Content: Demographics: Couple in our 40's seeking a short weekend getaway. I have to say, I read the reviews for this hotel and wondered if we made a mistake by booking. But, no, we were NOT disappointed in the least. $24 a day for Valet was one of the many complaints but I would encourage those who don't want to pay to park (or even valet) that you stay at the Motel 6 down the road and take the chance of having your car stolen or at least the wheels jacked. The Hilton-Anatole has at least 2 security cars patrolling the parking lots 24 hours a day to ensure your property is protected. That's worth the money to me. The following day, we utilized many of the spa/workout facilities and everything was good. The massages were excellent, to say the least, and as someone who receives massages regularly in their home town, I can tell you that this spa has thought of everything. I never felt so pampered and relaxed! Again, I have to mention, that the staff was very friendly and helpful. We only visited The Terrace for breakfast but the buffet was accommodating. My companion and I have very different tastes when it comes to breakfast food (he's a heart-meal eater, I prefer fruit, etc) and we were both satisfied with the meal. During the evening, we visited the Media Bar & Grill and had great burgers! Seasoned perfectly and cooked to our preference. The bar gets more of a night-life feel after 10 and a dancefloor is available for hip-hop/club dancing. Again, I will say that the Hilton-Anatole may cost more than other hotels in the area but I felt it was worth the money. From the time we arrived, Valet personnel were courteous and friendly and it continued with our belhop. The elevators are plentiful and FAST at this hotel (don't know why I felt the need to mention that, but there ya' go!). We were on the 22nd floor in the tower facing downtown Dallas and the decor was warm yet stylish.

Reviews.Title: “NOT what I expected......guess you have to be "important" at this place.”
Reviews.Author: gixxergirloh2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in dallas, April 14th thru 17th for her volleyball tournament. We booked our room through expedia so that we could get a good deal on a nice hotel. We arrived on thursday around 6 pm. The hotel is huge and we had no idea where to go to check in, as there are 3 different buildings. We were told we could go to any of the buildings and we would be directed to where our room was. After we checked in we asked where we could park. We were told that lot one was the only open lot out of 3. It was pretty far from our hotel but it was better than having to pay valet. PAYING TO PARK IS RIDICULOUS. So once my daughter and I lug our suitcases to the front of our building...i ask the valet guy, "why cant i park in these lots, they are empty.....why am i having to park waaaaaaaay over there" i couldnt believe his answer. He replies, " well we are having alot of guests coming" I point to the 2 empty lots.....that many????" He says....."well they are really important people" OMG....i said..."ummm i think im pretty important" he apologized quickly after realizing he whispered that to the wrong person. but i got the picture. I wasnt a walking dollar sign and NOT IMPORTANT. Saturday evening my daughter and i came back to find NO PARKING spots in lot 1. I called front desk from the parking lot and was rudely told that parking was first come first serve....i said im paying $17 a day and you cant tell me where to park...he said i cant see the lots from here mam...try lot 2 or 3. The event was going on by now....it was chaos......shouldve seen all the staff out in the street with walkie talkies stopping traffic to park cars.... whole lotta behind kissing goin on around there now cuz the bentleys and ferrari's were there aka "the important people had indeed arrived" this hotel is a joke. my view from the 23rd floor was of the hallway. why even put a window in a room if it is a view of THE HALLWAY !!!!!! pay for internet.....pay to park your own car....couldnt even get in my little refrigerator if i did want to pay $15 for some nuts. It wouldnt open !!! just overall VERY disappointed and i dont usually write reviews but i couldnt help it this time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms. Updated Asian decor in a spacious, clean, and quiet room. Good value. Convenient self parking. The reason I'm not giving it a 5 rating is problems with the reservations staff.

Reviews.Title: “busy kitchen made hotel smoky”
Reviews.Author: hussg
Reviews.Content: on friday 3/25 at 6pm, after getting back from work, the atrium 2 was very smoky. it was very uncomfortable. i had a hard time breathing. i asked one lady what was the problem, and she said that they were cooking in the kitchen, then i asked if this was normal, she said no but they are trying to fix it. i asked someone else what was the problem, and they said that there was a fire in the kitchen. i had planed to have dinner at the great media bar there that night with a business partner. we then had to change the plans and leave the hotel. i called to talk to the manager a few minutes ago, and he said that whenever the kitchen is busy this happens. he then asked what he can do for me, i asked a free night, he said i will take off the 50 $ i spent for food there. that was all he was able to do.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service!”
Reviews.Author: AMCMom
Reviews.Content: FIrst of all, the hotel is beautiful. But, the service is horrible. Because we had an event the night of arrival, we decided to Valet park. The valet workers were amazingly lazy! We asked for rooms near the other parties traveling with us. NO! When we made the reservations (3 months in advance), I requested a fridge and was told I would have one. No fridge. Called to get one at 7pm, they apoligized and said one was on the way. She reminded me of the fee, I said, I am aware of that. She said, "How am I to know that you are aware of that"? Do these people need a job!!!! NO FRIDGE at 9:30pm. Called again, they said they had been out of them since 3pm that day. SO WHY DID YOU TELL ME ONE WAS ON ITS WAY!! So, they promised to give me one the next day. Oh, but, they said I could empty out the minibar, use it as my fridge, and pay the restocking fee for ALL the items!! REALLY!!!! No fridge the next day. So they offered to let me use the minibar free of charge. Why, because, although I was first in line to get the fridge, they gave them out to other guests due to bad communication. Next, went to move my car out of valet since it is so darn expensive. Took them 30 minutes to get my car. NOT one person was there waiting for their car. Do not order room service! One hour wait for disgusting food. So, get my bill. Was charged for 3 nights of valet. WHAT????? Got that taken care of. HOW MUCH TIME DID I WASTE FIGHTING WITH THESE PEOPLE????? A LOT. The parking staff was inappropriately joking and flirting with all the guests and they seemed to have better things to do. It seems the Hilton Anatole spent all the money on decorations and art. They sure left little budget for staff. HORRIBLE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing minus the cheerleaders”
Reviews.Author: shaysmarch74
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time! The staff was friendly, helpful and always greeted us with a smile. The Gossip Bar was perfect for a calm drink and The Media Grill does a great steak. It's so close to downtown that the cab ride was only about $10 after the tip. I found the bed to be very comfortable, but my boyfriend (who has a bad back) did not agree. We will be staying here again! I only hope that when we return, there will not be a national cheer event going on. Hundreds of little teenie boppers running around all weekend....You can imagine. Definitely could have done without all of that. I'm sure without the cheers and ponytails it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, bad location”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a beautiful corner suite in the tower. Room was well appointed facing downtown and very large. Had drinks and a mid-night snack at the media bar. Service was very good but the waitress I do not think has ever served anyone before. We shared a bottle of wine, and I did not know a bottle of wine could fit into 2 glasses. But if you poor them to the top like it was a beer they pretty much hold almost the bottle. The hotel is a little way outside of downtown but is across the street from the major hospitals in Dallas. The hotel grounds are beautiful and very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Find a different Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMomof4
Reviews.Content: This place is over priced....bad service.....rude people...nothing close to hotel except a Denny's and sketchy part of town! We got a room in the atrium with interstate on other side, we were suppose to have a tower room! People(TONS of KIDS) in the atrium were yelling and with the echos it was SO SUPER LOUD till 3 am every morning!....housekeeping sucked(either didnt come or didn't bring basics...like tissues)....a beer was $6.25 and took 20 min to get(honestly there were only 10 people in the bar)....some people we traveled with arrived around 7, room wasnt ready, then they ended up getting a 1 bed suite(for 4 people)...the people who worked there were rude and not helpful! Called and asked about download speeds on internet service...talked to 4 different hotel people...nobody knew...they transfered me to the internet provider...they only showed 1 internet connection for the hotel...not 3, they had NO idea what the 3 internet choices this hotel offer were or download speeds.Called back to office...lady said she would comp the internet for the remaining of our stay...2days, because at this time I had been on the phone for over 1.0 hours just trying to find download speeds...then guess what, at check out, I was charged not compted for the internet...called the front, the lady was very rude!!!! That part of town is not nice and there is NOTHING close! The food in hotel was overpriced, and not very good! Everything costs...EVERYTHING! There are many choices in Dallas go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed hotel's amenities and services”
Reviews.Author: LarBel1219
Reviews.Content: First of all, our room in the tower was not dated. Theme in room tied into with theme throughout whole hotel. I enjoyed the uniqueness of the frame on the bathroom mirrors and the uniqueness of the wall bathroom light a pleasant change from ordinary, standard bathroom amenities. Likewise appreciated the ottoman in our room to rest our feet and/or use as a luggage rack. Good size flat screen TV and huge guest room. Also, really appreciated the fine, friendly, professional service at the Front Desk, the Garden Terrace restaurant, the Media Lounge and Bar, and the Etc. Gift Shop. I would indeed stay there again and recommend it to friends and others. Nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Size doesn't matter”
Reviews.Author: Nataly_Wonderer
Reviews.Content: This is probably the biggest hotel I've stayed at in my life. The hallway at the hotel lobby is huge and almost makes you feel like you are getting lost when you reach the middle. However, the size really doesn't matter. I value hotels for their comfort and service. And, this hotel was very good. I checked in at about 5 pm and paid for parking ($17) right away. This was high, but a kind of expected. My room was large and clean and had everything you'd expect at a Hilton. I had a busy night with my colleagues and returned back late. I was absolutely wonderful to dive into the comfortable bed. I had a good night sleep. I had some other business in the morning and used their automatic phone check out option that was easy. The only part, which concerned me was a strange charge that appeared on my credit card a couple of days later. I called the hotel and they said "it was the mini-bar charge". That was a surprise, because I hadn't used the mini-bar. The charge was around $15 bucks and I asked to credit it back. They didn't argue and said they would. Other than that everything was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better hotels in Dallas. Very dated rooms. Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: SDSpartan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Anatole for the Super Bowl for 4 nights. Disappointed in the rooms. The hotel itself - publics areas is nice and large, with lots of restaurant choices and good people watching. However, we had 2 rooms (avoid at all costs the handicap room if offered to you - it is horrible - worst bed I've been in and I was in Ecuador recently). Really amazing the bed could be that poor! The second room we had was a King bed in the atrium area - the bed was better, but really not what I thought would be up to "Hilton" standards. I've had better beds at a Holiday Inn Express!! Truly disappointin. The room was sorely in need of upgrades. It was probably nice 10-15 years ago. The bathroom was tight - tub/shower and toilet combo - hardly any room to move and we not large people. The first room was dirty (some left chewing gum on the themostat, which was not removed). The second room was better maintained. There is a nice flat screen TV. The furnishings were worn and outdated. We did have a pretty good view from the 2nd room. Perhaps the Tower rooms are nicer - try to get one of those. We really didn't have an issue with noise and mainteance responded quickly when there was a problem with our themostat. The front desk was hit or miss. Best front desk clerk - Hon! Rest were pretty poor customer servie and down and out lied to us at one point. The security was great. The parking - OK - $17 self park and I can'[t recall what valet was. They do seem to nickle and dime you - internt in room (not WiFI - really? This is 2011) was of several varying prices. You could get free WiFi in the lobby area. Nice gym facility. There is an indoor pool. The Media Bar & Grill was fun and good food. So was the casual self serve eatery. We liked the Coors Light Sports Bar that was in the basement - cool feel. The Terrace Restaurant was OK -a bit pricey. Ate at Nana's Restaurant on te 26th floor - awesome views of the town, but a bit disappointing in terms of food quality - service was excellent though. Overall, I would NOT return until they remodel all the rooms. We stay in nice hotels and this did not make up to anything we have been in recently (Westin, Peabody, Marriott and even the Holiday Inn Express). I would look elsewhere. They did give you a paper each day (which was nice) and free coffee and tea in the room. There is the mini bar fridge, but I do have to say it seemed a bit outdated. They should take a cue from the Peabody and have the "fill the fridge" program.

Reviews.Title: “where's the GM of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickpp
Reviews.Content: so there is a few inches of ice on the entrance/driveway leading up to the hotel; staff says there are no snow shovels or salt to help clean up the area so that no one will slip. hotel is packed to the gill - as it's superbowl weekend. Wouldn't you think that the GM of the hotel would have enough sense to go to home depot and pick up a few flat shovels to clean up the area - well he didn't! other than that the hotel was good, inside staff and valets were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in spite of Superbowl”
Reviews.Author: kathyhouston
Reviews.Content: Arrived on March 3 during the roll-up to Superbowl. Only one clerk on the desk but eventually got processed. Was happy to see guards on the elevator banks to keep folks who are not guests of the hotel from accessing the sleeping floors. We expected a frantic scene but other than the festivity you would expect for the event, it was a well controlled and monitored property. Used Hilton points (I am a Diamond member) and was delighted to even be assigned a room. My Atrium room was clean, modern, well equipped and, most importantly, QUIET. Yes, the volume of conversations/daily activity travels up quite surprisingly. Once we closed our hotel door, it was shocking how quiet the room was. During the 3 nights in residence, not one disturbed sleep. I spend approximately 150 nights/year in hotels so I am a pretty tough critic -- Hilton Anatole delivered what they are in the business to do. You don't often find that kind of consistency -- particularly during events like Superbowl.

Reviews.Title: “Under staffed and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Katalah
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Atrium, asked for Tower but was denied. Very loud at all hours of the night. Everything that goes on in the atrium echo's all the way up. At 6am the fire alarms went off. There was some muffled intercom announcement, but you could not understand what it was saying. Not knowing if it was a real fire or not, I called the front desk. Was told to evacuate the room and come to the lobby, via stairway. 9 floors down we arrive in Lobby. One other guest is standing there and we were told it was a false alarm, even though 5 minutes earlier I was told to evacuate. This hotel was full and only 3 guest would have survived had this been a real fire because no one heard what they were suppose to do. Every night all restaurants had a minimum 1 hour wait (understaffed) and it's not like you can walk to any other place to eat. I left my phone charger in the room after I checked out, called that night and was told "someone else has checked into that room, we can't go and look to see if it's there" I asked if they could ask housekeeping to see if anything had been turned in or look to see if it's still plugged in when they clean in the morning and was told by security "we don't have control over housekeeping, we can't even understand them". Really nice response. Stay away from this property, it is not the flagship hotel it use to be.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels looks nice, but service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: traveldiva365
Reviews.Content: I was impressed at how beautiful the hotels looks from the outside, and all the decor on the inside. And for the price (close to $200) you expect things to go smoothly. Checked in on 12/31/10 and wanted to stay at the Hilton to just relax and use the spa and fitness center. We paid extra just to use the fitness club. From the time we got there, everything went wrong. To sum up, they got our reservations wrong, booked a corner room but instead got an interior room on the executive level. We specifically told the booking agent that we wanted to use the spa and fitness center and when we got there the facility was closed. Then we didn't get our breakfast coupons, and manager at the restaurant pretty much look at us like we were trying to eat for free. Front desk finally took care of it and gave us the coupons. But only after 30 mins of talking to the mgr from the restaurant and he wanted to escort me to the front desk. How insulting! As if I wanted to run off from a $40 bill! Then we were supposed to have late check out at 4pm the next day. The front desk said they will note my account. We went to use the spa the next day. Our room keys stop working at noon, and my boy friend was stuck outside the room. Security made me get out of my spa treatment and walk ALL the way back to the front desk with my wet hair to show them my ID so they can let us into our own room. It was a disaster. For the price I pay, I would go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alittledabble
Reviews.Content: I kept hearing how great this hotel was, but honestly was just expecting a typically nice chain hotel. This place is anything but cookie cutter. The design is simply lovely. It's clearly been remodeled and they did and impeccable job that really made my stay. Lots of restaurants/bars/shops, but I was really impressed with all of the Asian art and the extra design touches in the room that really made it feel like a boutique hotel. Would love to stay here again. A bonus was that we had a view of downtown and could watch the New Year's Eve fireworks from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: jrmcd52
Reviews.Content: I arrived the Sunday after Thanksgiving to find an empty and deserted hotel. Like 3 cars in a massive parking lot. I had pre-paid for an a suite on the top floors but was told my only option was on the 4th floor. The room was OK but with a very small TV. The only restaurant open was MEDIA. Pretty much empty yet hard to get service. Several employees standing around talking yet ignoring the few customers they had. The food was OK at best. As a Hilton Honors Silver VIP I had pre-ordered some items for the room which did not arrive until 8 hours after check-in and the grapes on the tray were moldy. The Executive Lounge was the saving grace. Brandon was helpful and friendly but the food was sparse and alittle tragic. I will say room service was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: krb5000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Anatole for a birthday party in Dallas. The hotel is in a good location and is nicely decorated. One problem that I had with the Anatole was having to pay $17.00 a day for parking. I think this is steep for a hotel that has plenty of parking. When we stayed at the Anatole they had to test the fire alarms at 9:00 am. I have no problem with testing the alarms but they should have put out free coffee, juice and donuts for testing the alarm at 9:00 am. I thought not having something out for the inconvenience showed poor management!

Reviews.Title: “Classey! Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMBrooks
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the Anatole - I was amazed at the hotel. Such glamor and style. It is a trip to visit in it's self with all the art work - the pieces of the Berlin wall - a 5 million dollar painting in the Nana's bar. The service was awesome- every one was so polite and helpful. Room service was the very best. The only down fall was there was no internet included on our business room - they wanted to charge and over the top amount for each person and I had to use my black berry as my connection. Everything thing else was wonderful place to sleep - super super clean. The bathrooms were a nice big roomy area - the beds slept great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: carryon101
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled with my stay at Hilton Anatole. I was upgraded to a gorgeous corner room and the decor was fabulous. I had executive lounge access and also ordered room service and the staff were very attentive and welcoming. Would definitely recommend and stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed.....initially”
Reviews.Author: ACOOK392010
Reviews.Content: To be fair I must say I am still in my 1st night here at the Hilton Anatole. And I was initially very impressed with the service, the quick check in, and the gorgeous room and I cant say enough about the bathroom. But after being here for about 8 hours, my opinion is changing rapidly. #1 There is nothing near this hotel! Not a convenience store, a gas station, nothing. There is a Dennys about two blocks down the road. I ended up paying $28 roundtrip for a cab ride to Walmart to pick up bottled water and snacks so I could save some money. #2 Im here for a conference, which held a reception tonight at 5. I attempt to take a shower at 3:30. To my disbelief, the shower water begins to pool around my toes, then my feet, in minutes it was up to my ankles! I call down and fortunately, the repair man is here in minutes. Unfortunately, it takes him and his partner TWO HOURS to fix it. I know what you are saying, change rooms right? Well, considering what I went through to navigate this massive hotel with all my crap I said forget it. #3 The maintenance man calls down to have Housekeeping come tidy up the bathroom at 5:55pm. I hear them say 10-4 on the radio. At 6:30 I am still waiting on Housekeeping. I call down to that department and the woman tells me they have no record of the call! UNBELIEVABLE! So needless to say, I have some explaining to do to my boss as to why on the very first day of the conference I was not seen or heard from at the reception. Keep in mind this is DAY ONE. When I called down to the Manager, she said she will see about compensating me half a nights stay. I guess that covers my taxi fares for the day. I dread to think about what tomorrow is going to be bring. My advice from here on out, check your shower as soon as you get in your room! And by the way....you pay for EVERYTHING and it is very pricey! Water, snacks, INTERNET, EVERYTHING!

Reviews.Title: “A Disapponting Hilton Experience in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: janderson27
Reviews.Content: 1. The wireless internet signal was so poor in my room I could not establish a reliable connection. The signal strength was over 85% in the hallway on the 24th floor, but under 50% in my room . I called the hotel Hilton Honors member customer hservice line to report the issue. I did receive a VM response later that a technician was dispatched to investigate and everything checked out fine. Evidently, the technician never entered my room to check the signal strength, for if they had done so they would have easily observed the inadequate wireless signal. 2. My room adjoined room to another on the 24th floor (executive floor) with a doorway that linked the rooms. The sound barrier between the rooms was extremely poor, as the sound from their TV proliferated my room. Even the coughing from the adjoining room sounded like it was coming from someone in my room. 3. I called before my stay to inquire about getting a refrigerator so that I could keep cold a dietary supplement prescribed by my doctor. I was told by the Hilton employee on the phone that I could utilize the refreshment center refrigerator as it had available room. I utilized the refrigerator as directed, but to my dismay my perishable dietary supplement was removed and placed on the counter to spoil. If the hotel staff was going to remove my items, AT LEAST they could have placed them on ice. Even the complementary bottled water provided to me by the hotel for being a Hilton Honors guest was removed from the refrigerator. This action simply infuriated me. 4. I visited the front desk this evening to pay for some incidentals charged to my room. I had to wait in line for 15 minutes in the Hilton Honors line since the main desk was only staffed with one clerk. To further exacerbate the situation, the desk clerk was unable to accept cash for she had no change. Absolutely unacceptable for a Hilton property of this category. 5. Numerous times I entered the hotel lobby with my arms full, but not ONCE did the bellmen or valet parking staff make an effort to open the doors for me. I have NEVER had that happen at any Hilton Hotel. A complete neglect of a basic common courtesy. 6. Speaking of parking, this hotel property has acres of parking that was mostly empty, yet they feel the need to charge $17 a night for self parking. I see now why this property had an extremely high vacancy rate. If they treat Hhonors members this way, I pity the guests without frequest traveler status. 7. The layout of the rooms is such that the HVAC blasts you when working at the desk, making you too hot or too cold.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel. Not sure why everyone is complaining!”
Reviews.Author: BearVA
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to read the reviews of this hotel. I attended a convention at the Hilton Anatole during a very busy weekend in October and loved it. I stayed in the tower, which has a separate check-in area from the atrium. Line was long but moved quickly. In fact, I've never seen people get checked in so fast during a rush. Bravo! Room seemed to be recently refurbished and had all of your basic Hilton amenities. The health club is amazing. You must check it out if you're into exercise. I did not like paying for parking in what should be a free lot. Boo!

Reviews.Title: “Emplyees of the parking lot are in aggrement with theft gangs and posibly the security as well”
Reviews.Author: mr_garcia5089
Reviews.Content: I stay for 3 day to attend a big anual convention and I pay fee for parking and My truck was brake in and my DVR/ stereo system stoled, and there ware 10 similar cases in the same night according to the sherift who come to take my report is not a considence, these employees and security peronnel are geting a cut from the proofits because in not posible that this is happening in the big hotel. I never will recomend a friend to stay here. and worst of this that management don't do any thig about it, there not even lisent to your arguments, and not even to help you call the police. is terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and Far From Downtown”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithmike
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, if slightly dated facility. The front desk service was slow (10 minutes for check in) and unfriendly. There is a significant construction going on between the atrium and the tower which is a bit of an annoyance, but there's likely no way around it during renovations. The only other downside of the hotel is that there is nothing within walking distance. The best upside was the 102" flat screen TV in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Possible bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Rh0nda46
Reviews.Content: When I was at this hotel my towels were covered in little brown bugs. I have no idea what bed bugs look like but I hope not like that. I threw them out of my room which I'm sure is not very considerate to other guests, but I did not want to take home any bugs! I didn't notice any bugs in my bed and I inspected every piece of luggage and clothing while packing to ensure there were no bugs with me. For me, any hotel that has that many little brown bugs crawling on the towels they put in your room is too uncleanly for future service. The fact that they may have been bed bugs should scare you.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff made our 1st time stay a great one”
Reviews.Author: KM6881
Reviews.Content: I had traveled for the first time into Texas and this would also be the first time staying in a Hilton facility. My colleagues and I came in for a convention and as soon as we stepped onto the property, we were greeted with nothing but smiles. The woman who checked us in Friday evening (10/22) showed us such great hospitality that I regret not getting her name. I hope this gets back to her that she started our weekend off right! The lobby and all areas of the main level was so clean and well kept that we did not even notice there was construction going on in a large part of it until someone pointed it out. Gorgeous sitting area by the Media Grill Bar, where we had dinner.... but unfortunately, service there was not as friendly as everywhere else in the hotel. Food was good, dessert was awesome. I also regret, due to our back to back to back itinerary throughout our stay, that we did not get to fully utilize everything offered by the hotel (fitness area, pool, etc). Our room was great, though we found our view to be hilarious: It was of a roof... not a rooftop deck (which sounds nice), just a roof & fire escape so if you're looking for something with a view, avoid room 312. Couldn't say much about maid service bc it seems like they just made the bed and left. Our old towels were still left where we put them.... though it wasn't a big deal. The front desk was extremely friendly and helpful with our inquiries and though I was not present upon check out, my roommate did not have any complaints. I had also realized I'd left items in the room upon arriving home, but received them promptly via UPS with the great assistance of the Lost & Found Dept. MANY thanks to you all as these are very sentimental items! I'd definitely return to the Hilton if we should be in Dallas again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: matthewedward
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler this place was more than nice and certainly fit my needs. Nice gym, friendly service and kept up very nicely. If you plan to stay for pleasure be warned that the food prices are ridiculously high, portions were small and the quality was average. Do not eat at the hotel! Otherwise, this place is neat, clean and in very good shape. I guess I need to mention that there was construction going on but it didn't bother me at all because I requested to be placed in a tower away from the work. I recommend you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel that was good but some issues”
Reviews.Author: citymouse7
Reviews.Content: I was here for a meeting and I can say that overall it was a nice hotel. It's divided into Atrium and Tower. If you can stay in the Tower I would urge you to. The Atrium rooms, as with most atrium hotels, were incredibly noisy. The noise filtered up from lobby bar at night. Also the walls between the rooms were paper thin. I did not quite enjoy hearing my neighbor clearing his throat and spitting each morning but it was unavoidable. As it was a business event, the meals were provided to us. The scrambled eggs each morning were oddly runny. But the soups were amazing. Each day we had a soup and let me tell you, they were great. There is not a lot of outside space though they do have a few small paths in the sculpture garden. In the interest of getting some exercise, I ended up on a service road by mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it better than the reviews...”
Reviews.Author: adinaw
Reviews.Content: You know when you read these reviews and five of them in a row are not so good you might think this place is going to be really bad, and when you stay there it really is much better than they lead you to believe. That is this place.....This hotel has a 1980's vibe to it, but the design is classic so you don't mind it so much. There are asian details everywhere that are interesting the public areas are huge and you know they must host many large conventions probably several at one time. The construction that they are doing in the lobby is way out of the way and from what I could tell is going to be great. We stayed in the tower wing..it is a wing and a long walk from the main check in..by the way you can check in in the lobby of the tower also, we did not know that. Our room was great, well done, loved the colors and looked like it had been updated....ask for an recently updated room when you book. We had a function in the garden one night with a large group and the food and service was nice. Ok this is my only gripe...we received two breakfast tickets with our room so we went down the first morning and stood in line at the Terrace Restaurant for a good 15 to 20 min.. the line never moved we had to be somewhere and did not want to be late so we left. The next morning we had time so we waited in line again, and waited, it was nuts....Nobody told us how long we might have to wait...finally we got to the lady who took us to a table the told us we would have to go get back in the line for the breakfast buffet . We could not figure out what was taking so long, it's a buffet...They had the entire line waiting for the people who wanted to get an omelet , they made them one at a time, even if you did not want a omelet you had to stand in line and watch while they did this....Ok, moral of the story skip the room rate with the breakfast included unless you enjoy standing in lines. Other than that I enjoyed this busy, large Texas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: mgips
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole from October 10-15 for a large convention/trade show being held at the Dallas Convention Center a few miles away. I had stayed at the hotel several years previously, and I instantly recalled what I liked and didn't like about it. The big plus: the gym. The big minus: its location along a highway that makes even a jaunt across the street a cab ride away. I arrived a day before the crush of trade show attendees were due to show up, but there was still a long line at reception. Only two desk clerks were on duty, and one seemed to be occupied solely by guests who had already checked in but had complaints or requests. After about 20 minutes, I had finally checked in, but for the life of me I could not find the elevators. It's a large property with a huge atrium, and several areas were walled off for construction. The big problem, however, was that hundreds (if not thousands) of high school students were in the hotel for some sort of conference. They swarmed everywhere, blocking every entrance and corridor, some camping out on the floor with sleeping bags and pillows. They were friendly enough, but made it difficult to navigate. After walking a few hundred yards to the tower portion of the hotel, I was directed back to where I started--in the atrium--dragging my bags and having to navigate through throngs of high schoolers again. My room itself was nice and fairly spacious--plenty clean and no real complaints. The only significant irritant was that the walls were paper thin--I could hear everything going on next door, and I was grateful I wasn't sharing a wall with honeymooners. Another minor hiccup--pun intended--was that the wet bar refrigerator wouldn't open. Because I worked late every night, I took a couple of dinners in my room. Room service seemed overworked, if friendly, and the orders took longer than expected (an hour). Food was uninspired but OK. Dinner at one of the restaurants below was a lot better. The real jewel of the property is the spa and health club behind the towers, and the outdoor track that undulates through a pretty patch of lawn. Though the health club carries an extra fee, it offers a full-court basketball facility, a boxing gym, squash courts, a pool, aerobics classes, and a large selection of weights and cardio machines. To sum up, this is a spacious property that is nicely maintained, but it's lobbies are reminiscent of the cattle drives you'd see elsewhere in the state. It's also "ghettoized" along with other upper-end lodging properties along a highway. The facilities, especially the gym, are top-notch, though.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready to be nickel and dimed.”
Reviews.Author: matthew2424
Reviews.Content: Cons: Internet is not free. Fitness center is not free. Parking is 17 a day for self parking. 20 breakfast that was under par at best. Construction that starts way too early in the morning and smells the place up. Oh and extra charges on my bill for a restaurant that I never even went to. Overpriced for a decent room and too many charges for things that are free at most other Hiltons. Pros: The rooms were clean. The staff did fix my bill quickly but be sure and check your's carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable Hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: SDallas
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nicely decorated and except for no robe and better bath soaps, I would have put it at 4star. The service was more 3 star, though. Nobody went out of their way to welcome or greet, it was just efficient. The hotel itself is pretty with lots of Asian artwork and sculpture. The renovation wasn't done, but it should be beautiful when it is. The spa treatment rooms are nice, but you have to go downstairs to the workout facility to use the showers. The showers feel more like a workout facility than a spa. This hotel is great for large groups, but it lacks a boutique-y feel I prefer for a staycation.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why parking is so costly here”
Reviews.Author: Minnisnowda
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel. The rooms are very clean and tidy with a little bit of gaudy, Texas flair on the inside. The HHonors VIP Lounge affords great views of downtown and Oak Lawn. The location is very close to Oak Lawn and not far from downtown. With that said this is NOT downtown nor in a very populated area (it's a strip of hotels) adjacent to the design district which is all warehouses. So why is parking $17/night for self parking? I would still recommend if your travels require you to be in the Oak Lawn area.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to be Nickeled and Dimed to Death”
Reviews.Author: msscorpio77
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: The Hilton Anatole is a nice hotel full of decorative sculptures, art work, and landscaping. All of the staff I came in contact with was very helpful, friendly, and courteous. The hotel lobby and rooms were clean. THE BAD: The outside pool was nasty though. We never saw any of the restaurantsâ€™ or bars open, not sure if this was because it was the weekend or not. The major downfall to this place is they nickel and dime you to death charging EXTRA for parking, internet, use of the fitness club, pool, and donâ€™t touch anything the mini-bar. They donâ€™t offer free shuttle services. They donâ€™t offer anything free. I moved some stuff around to chill a bottle of wine that I had brought for our stay. I didnâ€™t know each item in the refrigerator had sensors on them. I was charged for everything I moved around to chill that bottle of wine, just ridiculous. I used Price Line to book the room, but once we checked in we were told we had to have a credit card on file. They immediately charged $100 to it right away and didnâ€™t even ask us or let us know they would be doing that. Next we were immediately charged $38 for two days of parking. $138 on top of the price we paid to stay here for two night and we hadnâ€™t even taken a suite case to our room yet. Then of course they added all of the mini bar charges, because I moved the stuff around setting all of the sensors off. Once they charged my credit card for those mini bar charges, they explained how they would be refunded in 7 to 10 business days. I definitely wonâ€™t be back and I wouldnâ€™t suggest staying here unless money is of no object and/or youâ€™re a huge Asian art lover.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location, overpriced, too large, no shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: downeasttraveler053
Reviews.Content: Two colleagues and I stayed at the Anatole September 10-15, 2010. It was a dreadful stay. There was construction below our room that kept us awake. We had to take a taxi to and from ANYWHERE, due to the poor location of the Anatole. They had no shuttles. You had to pay to watch virtually ANYTHING on TV. I mean, really a few reruns of Bewitched and some NBC news would be nice. There wasn't even a telephone book in the rooms, and no instructional booklet telling you what was where. With over 1,600 rooms, you needed a map! WiFi was pay as you go, and expensive. There weren't enough restaurants on site to accommodate the conference attendees, and not time to go offsite during lunch. The health club was separate, and you had to pay for that also. It was only moderately clean. Never again! The only good thing I can say is that the staff was friendly and helpful. Roger W. Quirk Lubec, Maine

Reviews.Title: “Good meeting stop over, close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: zmn4500
Reviews.Content: We stayed for here for a three day conference. Construction is on going, but had little affect on meeting or sleep. Room was in the tower (25th floor) and was comfortable and clean. Business rooms were adequate, and hotel capable of handling large groups. Concierge not very helpful, but rest of staff outstanding with their service. I had two unusual requests, and both were completed perfectly. Good location if convention time allows trip to downtown ............. very easy to see the sights. New Cowboy Stadium only 20 minutes away. If your company has a choice, this is a good one for casual corporate meetings. Take at least one break, and check out the view from the rooftop restaurant at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJack2009
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Dallas and stayed 3 nights at the Hilton Anatole. We had a great time and the room was very large and freshly decorated. We stayed in the tower (away from the construction) and all was quiet. This is a very LARGE hotel and the construction is scheduled to be done by Sept. 15, but I wouldn't count on that....seemed like it would take a bit longer than that to finish. The first night was a bit rough with the two different very large conventions going on at the hotel and the elevators were a bit jammed up (took several minutes to get an available one) at 6 pm, but after they left we had a very quiet time and great service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “MK Seminar 2010”
Reviews.Author: MKDEE312
Reviews.Content: Currently under construction, but still an audacious place to stay. Home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollyeH
Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay here for any amount of Money! Our bed was so worn out it was like sleeping in a hole...My back was aching at 6 am... The Manager moved us to a different room after I called the front desk and complained...The second room the Bath Tub had rusted and they sprayed it with spray paint...I noticed something floating in my bath water, then I realized it was paint peeling off the bottom of the tub..The Atrium is under construction and the dust in the hallway filled the air...At 8 am the construction crew was so loud. We were wide awake! The parking was an extra $17 dollars a night.. This was the worst Hotel I have ever stayed in..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but watch the slick floors!”
Reviews.Author: kdie123
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff is great. BUT the floors are extremely slick in the bathrooms. My friends and I came to Dallas for my birthday and stayed at the hotel. Before a day of shopping, one of my friends went to shower and when she stepped out of the tub...she went to the ground. The floor was so slick that she lost her footing and fell. I HIGHLY recommend to take something to stand on when getting out of the tub! The little bathmat doesn't do it!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dion2010
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I stayed at the Anatole and it was just as good as the first time. I was there with my girfriends and we had a blast. The staff was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “It's a murphy bed?!”
Reviews.Author: PGilchrist
Reviews.Content: After arriving late after another 3+ hr delay leaving EWR I arrived around 2am. After finally finding the check in I got to my room. Open the door, down a long coridoor, can't find a light and enter this weird room with no bed. Finally find a light and note this large queens sized bed shaped door. So I'm wondering if its the coolest door ever into a huge bedroom or is it perhaps a Hilton with a murphy bed. Well as you guessed its a murphy bed, a comfortable one, but slightly strange. The next morning I walked around this incredibly large hotel that has an amazing array of facilities. I did however end up at the Denny's across the parking lot for breakfast.
