This should tell you about how easy a cheap breakfast is at the hotel. There are a few different eating options here, and a few different drinking options. All have pros and cons, none are cheap. An excellent array of beers between the different places however. To sum it up, this hotel has a lot of features, just hope that someone else is paying. Don't be expecting Texas either its more elephants and bamboo.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with everything”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Anatole is a beautiful hotel. My room was in the tower portion and was true class in its amenities. I loved everything about it. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is amazing. The hotel isn't within walking distance to anything. I do know Dallas well enough to know the area in which it sits isn't great. You can feel safe in staying at this Hilton, but don't go walking under the interstate or beyond the hotel grounds. There is a wonderful athletic club adjacent to the hotel that is great in everyway. Hilton Gold will enable you to have complimentary access to the club. You will find an indoor pool, spin cycles, treadmills, an indoor track, and spa services. In between the hotel and the walk to the athletic club there is a paved running path. The hotel is under renovations in one of the atriums. I heard this property will be the Super Bowl Hotel Head Quarters, which is why they are having the renovations. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good service but lots of add on costs”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveler1956
Reviews.Content: Room was ok but a little worn. Very small bathroom. Comfortable bed. Helpful staff. As others have mentioned there are a lot of add on costs, parking, internet, work out room. It is under renovation. The hallways in the atrium are very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but goofy”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole in Dallas, Texas for 4 nights at the end of June 2010. I'm a buyer, and my trade show was just across the freeway at the World Trade Center. Location is outstanding. Hotel staff is as helpful as I've seen at any large hotel. If this is the location you need, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to Club level”
Reviews.Author: wildflower-Frisco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned last weekend from a Saturday night stay. There are numerous wedding receptions and guests associated with events. As you can imagine, we were awaken every 45 minutes by people in loud voices calling--or yelling-- to each other in the hall. If you have the money or the Hilton points please upgrade--or you will be awaken many times during the night. My husband and I have stayed at at least 25 Hilton properties and never had this problem in the past. It makes for a much more relaxing stay on a Fri or Sat night.

Reviews.Title: “It Certainly Didn't Wow Me”
Reviews.Author: azjeans
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole as part of a conference for four nights. I was really looking forward to my stay because it looked like a great property. Well, the property has some pluses and some minus. Hereâ€™s the good: - For a conference location, it is a good one â€“ lots of spaces, a little spread out, but good variety. - The food at the conference events was very good as was the service - The amount of unique artwork at the property is amazing â€“ lots to look at. - The Media Bar is a fun place to hang out and have a drink and watch a game. - The Gossip Bar though I didnâ€™t visit also looked fun whenever I walked by. Hereâ€™s the not so good and what could be improved: - The hotel is currently undergoing renovation on one of its wings. I donâ€™t think the website makes mention of this, though I could be wrong. This isnâ€™t really an issue other than hearing some construction noises when walking to the Tower or conference center. - The hotel is rather isolated from other places so unless you have a car or want to take a cab, there isnâ€™t much nearby. - My room was in the atrium, it was great size, but the bathroom was very small, especially, for a Hilton and what is supposed to be a high-caliber property. You had to close the door to use the bathroom. - Though there were 5 lights in the room, it still seemed very dark to me. - The housekeeping service was very odd. For example, the majority of the days, the housekeepers came down the hall early â€“ weâ€™re talking 7-7:30 a.m. I had a do not disturb sign out, but they came to other rooms nearby and you could hear them. They also would do afternoon room checks. Also, the last day of housekeeping left a lot to be desired â€“ towels were replaced except for washcloths. The toilet seat was left up with toilet paper in it, some of my drawers â€“ night stand and dresser were open (even though I didnâ€™t have anything in them). - Also, Iâ€™m not sure what happened but two of the days my wake-up calls worked and two of the other days they didnâ€™t. Would I stay here again? Perhaps if I had another conference though I would probably want to request a room in the tower as they seemed to have bigger bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here This Summer”
Reviews.Author: almychrn
Reviews.Content: Just so you know . . . a large part of this hotel is being renovated. This may affect the quality of your stay. Nothing is posted on the website, so it will come as a surprise to many after they arrive. There are 10 shops shown on the website facilities map. Only 2 are in operation. 3 restaurant/bars are closed. As the spouse of someone at a convention and in meetings all day, it left very little to explore. I was told this renovation is supposed to be finished in September. Otherwise . . . The hotel is close to the interstate. A taxi is a must to go anywhere but the hotel grounds. Pool bar was not open. The hotel has rooms in the very center of the hotel floors, which means you may end up with a room with no windows as we initially did. We were offered a room in the atrium area but were informed the construction work begins at 6:30 a.m. Hotel staff was very friendly. Elevators are quick and there are many of them. Eventual room was nice, even tho it was a *handicapped accessible* room. Good beds. Gossip Bar is fun and good, along with The Media Restaurant. Nana is awesome in terms of the view, particularly at night where you can see downtown Dallas and the light show from many of the buildings. But don't eat there. Food is WAY over priced, and steaks didn't arrive cooked as ordered. There is nothing common on the menu. It's very fru fru. I had hoped for a simple fillet, and ended up having to get one with blue cheese and caramel vinegrette. It wasn't good at all! A glass of wine took 15 minutes to arrive - and even then we had to ask the waiter when we would get it. Parking is $25 per day. And you have to pay $17 per day to get internet in your room. All in all, I wouldn't stay here again . . . unless I'm on a convention trip with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, upscale business hotel”
Reviews.Author: empjm
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights for business meeting. Our room was in the tower. Very spacious room with two double beds. Bathroom was large with two sinks and plenty of countertop and storage. Small coffee maker, fridge and safe in room. Large closet. Parking was free with our meeting but it looks like they normally charge $17/night for self-park. Short drive or taxi ride to downtown Dallas with many restaurants to choose from. Our favorites were Trulock's for nice dinner and Sonny Bryan's on Inwood for BBQ lunch. We paid $18 extra a night for access to executive lounge on 25th floor. Nice quiet spot for continental breakfast in morning and snacks in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “If the Hotel is Like the Restaurant-- STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Torchness
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel to have lunch today with my Grandfather, who was in town for a conference. First, parking is impossible. Though there is ample space for parking, one must meander through a convoluted maze to find an entry gate, so that the hotel may charge you $17 per day to park on land that is, frankly, not valuable. Luckily, parking was free for me since I had my ticket validated. But still. Not a great start. The hotel is massive and lovely inside. It is a gigantic complex. However, something quite curious arises. There is only one-- yes, one-- restaurant in the hotel in which to have lunch. A small trendy sports bar type place is the only place where any of the hundreds of guests may go to have lunch. There are no restaurants within walking distance. Thus, my grandfather and I went to the restaurant to attempt to have lunch. At 12 noon, there were no tables. After being promised a 15 minute wait, we were finally seated after waiting for 35 minutes. Our waiter could not have been more disinterested. We finally had to beg for some water and for him to take our order. 30 minutes later, our sandwiches arrived (did they bake the bread that day?). I felt awkward because there was a woman sitting next to us who had been ignored by the server for at least 20 minutes. This hotel is expensive and opulent. And yet, they do lunch so poorly. Save your money, try somewhere else. Because if they mess up something this small so badly, how on earth can they get the larger things right?

Reviews.Title: “Finest Museum I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: AprilAllYear
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed in this hotel several times, because it is a destination in itself and never ending in delights. it's been my birthday present the past two years. The art, mostly Asian, is unparalleled in any hotel I can imagine. I understand from previous discussions with staff that this hotel is privately owned by Margaret Trammel and her private collection adorns the walls, grounds, etc. And the decor of the hotel reflects the beauty and style of the art. This hotel is really three buildings: the tower, or tallest building, is the most amazing in art, I think, but the whole property, including the grounds, is a walk through delightful art. Most visits we make, we spend at least 4 hours looking at the art. Since my kids (now 11 and 13) have been 3 times, this time we decided to explore the swimming pools, also, and found a whole new reason to visit! There are 3 pools on the property, one being very large and outdoors with a swim up bar (empty, unless there's a party, I think), one small pool tucked into a corner of one building, and their spa pool, which is for swimming laps but has the added bonus of a beautiful women's area with steam room, hot tub and plush bathroom/shower facilities (there's another very nice hot tub and steam room, also pleasant and somewhat bigger, out by the pool that is co-ed). Their spa and exercise facilities have just been remodeled, and are luxurious. There is a pretty, manicured park with a walking/running surfaced loop as well as concrete sidewalk winding around and through it, adorned with delightful and surprising sculptures ranging from large, marble elephants to a shockingly large part of the Berlin wall. Nana's, their top notch restaurant, is outstanding also, and commands beautiful views of the surrounding areas from the top of the tower building. Honestly, I could write a book about all the wonderful and delightful details of this hotel, but you have to experience it to believe it. It still stands as a highlight of her trip to the US when my German cousin came to visit with her son and I put her up with my mother there. They both spent their first 2 days of their "visit to Dallas" wandering the property. PS -- don't miss the Margaret and Trammel Crow Asian Art Collection in Dallas when you visit. You will see the art in the hotel is the passion of this amazing family, who was generous to establish this gift of art to Dallas (it is free to visit this small, world-class museum).

Reviews.Title: “I was very happy with the help I received”
Reviews.Author: marye1_10
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank Terri Williams. She was the bomb! It was my first time to Dallas and i wanted to find some attractions. She was so great she printed out directions to get to each place and the directions back PLUS if i got lost she gave me her phone number if i needed any help. I have never met a nicer person from a hotel. I hope she is noticed for the good person she is. She was definately the bomb!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern and lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: tripcasey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for a business conference. The conference was catered and we had dinner at the Nana restaurant. This hotel is amazing. The rooms are very modern and clean. I love the bathrooms (see pics) and the roomy area with a sofa is nice. There are some nice upscale restaurants and bars, in addition to a spa and huge fitness center. We stayed an extra night after the conference was over and had a wonderful time. We stayed for dinner and drinks in the Media Grill & Bar and just enjoyed every moment. My only complaint is that the parking is very expensive in my opinion. 0-4 hrs will cost you $9 for example.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday”
Reviews.Author: luvya1tyme
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel!! It was a very large hotel, but beautiful with different art throughout the hotel. All the staff was nice, and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “May not be bugs but there is something wrong here...”
Reviews.Author: HBiztravel
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold HHonors member with Hilton, and travel weekly. I stayed Sunday March 28th, and had a horrible experience. I sat on the red bench in front of the bed, and approximately 15 minutes later, my legs and feet were covered in painful, itchy red welts/bites. I nearly called a doctor, I was so worried. I took a long hot shower, and went down to the front desk to complain. They said I could stay in the room, and they would look into it, or move my room and let me know what was going on. I understand the hotel can not control someone bringing something in, and things happen. What disappointed me was the response I received. I was told that the room would be unoccupied until it had been checked and treated. After I moved rooms, I went back to the front desk repeatedly. Monday night they told me the room had been checked and cleared, and was occupied. They said they would send someone Tuesday morning to clean my clothes and to sanitize my suitcase first thing in the morning. All I needed to do was leave mty clothes by the door. I left contact information, and asked they call or email me first thing in the morning. When I returned to the room at 11 AM, the clothes were still there, and I had an unintelligible message on the phone in the room. I checked out, and finally at around 2:30 I got a call from the hotel. By this point thanks to the lack of communication, I had thrown away my suitcase and the clothes, hoping to prevent the spread of whatever caused the reaction. The manager who called told me the room still had not been checked by Terminix, and that they would let me know what they found. I finally got a call from the hotel this morning telling me that the room had been checked but nothing was found. I guess I made it all up. Unfortunately, I didn't take pictures of my legs thinking that Hilton would take action and resolve this issue. Now I wish I had, so that I could show just how bad the reaction was, and to better warn others of the poor treatment by this hotel. Maybe there is a pretreatment charge I should have paid, to go along with the exorbitant self parking charge, the wired internet access charges, and the lack of communication by the hotel in general. Definitely will not stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Traveler”
Reviews.Author: SexyC430
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Anatole is an excellent hotel to stay at. This was my second year staying with them and each time it gets better and I enjoy myself more.. The first time I stayed here it was during a hurricane back in September 2008. The whole staff and mamngement made all of us feel very safe. The food was excellent and so was the entertainment that they have. I would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: vg411973
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Being a new hotel the rooms were clean, fresh and comfortable. Lobby and public areas are clean and new, and the hotel has several bars (excellent!) all of which were busy and had good atmospheres (the sports bar had terrific TV's which is important to me when traveling and usually wanting to catch a game). Hotel is humongous, so there is alot of walking to/from your guestroom to meeting space; if you are in the Atrium building it is almost impossible to slip back to your guestroom during conference breaks. The entire staff was excellent, with special note that the banquet staff was the best and most friendly that i've ever encountered in all my years of work & travel. Negatives: room service menu is very limited & my order took an hour for a burger. When you walk outside the building looking for a taxi, the private limo's and bellman are very aggressive and swarm you to go into a gypsy taxi (I had heard rumors about this and that the bell staff gets a kickback everytime they steer a guest to do this). Exhibit Hall is outside the hotel and quite a walk, and each time session broke it was a 20 minute walk from the meeting because there were 3000 people all walking along same narrow pathway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite...seriously...”
Reviews.Author: mikeinsacto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Anatole during a conference in mid February. While laying in bed I discovered what bed bugs look like, from the nymph stage to the adult... All of them were there with me in my bed....I am now home and have to deal with the fact that there are now bed bugs in my bed, my luggage, my clothes and I am daily covered with bed bug bites... Good luck with your stay.... and really, don't let the bed bugs bite, it kinda stings...

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best”
Reviews.Author: RitaLane16
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Anatole is full of everything Luxury. If you need it they have it or will get it for you. Words cannot express how much I LOVE this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel but Pricey and Poorly Located”
Reviews.Author: Bittco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like its own little world. It has multiple shops open during the day and a really nice outside space to walk around by torch at night. The problem is there is nowhere else to go. The market center area is a dump and there is nothing worthwhile there. It is a short trip downtown if you so desire however. The parking was also really expensive considering where it was (nowhere). This would be a good spot for a wedding or some sort of similar event where you dont want to leave the hotel and don't mind spending a lot.

Reviews.Title: “What a Huge disappointment. Is Hilton Anatole out of touch with its guests? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: teedubyaw
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and stay in many hotels. Never before have I been so inspired by a hotel to leave either a negative or positive review. This was so bad that I had to take a stand. In fact, this place was so bad, it has inspired me to write a book on bad company practices in the social media era. First of all, they bamboozled me into a "third night free" option via Hotwire.com The location is where I need it to be, and the price of $250 for three nights sounded reasonable-ish. As soon as I got to the hotel, I noticed there was no free parking on the premises. They requested $17 a dollars a day to park on one of their lots, or $27 a day for valet parking. On the second day of my trip, they had the two "cheaper" 17 dollar parking lots green-coned off, due to an event at the location later. So, I had to park several football fields away from where my room was actually located. The room was absolutely beautiful. The bed was very comfortable and you can tell the staff takes pride in keeping up a nice hotel. Nice isn't the problem. It's quality. But, for a company to nickel and dime you to death, is unbelievable. Next, I make it into my room. Almost EVERY hotel that I have stayed in for the last 10 years has some kind of complimentary internet access in the room, with the exception of some hotels in San Francisco. The Hilton Anatole thinks that $14-$17 a day for $24 hours of non-wifi / ethernet-tethered-to-the-wall is a good value. I don't pay $40 a month for internet at home, why should I pay over $50 for THREE DAYS? So, I decide to go into the atrium and get some food at their little open market deli stand. Aside from being extremely overpriced, apparently the cashier took the card that allowed customers to actually pay for their meals. So, I had to wait for about 15 minutes to even pay for my food. They couldn't take cash, credit OR charge to my room. After my meal, I decide to go to the gym... world class leisure and workout facility, a sign says... check out the Veranda! Great, after a long stressful trip... a workout would be ideal. I get over there... and the nice elderly lady tells me all about how great this place is, then commences to tell me that it is only $16 a day, unless I'm an ultra uber gold rewards member or something. I sarcastically ask if it is okay to walk on the sidewalk or do I need to pay a $5 incidental fee of some sort? So, I sat at the bar and decided to relax with a drink since I wasn't going to be working out... I'll take a screwdriver from The Gossip Bar. Sweet. Only $10. It's a freaking bargain in this money trap. Stay far away from this place. It is ridiculous the greed from this place. It's like Paris Hilton herself is running the place and is trying to get enough cash to get her dog an new diamond encrusted doggie bag or something. To be honest, I shook my head in amazement that their wasn't a fee for ice on the floor. I half expected it to be a dollar bill vending machine. Unreal. Boooo! Whoever manages this place should be fired.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: elturcogrande
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big fancy and comfy but not a huge difference from, say, a Fairfield Inn or a Towneplace. Hilton Anatole has the shopping malls, gardens, sculptures extra... Parking lot is expensive, and it takes too long of a time to park and walk... Has nice downtown view and a nice executive breakfast suite at one of the floors in the taller tower. Worth the views...

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: fasnstl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Anatole for almost a week for a conference. That was my third trip that month and needless to say I was exhausted. The staff and the hotel itself was so comfortable that I almost got I was traveling. It is now my exclusive hotel for any trips to Dallas, TX.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Anatole Concierge Eddie VanDerdys is the best!”
Reviews.Author: VaLawTech1
Reviews.Content: My suit jacket button came loose as I was heading toward a meeting. Recognizing my challenge, Concierge Eddie Van Derdys instantly pulled a sewing kit from his drawer and, with charm and a smile, quickly saved the day by personally sewing back my button. Eddie went beyond the call of duty. I had similar helpful experiences throughout my Hilton Anatole visit such as when obtaining document copies, looking for meeting rooms and seeking a taxi. It is the small things that often make a hotel standout from the others. Thanks to Eddie and Hilton Anatole for their excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “I am so glad it wasn't my money paying for this room!”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaMistik
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel. Although it was georgeous and clean, I would never have chosen to stay here myself. There was no free internet anywhere in the hotel, 24 hours cost $14, with tax. Although there was a refridgerator, you could not use it or you would be charged for the snack bar items you moved. You could not even call a 1-800 # from the room to use a calling card! I would have rather stayed next door... they had wi-fi IN THE ROOMS, a fridge and microwave!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful though an island unto itself”
Reviews.Author: richros
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a convention. Tower room was as good as it gets. Beautiful, new and clean. Great service. Wish it was downtown though since you have to drive or cab to get anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN DALLAS!”
Reviews.Author: hopeordie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole and had a one of a kind experience. The room had the most comfortable bed I have slept on EVER! The room inspired artistic design for somethings I envision in my own home. The V SPA is a true paradise. Sarah welcomed me and made me feel like I was on vacation in paradise. True customer service! The facilities and gym where top notch. Must stay here and visit the V SPA!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE Hotel With A "Boutique" Feel”
Reviews.Author: OxfordTraveler38655
Reviews.Content: I read the negative reviews on this massive hotel and property. I was concerned. Now I can safely say my stay was excellent. Room, Service, Food, Beverage, Comfort, Privacy, and on and on were all perfect. I do agree that free parking and Internet would be a real luxury for those who use them and could also be quite an attraction for one to choose this beautiful hotel/Museum over another place to stay. Until you go here and visit there is no easy way to explain how cleaver and spacial it is. It is not just a convention hotel it is a morph of so many things and they are all well done. Look at the whole picture and the cost of providing a property of this magnitude. How they make it feel so personal takes a lot of time, energy, and money. Hats off to you Hilton Anatole! Be sure to see more of the Crow Collection Down Town it is will worth your time the location of this hotel makes it so easy to get anywhere one chooses and very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “A review you can use”
Reviews.Author: Orig_Review_Master
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews you read are right on the money... this place is indeed "nickel and dime".. there is a charge for everything! They have a sign hanging in thk itchen near the docks about taking care of the customer - the sign should say "note their wallet"! Some tips: The parking: This was another hotel before that DID NOT charge for parking. There are flower pots in all the driveways (which can be slid out of the way) but the real gem is that we noticed some tire tracks on the grass... hmmm... the curbs are very low and easy to hop - go to the corner of the lot near the highway (lot 2 is best) near the gate and you'll see the tracks. Food: Don't eat there, breakfast is $20!! Alternative: There are alot of conventions and most have breakfast for their group. They usually set it up in between the two front desks somewhere.. just be sure to have some sort of id card hanging around your neck (flipped over of course) and they won't say a thing. Internet: Don't sign up for the $17 internet... there is wireless but they do not mention that... works in the room but in the lobby better. Soda: There is a soda station in the lobby, they charge like $2 for the cup but say it can be used all day... be sure you save the cup for the entire stay! Smoking: Smoking not allowed indoors (even though there are remnants like old ashtrays turned into trash cans). If you want to smoke be sure to stay in the atrium side. At night you can walk around the balconey and smoke one and ditch the butt in one of the many plants. One last tip about parking: No pay after 10:30pm. Biz Center: Watch out for the biz center... the hotel does not own this BUT will utilize it... for example: lets say you need a box, if someone from the hotel threw away your boxes they will instruct the biz center to accommodate you. Also, let 's say you need a box... there is a loading dock in the rear... if you are on business be sure to utilize it... the entry is near the backside of the unloacked and open biz center cage and there are bozes galore just sitting there... right by the back door. Also No fridge and microwave. PS: They charge $75 non-refunable for pets! Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Very vast hotel”
Reviews.Author: Friscojill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend of December 4,5,6,2009. We had a wonderful time. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. After reading the reviews I was very worried so I called the front desk and asked that when we arrive could we please stay in the towers(because I have OCD) and I wanted my room to be clean and new (Sada) the man we talked to was VERY nice and put us in EVERYTHNING we asked for. They were really full this weekend due to the Big 12 Championship games going on at the new Dallas Cowboy stadium. However, we were treated very nicely and our whole family really enjoyed everything about this hotel even the food we bought at the open kitchen was really good and was a large portion. I really think they are trying to bring it up to Hilton standards and this weekend was proof that they are almost there. Thank you Sada for a wonderful time. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis on Stemmons Freeway”
Reviews.Author: metrochica
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hilton Anatole within the past year. It is a huge complex perfect for conferences other special events, but unlike other massive hotels, it manages to come off friendly and inviting instead of cold and sterile. The Asian theme decoration is beautiful and not too over the top. I've stayed in the tower rooms so I can only review those. The first time I was on the 23rd floor and the second visit I was on the 17th. Both rooms were immaculate, with stunning views of downtown Dallas. There's not much to visit on Stemmons Freeway, but you are ideally located near several key highways that can take you to Dallas' top spots. A visit to the concierge will provide you with a wealth of info about nearby Dallas attractions. David was especially helpful giving me directions to some of the area shopping destinations printing out several maps and pointing out additional places to stop as well. If you are stuck at a busy conference and don't have time to get into downtown Dallas, the hotel offers several restaurants. Also, it is located down the road from a super diner, the Original Market Diner which is a must visit for foodies who like homestyle cooking. The Anatole also has a huge work out facility and excellent equipment and a pool. It also has a new spa but I didn't have a chance to check it out. If my work brings me back to Dallas, I will definitely stay at the Anatole again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large, Can be Nice”
Reviews.Author: JoVo19
Reviews.Content: This is a very large hotel and my group was spread throughout the hotel. I was surprised that i was given a center room on the 25th floor with no windows. I was glad it was a large room, but no fridge/microwave. Everything costs money, like parking, internet, gym (you have to walk outside to get too!) and food, so I was glad this was a business trip. No stores in walking distance, but downtown is close. The conference rooms were nice and effective for our meetings. Food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Everything costs extra!!”
Reviews.Author: soonerr11
Reviews.Content: Internet was between $14 and $17 depending on what type of service you wanted. Gym was extra $17. Parking was extra $20. There were barely any channels on the TV for all those who like to vege out. You had to cab it to everything if you don't have a car. Horrible ATT service (although I guess that can happen everywhere)! Restaurant service was sub par at best - we had to re-order multiple times in order to get what we wanted, it was slow to come out of the kitchen. It took house keeping over 24 hours to clean up the room service tray outside our room. Took them 48 hours to remove the wine glasses.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant business day but inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference. My friend dropped me off at the Tower entrance, and later I discovered that there is more cab traffic by the Atrium side where more people tend to check in (there are 2 different check in areas). I was in luck though because the Tower side apparently features more renovated rooms. I enjoyed a very restful stay with clean, modern, and nicely appointed room, while my colleagues who arrived separately and checked in on the Atrium side complained about noise and thin walls. The downside to staying on the Tower side is that it is a longer walk if your conference activities are on the Atrium side. On the upside, it is a closer walk to the outdoor campus area and the Verandah club and fitness area, and closer to one of the chic hotel lounge bars called Gossip Bar. The Verandah club and fitness area is a rip off for charging $17 a day for a daiy entrance fee to the gym - there are slight discounts though for 2 day/3 day passes. Another rip off is that the business center charges a minimum $7.95 for access to their computers, so you cannot expect to print your boarding pass for free here. Diamond and above members can get in free though. Another downside to the hotel is that it is not walkable to anywhere interesting, and you have to get a cab ride about 10 minutes to the Uptown area.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime”
Reviews.Author: No_Frills_Man
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers that the hotel is nice but expensive. Dallas is a city known for large open spaces and huge parking lots; it, therefore, surprised me that the Anatole would charge for 20/day (similar to the W in New York City) to park despite the fact that the neighboring hotels do not charge. Also as has been mentioned, why is that only expensive hotels charge for the Wi-Fi? In perhaps a more disturbing trend in "luxury" hotel Nickel and Diming practices, it seems that it has now become common to charge for entrace into the Health Club to use poorly maintained treadmills. Positives about the hotel include the nice lobby, serene outdoor space and comfortable rooms. I guess these hotels need to pay for their nice art in some way, but I would prefer them to include it in the room rate and then provide excellent service rather than gouge certain clients. My advice is to save 40 dollars and stay at the Hilton Garden Inn or Sheraton or Best Western next door and get free Wi-Fi and Parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: princt
Reviews.Content: I arrived early evening and check-in was quick and easy. I entered the atrium section of the hotel and my room was located in the tower, another building though completely connected by a series of lobbies. The lobby area is immense - everything really is bigger in Texas! The public areas are filled with spectacular art work from the Far East, tastefully and skilfully placed all over the place. My room was very quiet and all finishes were to a very high standard. One thing I found odd, however, was that I was in an interior room. It had a window but that looked into the hall so you would never open the drapes. I was there for 3 nights and lived with it but if I had been staying longer, I would definitely have found it claustrophobic. I really should have been told of this at check-in. It was a very long walk back from the tower to the desk. Now I know that I would never book an interior room on a cruise ship. Ate in a hotel restaurant in the atrium area on the first night and had a $22.00 hamburger. The waiter seemed bothered to have to wait on our table of 3 and brought the cheque without asking if we were interested in dessert. We told him to separate it into 3 separate cheques and he rolled his eyes. The tip reflected the service. Used cabs several times and the guys at the door were very good at fetching cabs but they always offered a limo first. Finally told the guy I wanted the cheapest way to get downtown and he called a regular cab. Maybe I look wealthy? A really great hotel if you don't mind just staying at the hotel (there is nothing within walking distance). I would stay there again but would definitely check last-minute prices as we met people who paid half what we paid, and we booked months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Aesthetically pleasing, isolated, expensive”
Reviews.Author: CascadeSalem
Reviews.Content: While at a conference mid-October, I was pleased with Asian art displayed throughout, comfortable bed, nice room, excellent wait staff for meals, courteous desk and concierge staff, pleasant sculpture garden w/track and 24th floor bar w/great view and light dinner options from the upscale Nana restaurant next door. I was disappointed that this hotel: --Switched my group's rooms from the (quiet) Tower to the (busy, sometimes noisy) Atrium, even though I made reservations over 10 mo. ago and specified Tower rooms. --Has NO free wi-fi or Internet connection. Even inexpensive hotels like Holiday Inn Express provide free wi-fi! -Is on the outer edge of urban sprawl, and the only place to walk or run outdoors is the short track in the garden. The Fitness center with its Olympic size pool is expensive, and the pool inside the hotel is too small for laps. The large outdoor pool opens at 8 AM--too late for conference attendees. --Doesn't provide free airport shuttle. (DFW Supershuttle service is $17 + tip per person each way.) No shuttles to downtown; you must take expensive taxis. I would recommend staying in a centrally-located hotel so that you can explore some of the city on foot, walk to restaurants and have access to the DART train and Dallas bus system.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShawnnellW
Reviews.Content: Hotel is like a mini city with multiple bars, stores, and restaurants. You don't have to leave the facility for anything. It was a nice experience. One of the best places I've stayed with great customer services.

Reviews.Title: “Flashy hotel with excellent, comfortable conference room”
Reviews.Author: MBPhD
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all that we come to expect from Hilton, excellent rooms, comfortable beds, those nice crabtree and evelyn bathroom products and courteous service. The hotel was hugh, with two atriums which were dimly lit. The food in the restaurantswas adequate but nothing exceptional, but the service was above average. There is a hugh health spa, but they charge extra to use it. Also, the hotel wasn't very near to anything else, just a walking path and "sculpture garden." What was really cool was the comfortable aero style chairs in one of the conference rooms. The room was set up like a modern lecture hall and having these comfortable chairs made all of the difference.

Reviews.Title: “It's a very nice hotel with lots of things to do within the hotel itself and around it.”
Reviews.Author: TanTan4241
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel. There were many Asian artworks everywhere, and there was also a section of the Berlin wall there. If you are into art you could spend time there to admire everything. There's a great view on the top floor and the employees were very friendly. The tennis courts were very nice and the fitness center was great. They had an olympic size pool. There is a walking trail that makes you feel like you're one with nature. The koi pond was amazing! If you go remember to pack your swimming suit, tennis rackets, tennis shoes, and anything else you can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and grounds”
Reviews.Author: Miniaturist02
Reviews.Content: Great location and great grounds. However, I wish they offered a free breakfast. It seems like the more you pay for a hotel room, the less they give you - - it makes no sense!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Fitness/Recreation Facilities”
Reviews.Author: peterny173
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in but I'm not a big traveler. My 30 yr. old son & I had a room in the Tower Bldg. whose rooms are recently renovated. The hotel also has rooms in the Atrium Bldg. The rooms are nice and just above average with double sinks & granite vanity tops in the bathroom. I always think the bedding @ Hiltons is comfortable. We used the Spa (next to the Tower Bldg.) quite often which had an indoor lap pool, a whirlpool, & dry sauna. The men's locker room has solid oak wood lockers and an area for about 4 people to sit to sip free coffee and watch the large screen TV. The Spa also has a Basketball Court, Fitness Room, Jogging Track above the Basketball Court, Racquetball, & Squash Courts. Outside are Tennis Courts and a large sized Outdoor Pool with swim-up bar plus another whirlpool. The bar was only open on the weekend during our Sept. stay but is probably open daily during the peak summer months. The Atrium Bldg. also has an outdoor pool which we didn't use. The Hilton Anatole is on 45 acres so it also has outside walking tracks. None of the areas were being hardly used by hotel guests. We mostly ate @ outside restaurants so I can't comment on the food or prices. A Rathskeller downstairs had a bar with bar food and a pool table. The lobby areas are huge and luxuriously decorated with large sculptures and large wall hangings. The hotel is defitely designed for business conferences. A downside to this hotel is parking. We had a rental car so paid $17 for parking each day. The TRE (Trinity Railway Express) had a station about 1/2 mile or more away. It's is walkable. Our hotel room for 4 nites did not cost anything as I redeemed my Hilton HHonors credit card (AMEX) reward points. It cost 35,000 reward points for each day. I would definitely stay again to enjoy the recreation facilities. I'm not sure how their rates compare to other brand name hotels that I saw (Renaissance, Holiday Inn, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lizhjo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for 5 years now - and I always look forward to going back. Just when I don't think it can get any better they continue to impress me. The staff are wonderful, the mexican food is fabulous, the breakfast buffet is great and caters to your needs and I am never disappointed! in my room! I always feel confident going back and taking people with me! Very beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden fees hidden fees hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: Pensfan6668
Reviews.Content: I was just looking for a nice place to stay for the labor day holiday. I was enticed by such a cheap rate of 129. What they don't tell you is you have to pay for parking which is $17 per day for self park, which is taxed or $26 per day for valet which is also taxed. Pretty much with this hotel you have to pay for services that are normally free. I had planned on spending around $400 for the weekend and ended up spending $660. My advice would be to stay elsewhere. I call this a "fine print" hotel. Do your research before commiting a credit card.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright as long as you know what you're in for ahead of time”
Reviews.Author: minipro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Labor Day weekend at the Anatole to celebrate our wedding anniversary and to enjoy an extended weekend away from our young children. The property is huge so be ready to walk a lot to get to anything. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the standard king room was bigger than I thought it was going to be. Positives: Great fitness center extends priveledges to hotel guests. Free to Hilton Honors members with status. Good food and decent variety. Good proximity to Uptown Dallas if you want to leave the property. Negatives: Only 1 of 7 restaurants was open all weekend - Drink and food prices are VERY expensive - very long walk to outdoor hotel pool - VERY expensive self parking, can't imagine what valet was going for The room rates were reasonable and it is a nice property. You can do better in Dallas for more $$ but I'd stay at the Anatole again but I'd be better prepared next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Very nice staff. Comfortable and quiet rooms.”
Reviews.Author: emmaleth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It's clean and has very comfortable and quiet rooms. The restaurants have good food and pleasant staff. The gardens surrounding the hotel are well maintained and lovely. All in all this was a very pleasant stay and worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - but slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TheNeeces
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to book a quick getaway for a Saturday night and use Hilton Honors Points. This is a beautiful property, but I found a few things that I want to mention. At check-in we were told there was no upgrade available. Find that hard to believe on the weekend. Check-in a little slow - only one person on the front desk. Finally, they gave me a corner room on the 5th floor- which was larger than the standard room, but overlooked the roof. Parking was $17 self parking and $26 Valet...a little high. After we checked in, we found a mini candy bar wrapper under the nightstand. Did not complain as the rest of the room appeared to be clean. Executive Level - forget it. Cheap pretzel mix that can be found at any sports bar in Dallas, Nothing else except one cookie in the display case. . Continental breakfast was not bad -but no individual packets of peanut butter - instead, there was an open jar of peanut butter near the toaster --a turn off. Not up to par for a hotel of this caliber. There was a charge for internet in the Executive Lounge - I've been at many Hilton properties and most of the time there is a computer in the executive level for guests to use. Outdoor pool area smaller than it appeared in the pictures, but still nice. Swim up bar was a great feature. This hotel has received a lot of "5" ratings, but I wouldn't go that far. I would still recommend this hotel, but you might be able to find something better especially on the weekend when most of the hotel rooms in Dallas are empty.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible services”
Reviews.Author: almagrimaldi
Reviews.Content: I came to the hotel and check in, they offered a service to keep your baggage in a room supervised by personal from the hotel giving you a number so you could check out your baggage. Two hours later, I came and one of my baggage was gone. They pretended they were doing the best possible to track my item, but they were weren't . They werewaiting for me to leave and not been responsible for the losst of my items. I lost very costly items for my appearance. No one took the responsability for my loss. I had been in differents hotel in bussiness but i would never recommended to anyone to travel and feel sage for your property. There personal are not train to be responsible and it shows a good description of their business ethics. I was in a seminar in July 29 for a very prestige Co. Don't spend your money in this hotel!!!! BE ALERT.... aNY QUESTION CONTACT ME AT [--]

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: GoBigRed57
Reviews.Content: We loved the Anatole. We were a little apprehensive after reading some reviews, but it was absolutely fantastic. We stayed in a room in the Tower on the Executive Level which was roomy, the bathroom very nice and overall a very comfortable, beautiful room. The Executive Lounge was also very nice. The view was incredible and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel property is amazing. We used the fitness facilities which were top notch with weight machines and aerobic equipment. The pool with the swimup bar was fun. All hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location worked out very well for us with easy access to the interstate. We will plan to stay at the Anatole on our next visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: loribit
Reviews.Content: I love the Hilton Anatole. I love admiring the gorgeous Asian Art that lines the entryways and embellishes the walls. It's also fun to walk around the huge sculpture park outside. And the gym! So not your typical hotel gym. This place rivals most chain-gyms. You'll get an amazing workout for your travel weary body at the Verandah Club. I highly recommend staying at the Hilton Anatole.

Reviews.Title: “Offers everything you could every want in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DallasGal09
Reviews.Content: We always send all of our friends/family/business associates to this hotel when they come to Dallas. It seriously offers everything you could ever imagine! The amenities are endless. Not only is the Hilton Anatole home to my favorite restaurant, Nana, but is also offers an outdoor pool with a swim-up bar, a seven-acre sculpture park, several pieces of art from the Crow Collection, V Spa- the most relaxing spa in Dallas, and the Verandah Club, the hotel's state-of-the-art work out facility. The hotel also caters to both professionals and families alike...not easily accomplished. What else could you need?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: joeljade
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights as part of our USA Honeymoon. We'd been staying mainly in hostels, and wanted somewhere nicer for our time in Dallas. From the outside it looks a little dated but once we entered the lobby it's ok. The staff were friendly upon arrival and for the duration of our stay. Cannot complain about the room. We stayed on the tenth floor with a lovely view of the Dallas skyline. The bed was so comfortable, flatscreen tv with cable available (at a cost), inroom internet (at a cost), gym available (at a cost). Outdoor the grounds included running/walking tracks, asian themed gardens, swimming pool with swim-up bar. Good choice of restaurants and bars but not all were open. Where we ate/drank were both really nice and the staff very professional. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous decorating and beautiful grounds!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherBunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and was thoroughly impressed with the quality of service, grounds, rooms and architecture. The hotel is done in an Asian theme and was breathtaking. I would go back. It was perfect for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to spend the night but you need a car”
Reviews.Author: Wawasayg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole when attending a conference at the hotel. My room in the Atrium section was spacious and had a bed and furniture in good condition and apparently updated decor. Tiny, tiny bathroom revealed the hotel's bones from the '70s. A lengthy hike separated most of the guest rooms from the elevators. Lots of walking was required to get from place-to-place in the hotel, so anyone who has difficulty walking distances may want to think twice before staying in the Atrium section of this hotel. My room had wired high-speed Internet service that was extremely expensive (~$17/day). The hotel lobby had wireless Internet but its use required that you pay the costly daily rate. The fitness center was lovely and complimentary because of my Hilton loyalty program status. Without this, I would have had to pay another expensive fee to use the club. The fitness center has a large number of good-quality aerobic equipment and weight equipment. I participated in a group fitness class during my stay that was lead by a very enjoyable and encouraging instructor. A nice walking/running path runs through grounds between the hotel, fitness center complex and pool area. This is a giant hotel and even with two meetings in process, the place seemed like a ghost town. Occupancy seemed to be sparse. Although the hotel has several restaurants on the property, only one restaurant was open, a casual cafe in the Atrium section. Because I didn't have a car, and because the hotel is so remote, I ended up eating in the hotel rather than burn up cash on cab fares. The food was surprisingly good, albeit expensive and overpriced. Healthy options were available on the menu, which is important for those of us who travel a lot and do not want to pack on the pounds. Given a choice, I would not stay at this hotel because it is just too remote and does not have wireless Internet access in the hotel rooms. If I am required to stay here again because of meetings at the hotel, I would rent a car so I could escape the Anatole from time-to-time. It's not such a bad place to stay, and if you are attending a conference at the hotel, it is probably worth staying there, too. But there's other places in Dallas that are nicer and in nicer locations.

Reviews.Title: “The dinner of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethDallas1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Anatole in Dallas recently for our 20th Anniversary. We haven't stayed there in many years, and we were both very impressed with the new guest rooms. The valet and check in service were fantastic, but our dinner in Nana was one we will NEVER forget. From the time we walked in the restaurant we felt like royalty. Everyone from the hostess to the servers to the manager were so nice and friendly. I had the tuna tartar for a starter, and it was AMAZING! My husband had a ribeye steak that he is still saying is the best steak he has ever had. We finished up with the a chocolate dessert that was the perfect finish to a perfect dinner. We have decided that Nana will be our restaurant that we go to for all our special occasions!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ur2k
Reviews.Content: Decent business hotel. Stayed in atrium section. I imagine rooms are nicer in tower but was given an atrium room upon check-in. Pros - - Decent Rooms. Looked relatively new. - Nice grounds - Great gym. Free as a hilton silver member but may have a cost otherwise. - Good conference facilities - Mexican restaurant was good Cons - Nothing within walking distance - your stuck if you're here for a conference without a car. - Rathskellar restaurant is not what you expect, dingy and not really a sports bar. Burger was good, other food not very good. But was the only late dining option for me, other steakhouse restaurant had ridiculously high prices. - Had to walk a long distance to get to room from atrium elevator - No wireless in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Met my clean and quiet requirements”
Reviews.Author: Metwo3
Reviews.Content: I wasn't paying for the room, so all it had to do was meet my clean and quiet requirements. It did that. The pros-- The sleeping/work area was well arranged and sized. My king room had 2 low back easy chairs, one foot stool, one desk chair with desk, one visitor chair, and a bench at the end of the bed. Plenty of furniture and space in that area. Curved shower curtain rod. Plenty of closet and drawer space. The cons-- The bath was tiny. The door opened to within 1 inch of the toilet. There were less than 6 inches each side of the toilet between the bathtub and the countertop. You had to slip between the toilet and counter to close the door. There was alot of counter space, but it was alongside the toilet, so you couldn't access it directly. Again, you had to lean over the toilet to reach the shower/tub faucet. There was another sink/counter outside the bath, but it was half taken up with the coffeemaker. The a/c was by the window and did not circulate well. It also did not block noise from the hallway/atrium because of its location. The windows could not open. The energy efficient lightbulbs throughout were difficult for reading and cast dark shadows on my face when trying to put on makeup (or was that lack of sleep?). Other cons have been mentioned by others--high cost of parking and Internet, parking lot/office/industrial surroundings (there is a Dennys nearby), automatic charge minibar, USA Today 75 cents per day unless you tell them not to deliver it. Staff was pleasant . I was first drop off/pick up for airport by shuttle before/after the downtown folks.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you can get a Priceline type rate”
Reviews.Author: matt_tx00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in Apr 2009 at the start of a business trip. Booked it on Priceline the day of - got a $70 rate for a 4-star hotel - total was $88 including fees. The hotel itself is huge and very very nice - rooms were immaculately clean and newly decorated. Everything went smoothly as far as that was concerned. Otherwise staff was ok - but this is a huge, impersonal, convention type hotel so I wouldn't expect a lot of special service. You are not downtown but the location here is still good. You are right at I-35E and Wycliff Ave. Its about probably 15 mins or so to downtown and 10 mins to Oak Lawn/Cedar Springs area. The only annoyance - and it was a pretty big one - is the parking. I paid $18 to park for the one night. It was a totally outdoor lot and a decent walk to get to the room. There was a gate attendant that you had to check in and out with each time you left parking. This is NOT a downtown hotel so I thought the $18 charge for uncovered parking was not cool. The hotel had a spa/fitness center - however I believe they did charge for that as well. Yes Hilton will nickel and dime you to death. I would probably stay here again *if* I got another <<$100 Priceline type rate.

Reviews.Title: “So far away...”
Reviews.Author: MomofHandH
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Anatole is a huge, but lovely hotel in Dallas. You must have a car if you wish to see anything or go anywhere. We took a cab to the wine store and it cost $20. The rooms are usually a pretty far walk from the meeting space and lobby. The conference food was poor, at best. The service was fine. The rooms were very large and the beds were great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: arthanial
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on valentines day. We enjoyed our stay. The hotel is nice in comparison to other hotels i've stayed at in dallas. It is right across the freeway(I35) from the American Airlines Center and approx 2-3 miles from downtown. We wanted to eat at NaNa's, which I've heard is one of the prestigous restaurants in the city(located in the tower on the top floor). It has a great view of the skyline. but they were completely booked unfortunately. Luckily another restaurant in the hotel had room and was pleasant. We did not stay in the tower building so we did not have a pleasant view...and upgrades were not available....but it was busy so I guess I should have planned more in advance. There was even a nice indoor heated pool. I would have definitely tried it had I brought a swimsuit. All and all we enjoyed our stay. My only minor complaint is that the walls were thin and noise from the next room over was able to be heard....but the room was nice other than that. Overall we would definitely return and will remember our experience for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere but here :(”
Reviews.Author: olindao
Reviews.Content: Right off the bat (at 8am) we had to deal with a miserable front desk clerk. I'd been on a 6 hour red-eye and was not in the mood. The next treat was a mile long walk to my room, which had a view of the a/c unit and three walls of the adjoining building. I did not fly 1500 miles for that, so I took my shoes off and proceeded to make the incredibly long walk back to the elevators and down to the lobby. I thought I was going to have to give CPR to the poor gentleman who was having to push my luggage all over the hotel! Back at the front desk and quite winded, I requested a room closer to the elevator in the atrium overlooking the pool. I informed the clerk that my brother, who was suffering from a knee injury and limping, and my 73 year-old father would not find that hike to and from the room several times a day an easy thing. So what did he do? He proceeded to give me a room, albeit with a better view, in the same tower. I then said, "Didn't I just ask you specifically for a room in the other tower?" He got a little snippy but finally obliged with a room right next to the elevator on the 4th floor. Now for the parking--$17/day for self-park, $24/day for valet. And ALL you do it tip! Nothing is complimentary. The only reason I give the location a thumbs up is that our visit was close to what we needed to do. If we'd needed to be downtown, we wouldn't have stayed here. Oh, I forgot about the fridge. We brought leftovers back 2 nights from a very expensive restaurants and went to put them in the fridge. I haven't seen this in a long time, but it was a fully stocked mini-bar and it had no room for anything other than their very expensive stuff. Since we were staying for 3 days and had water and snacks and lefterovers, we called and asked if either we could remove the items or if someone could come do it for us. Now this thing was set-up to monitor anything taken from specific slots and would then automatically charge it to your card. Seriously!!! They told us that to take it out and later put back would cost us $28. What crap. They agreed to remove the items only after we told them that we had a recovering alcoholic with us and that they couldn't sleep with alcohol anywhere close by. I won't even get into the drunks whooping it up and the echo that place carries. Like being in the Grand Canyon. And don't bother calling to complain at 2am cause they don't care. Anywhere but this place from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Would be perfect without the add-on charges”
Reviews.Author: kjurach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Anatole for a cheerleading competition. We opted to priceline the room ($60, seriously) rather than stay at another hotel with the rest of the team. Even with the parking (outrageous), we spent far less and had a much nicer room than the other hotel. We made the mistake the first night of parking in the only free lot on the far north end of the hotel and our room was in the atrium area. Dragging a tired daughter and too much luggage was a bit much and we paid for the parking the second night. The room was very nice with large pieces of furniture that didn't seem to overwhelm it. The bed and bedding were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was smaller than expected but could accommodate two of us easily. The TV was small and dated and the cable selection was limited. We discovered that there is no wireless internet in the room (even at $15). They have a network cable at the desk which really limits mobility. When I called the front desk about it, they cheerfully reversed my internet charges and explained that wireless was available in the common areas. There were at least three major groups there (including hundreds of cheerleaders) but the hotel was clearly designed to handle it. We didn't wait long for elevators. Check in was quick. It did seem to have a shopping mall feel (including the inability to go directly from one point to another). The lobby areas looked like a museum and we enjoyed just wandering around. We didn't eat in any of the hotels or order room service. There was a minibar but not refrigerator (that we could use) or microwave. The walk to the elevator from our room in the atrium area (one of the atrium areas) was pretty long and it was easy to get lost. But for $60/night, it's hard to complain too much!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Discounted Price”
Reviews.Author: OSUTeacher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through Hotwire for a Valentine's day weekend. I have to say that I agree with most of the posts on here. The Hilton Anatole is a very large and beautiful hotel. The hotel itself is gigantic and the room sizes are also pretty good. The room we stayed in had a king size bed, a large cabinet that stored the TV and mini bar, and a good size bathroom with two sinks. However, the Hilton Anatole lacks what many other, lower star rating hotels provide. For example, there is no refrigerator in the room. There is a mini bar, but you cannot store your own drinks and food in it. There is also no microwave. There is no free parking. You can pay 17 dollars a night for self parking or you can pay 26 a night for valet. There is also a daily charge for the use of the internet and exercise facilities(I believe each were around 15 dollars a day, but as I did not use these services, I cannot say that with certainty). Local calls are 55 cents a minute but room to room calls are free. The staff at the Hilton Anatole was friendly and helpful. We have no complaints with them. The check in was quick and the front desk employees were friendly. It is in a great location with several restaurants and museums within 3 miles or so. Overall I am satisfied with our stay at the Hilton. However, I paid a highly discounted rate through hotwire(around 75 dollars a night). If I had paid the average 240 dollar a night price I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful large Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Movee
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The rooms were great and the restaurants throughout were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is HUGE”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel numerous times when we go to Dallas because it's a very reliable hotel that is pretty much centrally located to everything in Dallas. I do agree that most things around the hotel are very difficult to walk to, so you have to rely on someone that has a car or rent a car yourself if you want to do anything outside the expansive hotel grounds. As for the hotel, we always request the a room in the Tower (for some reason every time we make a reservation we are always offered a room in the Atrium and I always have to ask for a room in the Tower - the rooms are the same price). The rooms in the Tower are refurbished, there is no noise from the open atrium, and the views of Dallas are better on the higher floors. The rooms are very comfortable, and the decor is very stylish. The beds are soft, and the rooms are ample in size. The bathroom has two sinks, a hairdryer, a lit shaving mirror, and a lot of towels. The only strange thing about the restroom is the toilet - every time you flush the thing it seems like everything in the bathroom is getting sucked in as well. It's not really annoying, but it just catches you off-guard. The Executive Lounge is decent. They have a bar and a few snacks in the afternoon. But there is no free computer access, which was strange for me. The staff in the lounge is very helpful and welcoming, so it was a pleasant stay. The only problem I had about this hotel is that I couldn't find a corkscrew. I asked the front desk where I could get one, and she said that the hotel had none. So I went to the Executive Lounge and asked if I could borrow a corkscrew (I even brought the bottle of wine with me), but under law he couldn't open the bottle. He offered to call housekeeping and have a corkscrew delivered to me. The response was quick, and we were drinking our wine within ten minutes. So if you ever need a corkscrew, just call housekeeping. We did try the gym in the building behind the hotel. The only problem about the gym/spa area is that it is not connected to the hotel. It was below freezing when we wanted to use the gym, so we just ran as fast as we could to this building. Once inside (HHonors members can use the gym complimentary), the check in staff was very nice. The gym was pretty impressive. Each machine had its own television, so don't forget to bring your earphones! There is a towel service, so you don't have to bring a towel from you room. We didn't use any other parts of the gym due to lack of time, but the spa services seemed nice. Even though the hotel is extremely huge, the personalized service is there. The rooms are nice and comfortable, and this is what always brings us back to the Hilton Anatole.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: KOinDenver
Reviews.Content: I am a repeat guest at the Anatole for business and look forward to it every time. The beds are ultra comfortable, the amenities are luxurious and the customer service is consistently good. I always get a great massage in the spa while I am there too. The meeting rooms are plentiful and dining options vary. If you have a conference to attend, it is worth it to pay the extra money to stay onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: bulldog44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 night conference for work. This is a great hotel to have conferences and can accommodate very large groups, lots of very nice meeting space. The city of Dallas has lots to offer but the hotel is quick cab rides from the city center restaurants and bars. The hotel as everything you actually need including several bars and even a night club. There were over 200 in my group and there was another large company with a larger group there during the same time. We has tons of fun at the local hotel bars and club. The rooms were very comfortable with great beds and everything was very clean. The ambiance of the hotel makes you feel as if your in a museum with sculptures around every corner. Most meals were provided for us and the food was average but room service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Its a very Large hotel with good restuarants, Especially the mexican one in the lobby was great, Also had free wifi in the Lobby. The only issue was that it was too isolated you needed to take a cab to do anything. There was a Denny's around the corner, but that was it. Wish it was located closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Expensive Hotel in the middle of Nowhere”
Reviews.Author: tacomarick
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference. The hotel is huge and has good grounds. It works well for conference space until you want to eat or go do something. That being said this hotel is not in a good location. About the only thing around are more hotels and a Dennyâ€™s. And donâ€™t go walking around the neighborhood looking for anything, because itâ€™s not a good neighborhood. The hotel itself has many restaurants and shops. However unless you like paying 40.00 for a pasta dish, 16.00 for an order of Nachos smaller than taco Bell, or 6.75 for a bottle of beer, then go elsewhere. Everything is overpriced here. And if you must stay here, rent a car, because taxi rides are the most expensive I have ever heard of. The rooms are fine. They have plenty of space and a mini bar. Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hiton Anatole--Dallas, TX”
Reviews.Author: rayc441
Reviews.Content: Very large elegant hotel. Beautiful atrium and several large meeting rooms. Hotel is large enough for several conventions at once. I stayed here with my 15 year old son and wife. Room had two double beds and room was "ample" though not too large in size. Internet in the room is pricy($11 - $13 /day), but if you have a laptop it is free in the various lobbies. The several restaurants and bars inside the hotel are a bit on the pricy side, however, one of them is a 4 - 5 star restaurant. Also, a Denny's and a Burger King are less than half a mile. The Denny's is about 100 yards from the building and is an easy walk. If you have meetings / conventions at the Hilton Anatole and don't want to or can't pay around $200/night, then stay at the Hilton Garden Inn@Market Center and walk to the Hilton Anatole just across the way. The Hilton Anatole is about 5 miles from Dealy Plaza /center of downtown and about 17 miles from DFW. The Hilton Anatole is right on I-35 @ Market Center Blvd. FYI, the "Tequilla Bar" does have more than tequilla and Rathskellers Sports bar inside the hotel is a cozy little place to have a beer but has a very limited menu (a burger, hot wings, turkey club, or philly cheesesteak--and thats your choices). The staff--ALL of them were great. The housekeping staff was efficient and pleasant, the concierge answerdr every question effortlessly. Parking is expensive--but heres a secret. For what its worth, the parking attendants don't show up til about 7 a.m.--if you are out by then then the gates are open. I am not a big fancy, hotel traveler, but I thoroughly enjoyed this place. And if I could splurge in the future, I would stay here again--IF I COULD.

Reviews.Title: “Bring money, and lots of it.”
Reviews.Author: siw_1201
Reviews.Content: I am a heavy traveller for work/business. I was in Dallas for several weeks, and my company put me up in the Hilton Anatole. As many other reviews state, the place is quite impressive, but it only goes skin deep. Yes, the grounds are beautiful, the buildings look nice, the insides are very attractive, and the staff is indeed nice and helpful for the most part (see notes below for the contrary). However, I soon found that the excitement was lost once you go beyond appearances. This hotel is geared towards one type of person: those who like to feel more important by spending much more money than should be required for anything, or those on company expense accounts. First of all, self parking...$15 a night ($19 for valet). This hotel has thousands of parking spots, most of which were empty for a good portion of my stay, and many of which aren't available to hotel guests anyway. Yet, they still charge this ridiculous amount for self parking (it's gated, so no cheating). From what I can tell visually, no other hotel in the area has gated self parking, thus I imagine they don't charge for parking. Yet this hotel feels it necessary to charge $15 a night. The worst part was when they closed the one lot closest to the atrium building for four days "for an event", forcing you to either park across the campus (a good 5 minute walk away), or valet. No one ever seemed to know why the lot was closed, or when it would reopen. I only saw cars in the lot for one of those four days. Even though we were at the Hilton for three weeks, we visited only one restaurant one time. After paying $6.25 for a domestic beer at the sports bar, and looking at the menu prices for a few of the other places, we decided that eating a meal in this hotel was not an option. I think it was about $23 for an entree at the Mexican restaurant. Another ridiculously overpriced "amenity" at this hotel is their internet service. They offer two options, "Choice" for $11 a day, and "Premium" for $13 a day. It's the most expensive hotel internet I've seen in years in the US. Being an internet junkie, I did pay the $11 a day several times, and I can say that the internet service at this hotel is pathetic. Dial would be faster on most occasions. I could hardly even get Google Maps to load, and checking email was spotty. This was even when the hotel was not busy, so they can't use that excuse. I have to check again, but I believe I was also charged a "handing fee" for receiving a small package of mail from home. That's just a slap in the face if you ask me. I didn't use any other service that this hotel. Noise is certainly a factor if you are in the atrium building. On some nights, when a convention lets out, even at 11pm (I had to work early the next day or it wouldn't bother me as much), it sounded like a freight train was running through the hotel. The atrium does not absorb any noise whatsoever. The TV channel selection is pretty boring as well. Standard networks, a few sports and news channels, and a few cable networks. Other than that, the room was clean, and the place seemed nice enough. But I would never return to this hotel by choice. I simply just do not believe in paying extreme prices just to feel like I'm getting better service. And that is what this hotel is built around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially for conferences!”
Reviews.Author: LegoJoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole for a business meeting in early September. Check-In--was very efficient and quick. Staff was friendly-no complaints. Rooms--Were very nice--seemed to be newly refurbished. Bathroom was spotless, great bath amenities. Room was a decent size (I had 2 Queen Beds). Restaurants--We did not eat at any of the restaurants in general, but had work conference meals. They were the best meals that I have had at a hotel. Great tasting and presentation was excellent. Large conference dinner food tasted very good. Funny story, I actually wasn't feeling well the night of the conference and didn't eat much of my food. The staff asked me if I would like something else and they said they would make me whatever I would like! I thought that was going above and beyond! Mexican Restaurant Drinks--The Mexican Restaurant is a great place to have some drinks. We had some wine and margarita's. The staff was fantastic and we had a great time here. All and all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially a business person. (I think this is mostly who this hotel caters to). I could see a tourist staying a little closer right in the city... Please email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've EVER stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: cphelps
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel and it was wonderful! we got a really good price through our frequent flyer miles. the rooms are huge, the beds are like fluffy clouds, and we had the perfect view of reunion tower and the green building that i'm sure you've seen if not in pics! one of my absolute favorite things about this room was, it had a digital thermostat. most hotels have that horrible low, high or off dial. you can never get the temp right, its always too cold or too hot! the hotel had huge atriums that were breath taking! the elevator we rode on had a glass wall and we were on the 10th floor so we had a really good view of everything! the only downside to the hotel is #1 you have to pay for parking, i think it was $15 a day for self parking, i'm sure it was more for valet #2 everyone expects a tip, the guy that helps unload your car(even if you don't want him to), the guy that opens the door for you (every time you come and go), and the guy that takes your bags to your room(even though he banged and knocked and knocked my bags off a few times, thank goodness i carried my laptop case!) but over all this is a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Big conference hotel with good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Omakok
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel suitable for conferences and events. The rooms are in three buildings, the Atrium1 and 2 and the Tower. The distances can be quite long and it makes sence to find out where your event takes place before choosing where to stay. There are receptions in both buildings, though. Stayed here 3 times. I like most the garden with a jogging track, a good way to start the morning. On the way back, buy a filled croissant and fresh fruit salad at the cafeteria instead of the big hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the fishbowl!”
Reviews.Author: ohviaggiare
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hilton Anatole every two weeks on Friday night. The hotel is basically ok, but everyone should know to avoid a certain room they have on every floor in the tower which is essentially a fishbowl. There are no windows to the exterior of the building, all windows are on the corridors, and you can hear people passing by and the elevators all night. Second problem, on certain floors and not necessarely in the tower you can hear loud music well into the wee hours of the nigt because they have a bar and disco. It's impossible to sleep. Thid problem, but this is common to all Hilton hotels I have visited: their beds are so soft, I always wake up with an aching back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not for Families with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: TexasMom2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole over the 4th of July weekend with my children, ages 8 and 3. At first glance, the hotel appears to be a beautiful and well maintained. But our stay on the 14th floor with inoperable air conditioning and no windows was downright brutal. Needless to say that it was a very restless night for everyone.
