The Anatole did not have basic television channels for children such as the Disney channel, Nickelodeon, etc. They did graciously give you the option to purchase 30 minute kids' shows for $3.95 per show. Or you could purchase a kids' movie for $13 per movie. This was new to me and I thought it was a complete rip off. The $17 self service overnight parking fee was also an unexpected charge that took me by surprise. WOW! Needless to say that if I am in Dallas ever again, I WILL NOT be staying at the Hilton Anatole. It is beautiful on the surface, but don't look too deep.

Reviews.Title: “Check Your Credit Card Statement”
Reviews.Author: kbris10224
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a conference and gave our credit card numbers to hold the rooms. The conference was not until mid June, but upon reviewing my credit card statement, the hotel had charged me a room deposit of $228, three different times (once in May and twice in June weeks before the conference.) I called the hotel, I faxed, I called the 1-800 Hilton number, I e-mailed.... No help. I may finally have someone to assist after sending a note to the hotel manager. I travel at least once a month, I have been to other conferences and have never had anything like this happen so check your statement. Other people in my group had a similar issue. If you have to go, pay in cash or through Travelocity or some other reputable hotel booking service.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't handle a large group”
Reviews.Author: FloridaEchoman
Reviews.Content: About a thousand cardiologists descended upon Hilton Anatole in May of this year to take an annual certification exam. Check-in was smooth, and the room was adequate. My view was of a parking lot, but since I got a "group discount" rate, no complaints. Dinner in the lobby's Mexican restaurant was very good, but pricey for what was served. The next morning, chaos reigned. My room service breakfast, ordered the night before, never arrived. Multiple calls to room service were never picked up. I spoke with many others who encountered the same problem. This was before a 6-hour intense exam where no food was allowed in the testing room. Since no bags were allowed in the testing room, all of us tried to get bell service, and the lines were long and painful, with the poor bellmen obviously unprepared and stressed. I asked the pleasant young woman at the check-out desk if I could speak with a manager but she told me he was "overwhelmed". I eventually managed to get a very expensive cup of yogurt and a Starbucks coffee at a kiosk in the hotel, but there were some very angry doctors in line. Clearly not the place for your convention, but seemed adequate for an overpriced night in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: zsazsa77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole for 2 nights to sit for an exam there. The property is beautiful & sprawling. The inside of the complex has 3 or 4 courtyards that all the rooms open onto, making the hallways nice & bright. My room was fairly standard with 2 double beds and a desk, hairdryer, coffee maker, bathroom with Crabtree & Evelyn products. The most impressive thing about this place was how big it was - there's a whole 6 or 7 acre landscaped park within the hotel with a running path, a full spa complex and 2 pools. One is located near the front of the hotel, and the other is at the end of the park, and has a swim up bar. There are 4 restaurants within the hotel complex. We ate at 2 (the mexican place and the garden restaurant), both were a little pricey (breakfast buffet $21), but the food was very good. The hotel is about 15 mins away from downtown Dallas. We did regret not renting a car, as taxis are strangely expensive here, costing $15 to get downtown, but i think that is because there was a per person surcharge (there were 4 of us). All in all, it was a good, convenient place to stay for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Assembly Line Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasGirlTravels
Reviews.Content: Instead of going out of town this Memorial Day weekend, we opted to spend one night at a "fancy" hotel with our daughter. After much research, we decided on the Anatole, largely on the basis of the promised "gardens" and swimming pool and the assurance of the four stars. The price -- $120 -- was comparable to other four star hotels in the area. It did not occur to me that the fact that it is a conference hotel mattered. Was I wrong! The poor front desk attendants were clearly instructed not to be too friendly, not to chat, etc., in the effort to move things along. We had to change rooms three times before we were placed in an appropriate one: first there was only one bed, then the room smelled of smoke (in a no-smoking hotel), but finally we got a nice room -- well appointed and comfortable. So off to the pool: imagine a Florida spring break scene at a no-star hotel, except instead of college coeds, we were among overweight, middle-aged cubicle types & mothers shepherding gaggles of children. The soundtrack: a local rock n' roll station. Not bad, but not nice. And the "gardens": lawn & containers with the least expensive flowers imaginable (the equivalent of pansies, but it is May in Texas, so pansies can't stand the heat). All in all, the hotel was dull -- not fun, not exciting, not glamorous. It did not make us feel special -- or make my daughter feel special -- and I can see how it could not: what with 1,500 rooms to fill, empty, clean & maintain, there is no time for personal touches. But there should be enough revenue for decent flowers!

Reviews.Title: “Large Hotel and nice”
Reviews.Author: scarlet798
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference.The hotel is like a city it is so large.The rooms was big ,clean and modern.Food was very good and the fitness room was great.No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Anatole staff gets it!”
Reviews.Author: M3-Racer
Reviews.Content: This place was recently remodeled and looks fantastic. In my 3-day stay I discovered a backlight on one of the elevator buttons was burned out. I was happy to see that because pretty much everything else was so perfect. The entire staff seems trained to make customers feel welcome, and they're very helpful with everything. They made me feel valued, even important. Sheesh. The fitness center came with an $8 usage fee, but it is fabulous - not your typical hotel fare. Annoyance - they still charge for internet service. At many lesser hotels it's free. It's not better service, it just costs. High-end hotels as a group will not be able to get away with this forever... Still, I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Take Your Money Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: AggieGirl02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Anatole from April 30, 2008 through May 4, 2008 for a business conference. This hotel cares much more about conference attendees and parties than its regular guests. Beyond being large and impersonal, this place nickel-and-dimes you. Overnight self-parking costs $15 per night, and you have to pay a fee to use their gym. They do have a nice running track on the property that I used several times. I had a regular king room in the Atrium building. The first two evenings, noise was not a problem because there were not guests staying in the rooms next to mine. However, the second two nights, the noise was awful. I attribute part of it to the incredibly rude people staying next to me, but the walls were also paper-thin. When they returned to their room at 2 or 3 in the morning, I could hear everything they were saying, and it sounded like they were using the TV and/or radio in my room. I finally had to call security the second night, and they did respond promptly, which I appreciated. The bed was fine, but I did not like the pillows. The bathroom was small but nice, and the Crabtree and Evelyn bath products are a plus. If you want to have a party or go to a bar with overpriced drinks, I suggest using this hotel. I enjoy personal service and kind employees at hotels, and I don't feel like I found either here. If you want to have a nice, quiet get-away in Dallas, I suggest staying somewhere else, like the Aldolphus.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Sprawling property, very nice”
Reviews.Author: gvr001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for one night on business. The hotel is located a few miles from the downtown business district of Dallas, and is accessible. Given the resouces on the property, $200/night was certainly a reasonable price to pay for lodging. I was amazed at the size of the property! The lobby has huge ceilings, with elephant scultpures, paintings, and marble flooring, and had the feel of a Vegas casino! It takes several minuts to walk from one end of the hotel to the other. Check in was fast and efficient, and they validated the parking, which was a huge bonus! There are 2 atriums in addition to the Tower, so plenty of rooms to choose from. I stayed in the Atrium, which was fine. Plenty of elevators, 2 sinks in the bathroom, and a nice sized TV. I was somewhat disappointed that the rooms do not have wireless internet, and that there is a charge to use the ethernet connection in the room. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from. I ate in the Sports Bar as well as the breakfast buffet in the Atrium, and both were good, reasonably priced meals. The property has a nice sculpture garden, with a soft running track of 1/4 mile, which I used, which was very nice. I didn't go to the gym, but I believe they charge a fee for using the machines on the property. There are several areas to have a drink and relax. I would certainly consider staying here again on business, and if I ever brought the family to Dallas on vacation, this property would certainly be a consideration.

Reviews.Title: “big”
Reviews.Author: SaminDC
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference, and the hotel is big. It has a Hertz on site and lots of food choices. The Mexican lunch buffet, at about $18/person, was totally not worth it. Nona's was quite good and offered excellent views. It was not too convenient getting to my room, which was about as a far from an elevator as can be- they should have more banks of elevators for the non-tower bldg. The bathroom was really nice, and the room had convenient business amenities like speakerphone.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Anatole”
Reviews.Author: STEVEFR
Reviews.Content: I would agree with most of the other recent reviews. The rooms are large and well decorated and with coffee making facilities. TV did not have a huge choice of channels. Check in and out was extremely fast and efficient. Note this hotel is not downtown or near shops or restaurants areas. There is nothing within walking distance of the hotel, though it is easy to locate on the feeway from airport to downtown. Extremely spacious public areas and nice gardens outside. The Hotel seems to be full with conventions which do sill into the main areas of the hotel due to their size.. Loud and noisy but on the plus side you can pretend to be part of them and get free drinks!! The hotel is surrounded by its parking lots for which you have to pay in my opinion a very high fee that should be included in your room charge. I would prefer a hotel closer to facilities but it still is a quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conference and leisure - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: parrot21
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a conference in April and found the hotel to be very comfortable and plush. It's a huge complex, which provides ample opportunity for things to fail, but we never found that to be the case. The front desk is efficient, quick and accomodating. The maid service was exceptional, the grounds are immaculate and the general cleanliness flawless. The spa is currently under renovation, so there is construction surrounding the area. I never found that to be much of an issue, with the exception of the indoor pool being out of circulation. The gym facilities are wonderful - many, many cardio pieces and more than enough weight machines and free weights. The pool area is large enough to handle a good crowd (although we were here in April, so things may change during the summer months). There was no bar service at the pool, but again, off season. When I arrived at the pool, there were no beach towels, so I contacted the adjacent spa desk clerk and within 10 mins. there were plenty of towels for the other guests. We ate in all of the restaurants on site, because you are located a cab's drive from any other dining locations. At each location, the food was very good. My only complaint would be that due to the large conference volume, mid-day was slow on at least two occasions - it was difficult to get something to eat and back to your meeting within an hour. We dined at the top of the hotel at Nana's gourmet restaurant and found the service to be impeccable, the food exquisite and the view is marvelous. If you get the chance, fit that into your schedule. As another reviewer noted, the elevator bells ARE annoying. As soon as the morning rush starts, you hear them constantly. I'm sure they could be toned down. The elevators are very quick though. All in all, I would not hesitate to stay here again. A good example of Hilton service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Snappyinchi
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Anatole is really amazing. Beautifully renovated, deluxe finishes everywhere. Rooms are large and well appointed. Huge walk in showers and in room safes. Beautiful outdoor spaces as well. If you are driving assume you will be staying and park near tower entrance to avoid having to walk through entire hotel. Complaints? Elevator DING DING can be heard in room, and in ceiling light in bathroom is slightly annoying. I would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “At first I thought, oh no, but ...”
Reviews.Author: JosephineB
Reviews.Content: When I arrived and realized that there was nothing in this area except the hotel and I was at a 7 day conference.. depression. But I actually enjoyed the experience. The Anatole works as a "destination" hotel. Size is a plus. The room was large; the public spaces are large. Lots of walking around space. The sculpture garden is attractive and has a running track. A few times around and you have a mile in not much time. The variety of restaurants is acceptable and the food is above average. Try the Gossip Bar in the Tower for a quick breakfast of pastry and coffee. It's away from the main areas and people forget it. The Terrace is a steakhouse in the evening and, well, this IS Texas. For some pleasant downtime, try the outside patio near the sculpture garden for a cozy chair and if it's chilly, there are overhead heaters. The public areas are filled with asian sculptures and vases which are stunningly beautiful. The staff is Texas-friendly and seem to work hard to make your stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A City Within In A City”
Reviews.Author: snowmaninsnowcountry
Reviews.Content: I was at this property the other week on a business trip and in a few words it is..... very large, and interconnected "A City within A City" Room was very good and well equipped, with all of the Hilton extras you come to expect. Customer service was very good by the staff, and always willing to assist in any manner when asked for anything. The Hilton is a convention mecca as there were several meetings and different groups present every night that I was there, and the crowds do not appear to fill the place up. The design and layout handles the huge crowds, so there is never a crowded feeling any time. I had dinner in the Terrace one night and found the food quality fair compared to what I have experienced in Italian dishes in the areas of Pasta. Prices were somewhat higher compared to other comparable restaraunts and what I disliked is that everything is Alacarte. The Mexican restaraunt is excellent, and offers good value and quality. Internet service is quite expensive, with the $7.50 connection and then .50 per minute with a guaranteed 15 minutes required. But when you need it, they have you........ Concierge service excellent and alway's ready to assist your needs of the moment. Overall I would stay here again and it is defintely a convention mecca and business persons paradise. It would also be a good getaway for a weekend for you and that someone special, that is looking for the different kind and somewhat elegant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “This is a big place...”
Reviews.Author: Taz-n-Figment
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed this past Friday night in a corner room in the tower. We have stayed here many times over the last 2 years. The corner rooms are much larger than the standard rooms. The extra space contains an oversized sitting area with 1 chair & couch w/pull out queen-size bed that was very comfortable for 2 kids (under 10 years old). The views out the window were fantastic (rooms ending in -66 are on the SE corner). All the rooms in the tower are recently refurbished (within the last 12 months), and are styled, not overpoweringly, in a distinctly Asian theme. The tower rooms feature tiled, glassed in showers and flat screen televisions. The kids were upset that we couldn't plug in the playstation or dvd player (there is a sticker of RCA inputs on the tv, but no actual inputs). In the "Atrium" building, there is an indoor pool for the kids & adults that works well in the winter. There is another indoor pool near the gym which is in a separte building out back. The outdoor pool is back there as well, on the other side of the garden area. The gym is pretty well stocked, almost like a mini health club. It has lots of cardio machines, and quite a few weight machines with free weights as well (although the weights and weight equipment look 20 years old). The atrium side of the hotel tends to be louder as all the rooms open to the atrium. The tower rooms are limited to the noise on your floor (which has never been a problem for us). You'll also walk further to your car once you exit the hotel (versus a room in the tower). There's alot of Chinese artwork throughout the hotel (the kids love the two large elephants outside the meeting rooms near the tower). There is a nice walking area around the garden out back that ends at a koi pond. A strong negatives is the parking situation. The hotel charges for it and it seems like you never know which lot you'll get as they have conventions frequently that take up a lot of space in a very short period of time. Another negative is there is nothing to see within walking distance other than market hall (which is empty unless there is a show/festival going on). The hotel is roughly 30 minutes from DFW airport and about 15 minutes from Love Field. It sits on the west side of Interstate 35, about 5 minutes drive from downtown Dallas. All in all, it is a nice place that offers alot on its expansive premises.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Monaco98
Reviews.Content: The other reviews here are pretty much correct: - This sprawling complex is HUGE-really more like several interconnected hotels in one. - It is not downtown, and at least 30 mins from the airport. You will need a car/taxi to go anywhere. - While there is (I'm sure very purposely) no reason to leave the complex if you don't want to, you should, if only to see the 6th Floor Museum / Dealy Plaza, the Dallas Art Museaum, a good steak house, etc. - Not cheap if you are not expensing everything: $5.75 for a Shiner Bock at the bar. - Elevators and cleaning staff are loud--ask for a corner room if possible. - Was told by friends that the adjascent Hilton Garden Inn was "nice" and "much quieter". - the heated patio and outdoor sculpture garden / jogging track were a nice added feature.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel , great service”
Reviews.Author: kaybabee
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, from the minute I checked in until the minute I checked out. I went to a convention and everything was great. The staff was great, very nice, asked me if I was doing ok, very polite. The room was nice, the desk chair was wonderful, the Herman Miller ones. The breakfast buffet was great also. Overall I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms are very nice..”
Reviews.Author: DavidandAngela
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in Dallas but stayed two nights while attending a ball. We stayed in The Tower (be sure to ask for it) which has been completely updated and renovated. The bed, room, desk and lighting in the room was very nice. The bathroom, though brand new, is still small but okay. Towels were fresh and excellent. Good hair dryer and a magnifying mirror, mouthwash, and the usual other extras. The shower curtain was on a curved shower rod which we like. The elevators were very quick with very little wait even during busy times. It was an easy walk to most areas of the hotel and The Verandah Club, the $15 extra health club facility. A bottle of water out of the mini bar was just $1.75 (reasonable by big hotel standards) and the coffee brewer was one of those "by the cup" machines. We liked it very much. There is a "Starbucks"-like set up in the hotel's bar area at the bottom of the elevators that was quite reasonable! A BIG cherry danish served on a plastic plate with plasticware was $2.50. I brought my free hot tea from my room and had a nice quick "breakfast" in their bar that is in open area of the lobby. The HVAC worked splendidly, water pressure and hot water were great, and morning newspapers were welcomed. Yes, the doors are heavy and slam loudly so be careful. That said, we never heard anyone in the hallways or other doors slamming. Nice. We had dinner in The Terrace Restaurant. There were only 4 tables full the entire time we were there. The problem with that is that waiters are LESS attentive when there are fewer people dining. My wife's side dish was completely forgotten and came out after having to hunt down the waiter and ask for it. To their credit, they did not charge us for it. All in all a good meal that was prepared fairly well. We tried to use the main hotel pool but it was closed due to chemical treatments. We insisted on being comp'd into The Verandah Club which was only "okay". There was an "out of order sink" in the men's locker room, rusting drain troughs in the pool and yucky tile in the yucky jacuzzi area. In the summer it is probably much nicer, but on a February morning it was not very pretty. The Anatole has added a "Charge per day" parking lot in the last couple of years so be aware. Their valets were cheerful and efficient as were their check in people. There is a Denny's across the street within walking distance for those who want to eat a little cheaper. That said, the quickie food in the main open atrium area is reasonable for breakfast, but a bit expensive (like most hotels) for lunch. We prefer smaller hotels but, overall, this was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Suomessa
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Dallas, and always used to think it would be fun to stay at the Anatole. I got my chance last week, and having booked for 2 nights, left after the first. It wasn't terrible but it was a bit devoid of atmosphere. This is partly due to the location, hard up against 14 lanes of traffic in a slightly dodgy part of town and partly because of the hotel's sheer size. Maybe it would have been better if I had been part of one of the conferences, but it seemed like a lonely place. I might have been put off by the surrounds though, which were gloomy. If you stay on the executive levels (about floor 24), you need to go down to the ground floor to catch the (one) elevator up to the 28th floor. It's a large hotel, so it takes forever to get all the way down and then up again. Those rooms seemed to have been recently renovated - quite reasonable looking and very large - although they did smell of paint as of early Feb 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm...be careful!”
Reviews.Author: Barnacle420
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler and a Hilton Diamond VIP. It seems to me that this hotel's primary function is to extract as much money as they possibly can from their convention customers. To be fair, the room was fairly large for a standard room, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was small. The closing and slamming of the doors by guests and housekeeping was extremely LOUD!!! Self-parking at the Anatole is $15 a day. There isn't another hotel in the immediate area that charges for parking. When I brought up the parking charge the desk clerk gave me a "free" pass for the week. When I left the parking lot for the first time and was asked for my room number, I asked if I was going to be charged. I was told that I would not be charged all week as long as I had the pass. When I got home and looked at my bill I found out that I had been charged parking for each and every day! Executive Lounges at most Hiltons are where Hilton VIP's get free appetizers and free drinks. To get to this lounge you have to use a specific elevator and press AND HOLD IN the button on the side of the frame. Of course, no one told me that when I checked in! The ONE beer that I thought was going to be free was $5.75! When I tried to pay cash I was told that I had to use a credit card or charge it to my room! They wouldn't take cash! Also, the appetizers were very cheap for a hotel of this size and supposed stature. They also charge for the exercise facility. Surprise, another $15 per day! I got it "free" because I am a Diamond VIP! They gave me something free that most hotels do not charge a dime for! I ate at the Mexican restaurant at the hotel. My enchilada was cold and my bottle of beer was $6.25! I guess the $5.75 that I paid in the Executive Lounge was a discount! If you stay at the Anatole, make sure that you know what you are getting and not getting. Watch your bill each and every day! I expect more from Hilton, and usually get it. Not at the Anatole...

Reviews.Title: “Jessee at the Front Desk was very focused on Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: patriciaforesta
Reviews.Content: Jessee at the Front Desk was very focused on Customer Service! Great Job , Great Room -Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwadnelson
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Anatole was recomended to me while searching for a hotel to stay while we were in Dallas. The staff was friendly, and would go out of their way to please the guests, and they were completely booked during our stay due to the Cotton Bowl. The room was really clean, and didn't have that weird hotel smell. It was comfortable place to stay. The only complaint that I have was out of the six places to eat in the hotel, all of the them were reserved for the Missouri Tigers. Luckily, my inlaws live in Dallas, and they picked us up to take us to dinner. We plan on going back to the Hilton Anatole this May during our next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Does Paris manage this one?”
Reviews.Author: CJ B
Reviews.Content: Wow, this could be a great hotel. The problems were many, so many in fact it was comical! After stressing with the lost reservations and wrong room assignments I decided to start laughing at the whole situation. I think I spent a total of 16hrs on the phone before and during our stay just to work out small issues. After the initial errors, we were turned away from the executive club (which we paid for) and the health club (which we paid for). I wondered if this was just the holiday from beyond. We finally worked out all of the problems and went on to enjoy the Stars hockey game. Same problems next day. We received may apologies, but nothing else. The bill arrived on our last day and we were charged for valet parking two cars. Funny, we only drove one. If you plan to stay at the Anatole, make sure you double check your reservations before you leave home. Talk to a manager and document everything, including names of people that make you promises. Also, plan on spending lots of time on the phone to fix the problems they make. Too bad it is so poorly managed. It could have been a great hotel. We ended up laughing at the entire situation and making it a good weekend. Hockey - great! Galleria - great! Traffic - not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: porscheturbo
Reviews.Content: Was there for 4 nights for a conference. Hotel was undergoing renovation but disruption was minimal. However, power was out one morning for about 15 minutes. Also, the fire alarm went off at 4:00 AM and this was very disruptive. Staff is ok and the rooms are pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelingfamily5
Reviews.Content: Booked with a nearby convention. Beautiful lobby and grounds, large beautiful room (3rd floor corner room), great restaurants and bars, quiet despite large crowds, plentiful staff who were helpful and friendly, cab service available, easy access to tollroad to Galleria, convenient parking. Not perfect - couldn't get king bed, a/c in room didn't cool very well (a friend on the 7th floor said she froze), expensive food, no maid service (did immediately bring up clean towels when requested). Overall a great experience - I've never stayed at a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly poor for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ugobananas
Reviews.Content: The decor of the hotel was interesting, but seemed sparse. The brick walls took away from the oriental feel that it seemed to be going for. Bedrooms were average, but I'm not used to a nice hotel like this having full sized beds instead of queens in their double rooms - my husband and I are both tall people and we were pretty cramped in our bed. Bedding was comfortable. Mini fridge charges you automatically for items if they are removed for more than 3 seconds, which we didn't find out until the next day after we had spent some time looking at some of them. We were charged for a few things we didn't use. Rather annoying. No fan in the bathroom - ? Had to wait a long time for mirror to unfog. They accidentally had as set to check out a day earlier than we had reserved the room, even though we had confirmed reservations a few days before we arrived. Thankfully this was taken care of without a major hassle. The elevators had some serious issues - sometimes you'd have to press the button several times for one to come, and some of the doors wouldn't close until you pressed "close door" - which you didn't realize until the annoying buzzing started. Also, one time, we pressed "down" and an elevator arrived with the down arrow lit. We stepped in, pressed our floor (one - and no other buttons had been pressed) but the elevator went up to the 7th floor, where no one was waiting, and THEN went to the first floor. Strange. Another time, one of the people we were traveling with said he had to take the stairs because the elevators were not working at all. The staff were average, didn't seem terribly friendly but weren't rude, either. Location was pretty bad - the only place to eat, within walking distance, was a Denny's - otherwise you had to eat at the hotel restaurants, which were overly priced and had mediocre food. Also, only a few blocks from a pretty bad area of town - all the windows of the rundown shops are barred up, etc. There are better hotels to choose from in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing serivce and product, would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Service-101
Reviews.Content: Stayed for (5) days with a company meeting and was dissapointed on all sides. It began with changing rooms three times for various problems. The tower rooms are old, run down, and falling apart. Carpet was dirty and everything smelled old and was worn out. Immediately asked to be relocated, and was placed in the Atrium Tower. Room had such bad connecting doors, could here a conversation as if door wasn't there. Again asked to be moved, and each time I asked for help, I was told to come to the front desk before anything could be done, never offered to help or address the issue. The food as one of the greatest disappointments, would not eat at the hotel again. Lastly, the service all around was rude and short tempered. From the front desk who really did not care to help a guest in need to serving staff in the dinning establishments, to the gift shop rep, who offered to charge to the room, then said it was a complete hassle and could take 10 minutes. Ended up taking 30 seconds but was too hard for him to do without complaining. All around, will not be staying with this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: FPBlues
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel on 8/16/07 for a convention and check-in was very smooth. We were given a room on the 12th floor and be forewarned when you get out of the elevator it is like a sauna. Our room was not cool at all, so we cranked the A/C down and went out for dinner. Upon returning the room still wasn't very cool, but we thought it was just slow to cool. Bottom line, we were miserably hot by morning and while they did send a repairman, it never got cool and we had to beg to be moved to another room for the remaining two nights of our stay. Spent most of the second day waiting for another room to be "ready" for us. We had asked to be moved by 9:00 am and did not get into another room until 5:30 pm! All we got was a $60.00 reduction on our bill! On top of this, the bathrooms are only big enough for one person at a time and the commode wasn't working properly either. Advice: ask for a room in the newly renovated tower because the rooms in the smaller atrium building obviously have not been renovated. The public areas of the hotel are really beautiful and sculpture is gorgeous. Verandah Spa workout facility is amazing and they do have a really nice 1/4 mile jogging track, but these are the only positives I have for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay to me”
Reviews.Author: tcancienne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole in July 2007 for 3 nights. I attended a conference there, and was busy with it most of my visit, so I did not leave the hotel during the three days. Check in was okay, no real problems, but staff is not overly accomodating. Very dry, no smiles, just like robots, not rude, but not friendly either. I was sharing a room with 3 other adults, and we were quite cramped. Beds are doubles, not queens, so it is small for two adults. Hotel is huge, with lots of restaurants, shops, nice atrium, etc. Our meals were catered by hotel, and all were done very nicely. Food was presented well, was delicious, and service was good. I did not eat in the restaurants outside of catered events. It was very expensive. If you stay here and want to enjoy the amenities of the hotel, bring your good comfortable walking shoes. It is a hike from one area to another. Overall, it was okay for the convention, but I would not choose to stay here otherwise, on my own. Business center is available, but very expensive to use. This hotel caters to large events and conventions, and does a great job at it.

Reviews.Title: “One annoying problem”
Reviews.Author: Brea_CABookworm
Reviews.Content: Staff- I've stayed at hotels with decent staff, these staff were the best. Halls very hot but there was air condition in room. A must-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Parking 15 bucks in a hay field??”
Reviews.Author: bigbaldjohnny
Reviews.Content: The Anatole is something, thats true. It stands out. Pros: Nice HHonors room and lounge with a great view of downtown Dallas. Nice size marble counter bathroom. Cons: Aging, cracked paint, decor in the common areas was sparse and eclectic. The desk phone didn't work but who cares in the days of the iPhone. They roasted me on the cost of parking - I'm sure there are better values in the area including the Renaissance and Sheraton Suites

Reviews.Title: “quality hotel for business meeting with museum quality art collection”
Reviews.Author: onoman
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for the first time. Found the experience to very good. Check in is a breeze, room was very nice, bathroom a little cramped-- sufficient. Food was very good. Tried the gym, lots of equipment, indoor and outdoor pools, indoor and out door track and tennis courts. Meeting facilities were great. Also several shops for some souvenir shopping. Like most hotels in Dallas it is pretty spread out and there is some walking involved getting from meeting rooms and hotel room. What was really surprising was the amount and quality of the Asian art located around the hotel. Found out that it is part of an extensive private art collection by the people who own the property. Don't miss the amazing jade horses in the Nana Restaurant on the 27th floor. Would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: samsela
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. I was in Dallas on business and reluctantly booked the Anatole (after previous negative experience with a reservation not honored). I arrived at 11AM and they did not have a room available, so we checked our bags and they told us that as soon as our requested room was available, (king bed no smoking) they would put it aside for us. So we went to work and returned to the hotel in the evening. There was no room set aside for us and we were told we got the last available room. However, we were put in a smoking room on a smoking floor and were told there were no other choices because they were sold out. The managers refused to meet with us or speak with us. We spent FIVE nights in the most rancid smoke infested room. When I got home and unpacked everything I own, including the suitcase was smoke infested. I also received zero satisfaction from "customer service" after my stay, they do not care.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel--Good All Around”
Reviews.Author: kiddogo
Reviews.Content: I have been frequenting Dallas on business recently and have stayed here three times over the past two months. Have previously stayed at the Magnolia (the place is needs new leadership and a face lift) and the Embassey in Addison (OK for business). The Anatole is massive with two buildings and another separate fitness club building. I am Hiton Diamond but tend to be frank. The rooms I have stayed in were all upgrades including two suites. Rooms have been massive, clean and consistent with my Hilton experiences. Bathrooms are small but all functional. Executive lounge is a misnomer. Bars are well stocked and there are plenty of them. Ate one night at Nana's and if you are on a corporate expense account, go for it. If not, ask the concierge for help. Good solid place to stay just outside the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with Caution”
Reviews.Author: RichieRichPhilly
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 3/2-3/4 in the tower and it was one if not the worst hotel room experience I ever had. I asked for a kingsize room and was given a room with two at most full size beds. I was on hold for room service for 13 minutes only to be told that it would be 50 minutes to get the food. The room and bathroom both had wallpaper peeling off. The bathtub was PLASTIC and the bottom slippery and dangerous. The toliet took two flushes each time to work. The food was fair and the service was ok. I have stayed in everything at meetings from Red Roof Inn's and AmericaSuites to Westins, Ritz's and Mandarin Orientals. I can only descirbe the room with one word GROSS. I called asking for a change of room to the type I asked and was told that I probably would not do better because this room was special and on the Executive Lounge Floor. Wow, I felt so touched and honored! I absolutely would not get anywhere near that hotel ever again. I just wanted a room with normal amenities, a bathtub that was not PLASTIC and beds that were the size I had been promised when i made the reservations. Proceed with caution!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, large, needs some room updating”
Reviews.Author: travelmutt1
Reviews.Content: Guest rooms could use a little overhaul. Beds were comfortable, but some areas of room/ bathroom were a little shabby. Room was a decent size with nice double-sink vanity area in bath. Hotel is very large. Service was good by all staff. Friendly. Good food at several of the bar/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: travelerNSD
Reviews.Content: I'm an Hilton Honor's Diamond VIP as well as a Marriott Platinum member, so I've stayed in my fair share of hotels. The ONLY saving grace for this hotel is that I had free usage of the racketball courts next door at the Verandah Club and Spa, but this was only due to my status. Checkin at the tower was quite lengthy, especially when half the people in line were returning with card keys not working (some had mentioned that they had to return up to 5 times!). The first night I was put in a room on the 26th floor of the Executive Tower, but in a room that had two doors to connecting rooms, which I dislike and which became very apparent why at around 1am in the morning. Suffice it to say, there was a travel agent convention at the hotel and they had a Las Vegas night, the woman next door obviously had too much to drink and took the Vegas slogan of "What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas" to heart and applied it to Dallas. Let's just say that she "met" someone at the convention and the connectng door was so thin I thought I had an adult movie playing on the television. The first thing in the morning I requested a new room and requested that they get me a new room and move my suitcase and 2 shirts in the closet, when I returned that evening I found that my request wasn't followed and I had to move my own things. Instead of giving me a key to the new room and let me move my things right then, I had to go retrieve my luggage, drag it all back down to the registration desk, wait in line again, get the new room key, then drag my belongings up to my new room. Then I find out that my room preferences on my Hilton Honor profile (non-smoking room, high floor, away from elevator, king size bed) were completely ignored and I was placed in a room next to the elevator on the 4th floor with double beds. The only saving grace about the double beds and pillows was that they were much more comfortable than the King size bed on the Executive floor. The internet was sub-par, keep in mind that I utilize the high speed access in hotel rooms as part of my job, the first night it took at least an hour to successfully go through the charge screens (yes, they charge Diamond members) and connect to the internet. And unlike all other hotels that I stay at, there were no directions available regarding the outgoing smtp server to be used for the mail client. Forget the support number they give you, I called and asked specifically for the outgoing server and either they didn't know what it was or they refused to give it to me. Oh yes, if you should have access to the Executive Lounge and are not on the upper executive floors, you have to request access to the Executive Lounge, it's not a given. If this is the treatment they give a Hilton Honors Diamond VIP member, I would not want to be a guest with a lower status. Both the hotel rooms and Verandah Club are very tired and need a major refurbishing. I would not recommend this hotel to the casual nor business traveler. As with mentioned by another poster, it appears that the Hilton Garden Inn next door is newer and probably not as tired. For Marriott members, there is a Renaissance close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: rporter8555
Reviews.Content: My company booked about 50 rooms for a trade show in town and held meetings in the hotel. I stayed there five nights and enjoyed my stay very much. The hotel is large and luxuriously comfortable. The bed is as good or better than Westin's. The pool and hot tub was great. The staff was eager to please, the bell captains and bell hops were prompt and courteous, the wait-staff in the Terrace and La Esquina restaurants were very good. The service and set up in the 27th Floor Honeysuckle and Rambling Rose rooms was awesome with a very nice custom-made ice sculpture and buffet service (great shrimp!). When I set up for a presentation in the Emerald Room, the hotel technical support team went above and beyond the call of duty in helping me set up my projector with their screen and their sound system. The only mishap of the week was on check-in when the desk wrote the wrong room number on my key slip, which caused delays in delivery of my luggage and presentation materials to my room. Fortunately, the bell captain took care of my things and all was well. The only improvement I could suggest would be that they hire a few more bell hops. If you are in a hurry, plan ahead or expect to wait a while for luggage pickup.

Reviews.Title: “Unplesant situation”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoBistraveler
Reviews.Content: I woke up to a gurgling noise in my bathroom in room 679. When I went in there the sink was filled with water containing fecal matter. The vanity sink also took an hour to drain. I had this problem before in another room I think this hotel has an inherent drainage problem When I went to the front desk to get moved to another room the clerk did not take any notes of my problem...i'm guessing they just re-rented the room

Reviews.Title: “loved the hilton anatole”
Reviews.Author: cchambers97
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Anatole was a great place to stay, even though I live in Dallas just a great place to get away and relax. It all started with the great rate of the room which was the reason I booked this hotel. The hospitality staff was excellent from the point of arrival to departure, the food and parking was expensive typical of nicer hotels anyway. My overall experience at the Hilton Anatole was great and I would recommend this hotel to others if traveling to the Dallas/Downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, But Very Lightly Staffed”
Reviews.Author: 2BAnonymous
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent one night at the Hilton Anatole following an event. Our stay was neither particularly good, nor particularly bad. It was just kind of flavorless... The hotel is HUGE. So huge, in fact, that there are two separate buildings. I would recommend not parking your car until you check in to determine which one you are in so that you can park accordingly (self park at $15/night is not what I would call cheap, either). But what I found most surprising is that for such a huge hotel, there is virtually no staff. There were a few valet guys lurking out front, but other than that, it was pretty much desk staff only. As we headed to the elevator, I overhead someone asking for the concierge only to be informed that "the desk is not always staffed." And this is a Hilton? Hmmm. Our room was on the big side. The furnishings were pretty standard - a desk, a couch and coffee table. The bed, however, was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept on in a long while. The pillows were exquisite. The A/C was a little wonky as it was either stuffy or frigid. There was not really an in between temperature. In keeping with the theme of no staffing, there was only one desk personnel for checkout. On a Sunday morning, nonetheless. Are you kidding me...? After waiting in line for 10 minutes, I gave up and returned to the room to do the expedited phone checkout. Turns out this was the wrong decision. Our $3.00 of mini-bar purchases were charged as $10.78 to my credit card. Looks like I will be calling the hotel to sort it out. So in total, the Anatole is a good value for (near) downtown Dallas, but do not expect the level of service a hotel of this caliber should deliver. If you keep your expectations low, you will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Anatole Needs Some A.C.”
Reviews.Author: wdharrington
Reviews.Content: This used to be a really nice hotel, but it has slid recently. The rooms are still decent, but the air conditioning is brutal.The hotel's staff said there is nothing they could do about it. The beds are fine, the bathroom is great, the television sets could use an upgrade. Charging for outdoor parking is a new one on me too. All the other hotels in the area do not charge for parking, so why should the Anatole, especially when its outside. This is no longer a four star hotel as I've stayed at three star hotels who put this property to shame. Definitely not worth the money they're charging.

Reviews.Title: “Weak excuse for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: HiltonHonor20YR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically a large ship without a rudder. Due to my companies policy's I've stayed at this hotel many times since it was converted from a Westin (I think) and each time is a challenging experience. I'm a Diamond member and every time I check in I have to tell them my number at the front desk. My issues have been everything from no internet connectivity, internet is free one week and according to the front desk not the next, the TV cable box did not work, loud banging doors around my room, the front desk staff forgot to give me my conceirge card, my room key would not open the parking lot gates. One week I couldn't even enter the parking lot due to the gate not working. My advice; pay a few bucks more and stay somewhere else or go next door to the Hilton Garden Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton experience ever”
Reviews.Author: HPK
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller and former Hilton Diamond member so I've seen lots of their properties. This was about as bad an expereience as I have had in 20 years of travelling. This large, noisy, convention hotel could not get anything right during my stay. The free internet service in my room did not work but I somehow got charged $10/day for it anyway, the drain in the shower was clogged, and bathroom lights didn't work. Finding a concierge to get directions to a local restaurant was a major task and when I found him, he was too busy to help me so I ended up using his pc to locate the restaurant on the internet (at least his network connection worked), and printing the directions myself. The employees were pleasant enough to deal with when I talked to them but didn't seem to have a clue about customer service. The manager gave me a gift certificate for a free night's stay if/when I come back to Dallas. I think I'll give it away to someone I don't like much....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Anatole”
Reviews.Author: Gurnip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights 1st & 2nd July. The hotel is large, and has plenty of facilities. The only small snag was that after a 10 hour flight from the UK, there was a huge queue at check-in, (a blind convention). Asked concierge if there was an executive lounge that we could check-in - but apparently not - the hotel has only just been acquired from Wyndham. Adjourned to one of the bars and after an hour and a couple or three martini's the of queue had all but gone. Was upgraded to a junior suite - always a nice touch, room was in good condition with all usual Hilton amenities. Restaurant - (24th floor?), is v.good, gym is excellent and the room rate was okay $110 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Tried it twice, never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As you're reading this, please keep in mind I'm writing this review from a business traveler perspective. Things that annoy me as a business traveler aren't necessarily the same things that I care about when on vacation. Let's see, where do I begin. I've stayed here twice for business. Once they put me in the executive tower; once in the atrium tower. Poor service at the front desk both times. Check out service was poor (I still haven't received my honors points for one stay; plus I had to call 3 times to get a copy of my bill). They don't put your bill under the door as they do in just about every other Hilton property I've stayed in. I travel a lot for work and always try to stay at a Hilton property. Because of my work travels, I have reached Hilton Diamond status. I don't expect special treatment because of my Diamond "status" but you'd think I'd at least get a friendly front desk clerk or a helpful attitude. I don't think anyone, regardless of their HHonors membership, gets decent service here. I had to ask for a pass to the executive lounge both times. One stay they gave me free internet access for being a HHonors member (without me asking for it); the next stay the front desk person argued with me that she's never heard of such a thing. The front desk guy didn't know where the exec lounge was located or what the hours were. Unfortunately, this is probably a beautiful property but I was so frustrated with my check-in BOTH TIMES that I failed to notice anything else. I thought for sure that my first experience was an isolated situation and gave the hotel a second chance, but I was wrong. One other thing (not the hotel's fault)....both times I was there, I needed a cab to downtown (not far, about 10-15 minute drive). Both times, the taxi drivers were annoyed to pick up a fare for such a short drive. Sorry if this review sounds overly negative, but as a business traveler, I won't stay here again. The Park Cities Hilton in Dallas has much better service and I will go back there again. Hilton recently purchased the Anatole so maybe they're just going through growing pains. I just didn't feel the usual Hilton service here. One positive note, the exec lounge had really good happy hour food and the guy that works there was very nice and attentive. They should put that guy on the front desk. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lako
Reviews.Content: This hotel has large,open spaces inside. We never felt crowded. Service was fine, nd the room was nice, but there was only a small airconditioning vent and we could not get it to cool down properly. We were on the 18th floor, and the whole floor seemed stuffy. We ate at Nana's, a five star restaurant. The food was presented beautifully,and was very good, though the staff was not very attentive and the music was piped in. The many shops inside the Atrium had a good selection. I really hated paying $15 per day to park myself, or $24 for them to park you.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel had nice grounds, and some nice art. What I had a problem with was the rooms had thin walls. I was given a room with connecting doors, when i went down and asked for an alternate room without connecting doors, I was told that 90 percent of the hotel had connecting doors. Well I think that only added to the noise problem. Our neighbor's phone rang and we could here his conversation, and the toilets flushing. I would not recommend this if you want a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Anatole May 4-7 of 2006. My experience while staying at this hotel was so bad, that I vow never to return to Dallas again. First, the staff at the check-ins were quite rude and unaccommodating. I checked-in at the correct time (3:00), and was told they were out of rooms with two beds already. I was also told at this time, that they can guarantee you get a room, but not necessarily the room you booked. (and I'm a Hilton Honors member!) Not even a King sized bed, so you'd better be pretty chummy with your roommate. I guess it's true that everything is bigger in Texas. This is a monstrously large hotel catering to conventions, where the staff acts like they are doing you a favor by just existing. It is so very large that walking from one end to the other is extremely tiring, especially if you are staying on one end and all of your meetings are closer to the other. The pool my roommate tried was dirty and crowded. The food was OK. But the worst part of the entire trip was that we had a room in the Towers, and this room had one window that looked onto a hallway! Needless to say, the room was very dark and depressing. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel -- could have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights.It was a pleasent stay however one expects free parking etc during the stay which was not the case.The room swipe card never worked on the parking barrier.Coffee maker could have been placed better, rather then next to the toilet. Iqbal Khan.

Reviews.Title: “uncaring front desk”
Reviews.Author: peter5364
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights at the Anatole (April 21-23). Booked a junior suite in the tower. Asked for a non-smoking room and was put on the 9th floor (non-smoking). The room however reeked of cig. smoke. I immediately informed the front desk of this. The woman at the front desk was both incredulous and non-caring. She first told me that it could not have been cigarette smoke as I was on a non-smoking floor. She seemed perturbed to be interrupted from talking with her co-workers. When I persisted she said that there was nothing that could be done as there were no other rooms available. After more complaints from me, she agreed to have someone send up an air purifier. Both maintenance staff, housekeeping and room service folks agreed that this was a terrible smell. Needless to say the smell did not go away during my stay.. When I checked out and raised this complaint I was told that because somehow this floor is close to a smoking floor, that this has happened before. Further, he did not even offer an apology for this (his name was Ken). The hotel is nice; beautiful grounds and nice rooms (besides the odor). But., what struck me the most was the great indifference to my problem by the folks at the front desk. told me that I was out of luck -- that there were no other comparable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice Nana”
Reviews.Author: CATrvl08
Reviews.Content: Valet parking and check in were quick. A convention was in the hotel so there was a line to use the elevators, but when they went through the line and pulled out all non-convention guests, it wasn't a long wait at all. The room was clean and pleasant, our view was the Dallas skyline and courtyard, very nice. The bedding has been upgraded, nice down comforter and plenty of pillows. The mini bar was locked and the key was not provided, which was the only problem we encountered. Dinner at Nana was fabulous, although the service seemed somewhat snobby. The wine steward was pleasant and had an extensive knowledge of reds. I probably wouldn't return for dinner considering there are many other places in Dallas to receive top notch service when you are spending $100 a plate. Overall a very pleasant stay, I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay, but it ended up free!”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoWanders
Reviews.Content: I had an awful stay at this hotel filled with many problems, but the management was helpful on check-out and gave me the nightly stays (2) free. My first room was musty, the a/c did not work, no windows - AWFUL!!! The second room was much better but overlooked a concert stage for a Microsoft event that went very late into the night with a country band blaring. I thought no windows was bad, but with this band that might have been a blessing. My room key on the second room never worked and I had to call security to let me into the room each time I returned - awful! The hotel was huge and full - I had to wait for everything longer than is acceptable (15 people in line at most services). There were 3 special events in the lobby, bar and restaurant areas on Saturday night - crazy! The parking was ~$14 and was too far and unavailable the second night. I WOULD DEFINITELY PAY LESS NEXT TIME AND STAY AT THE NEW HILTON GARDEN INN NEXT DOOR!!! My coworker stayed there and I saw her room - it was very nice and included free parking, high-speed internet, a complimentary business center, hot cookies and free parking. A much nicer and newer hotel.
